listCustomEquipment.name: Extract of Anguish (Greater)
listCustomEquipment.traits: Rare, Alchemical, Consumable, Elixir, Mutagen, Polymorph
listCustomEquipment.description:
Your body begins to rapidly and painfully optimize, improving itself at the cost of everything else. This mutagen can be imbued, or thrown at a willing creature within 20 feet as an Interact action. Due to their highly unstable nature, extracts of anguish can only be created through advanced alchemy or quick alchemy.

Benefit If you have the fleshwarp trait, you gain the listed item bonus to attack rolls, AC, checks, and saving throws for one minute. At any point you can use a two-action activity with the concentrate trait to force your fleshwarp biology to counteract the effects, immediately ending the mutagen.

Drawback Your body overclocking causes an increasing physical toll. Each turn you are affected by the mutagen increases your drained condition by 1. If you don’t have the fleshwarp trait, you instead suffer 2d6 persistent acid damage and are fatigued until you rest for 10 or more minutes, but have no other effects.

The item bonus is +3.

listCustomEquipment.name: Extract of Anguish (Lesser)
listCustomEquipment.traits: Rare, Alchemical, Consumable, Elixir, Mutagen, Polymorph
listCustomEquipment.description:
Your body begins to rapidly and painfully optimize, improving itself at the cost of everything else. This mutagen can be imbued, or thrown at a willing creature within 20 feet as an Interact action. Due to their highly unstable nature, extracts of anguish can only be created through advanced alchemy or quick alchemy.

Benefit If you have the fleshwarp trait, you gain the listed item bonus to attack rolls, AC, checks, and saving throws for one minute. At any point you can use a two-action activity with the concentrate trait to force your fleshwarp biology to counteract the effects, immediately ending the mutagen.

Drawback Your body overclocking causes an increasing physical toll. Each turn you are affected by the mutagen increases your drained condition by 1. If you don’t have the fleshwarp trait, you instead suffer 2d6 persistent acid damage and are fatigued until you rest for 10 or more minutes, but have no other effects.

The item bonus is +2.

listCustomEquipment.name: Extract of Anguish (Major)
listCustomEquipment.traits: Rare, Alchemical, Consumable, Elixir, Mutagen, Polymorph
listCustomEquipment.description:
Your body begins to rapidly and painfully optimize, improving itself at the cost of everything else. This mutagen can be imbued, or thrown at a willing creature within 20 feet as an Interact action. Due to their highly unstable nature, extracts of anguish can only be created through advanced alchemy or quick alchemy.

Benefit If you have the fleshwarp trait, you gain the listed item bonus to attack rolls, AC, checks, and saving throws for one minute. At any point you can use a two-action activity with the concentrate trait to force your fleshwarp biology to counteract the effects, immediately ending the mutagen.

Drawback Your body overclocking causes an increasing physical toll. Each turn you are affected by the mutagen increases your drained condition by 1. If you don’t have the fleshwarp trait, you instead suffer 2d6 persistent acid damage and are fatigued until you rest for 10 or more minutes, but have no other effects.

The item bonus is +4.

listCustomEquipment.name: Fleshcraft Mutagen
listCustomEquipment.traits: Rare, Alchemical, Consumable, Elixir, Mutagen, Polymorph
listCustomEquipment.description:
Your flesh rapidly warps, gaining the benefits of a graft albeit temporarily. Due to their highly unstable nature, fleshwarping mutagens can only be created through advanced alchemy or quick alchemy. When creating a fleshwarping mutagen, select an item with the graft trait that you know the recipe for and whose level is less than or equal to your own.

Benefit You rapidly mutate, growing the graft that was selected when creating the mutagen. You gain this graft for one minute as if it were invested, and it doesn’t count against the number of items you can have invested. This mutation is rapid and violent, and can damage clothing if the grown material would appear underneath it. After the minute passes, the flesh destabilizes and dissolves harmlessly into a foul biological slurry.

Drawback The mutagen works using the material in your body, rendering you drained 1 or increasing your drained value by 1. This condition lasts even after the mutagen ends.

Craft Requirements You know the recipe for the granted graft.

listCustomFeats.name: A Greater Power
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

Your will is unmistakable to aberrations, even if they’re normally unintelligent, causing them to both fear and respect you. You learn Aklo, and gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy, Deception, Intimidation, and Perception checks made against aberrations. You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use Charisma skills with otherwise mindless or unintelligent aberrations. Aberrations have an initial attitude towards you of one step better, or two steps for unintelligent or mindless aberrations, to a maximum of indifferent (typically from hostile to unfriendly or hostile to indifferent) unless it would already be better.

Additionally, you can spend a Mythic Point to cast dominate as an occult innate spell targeting an aberration that you can sense and who can sense you whose level is lower than your own. The spell is heightened to half your level, rounded down.

listCustomFeats.name: A Mind Electric
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

Your mind has begun to move in ways utterly indecipherable to those outside of it. Detection, revelation, and scrying effects with the mental trait pass right over you, your possessions, and your auras, detecting nothing unless the detecting effect has a counteract rank of 10 or higher. Additionally, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against mental effects and your Deception DC.

When you would be targeted by a mental effect, you may use a reaction with the concentrate trait to spend a Mythic Point and send a burst of psychic backlash at its origin. The creature creating the effect suffers mental damage equal to twice your level with a basic Will save against the higher of your class or spell DC. On a failure, the creature is stunned 1, or stunned 3 on a critical failure. This is an incapacitation effect.

listCustomFeats.name: Abby Normal
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshwarper Dedication

You’ve learned to make the best of a bad situation, though you often find it’s the subject that’s lacking more than your work. When you would roll a failure (but not a critical failure) on a true fleshwarping ritual, along with the normal failure effects, you can choose to transform the ritual’s target into a sinspawn with the weak template instead of them collapsing back into goo; this does not cause you to regain any less fleshwarping goo, as the half that would normally be lost is rapidly reprocessed into making something useful of the failed ritual. This sinspawn counts as being created by a critical success with the ritual, and is wholly devoted to you.

listCustomFeats.name: Aberrant Biology
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Your biology doesn’t match that of most creatures, making it difficult for attacks to hit your weak points. You gain resistance to your choice of precision damage or critical hits equal to half your level.

Your features are mutable; you can select this feat at any level, and you can retrain into or out of this feat or change the type damage you resist.

Special You can select this feat a second time to gain resistance to the other type of damage.

listCustomFeats.name: Aberrant Metamorphosis
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You can cause your body to distort and swell to exceptional proportions. You gain the effects of enlarge constantly. You can dismiss or resume these effects as an action, which has the concentrate trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Abhorrent Allies
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

You bind to your service a creature from the dark tapestry, compelling it to do your bidding. Spend a Mythic Point. You summon a creature that has the aberration trait whose level is 3 or more levels lower than your own to aid you in battle. This creature gains the summoned trait. You can sustain this ability for 10 minutes.

Once per day, you can use this ability without spending a Mythic Point. If you do, the creature you summon must have a level 4 or more levels lower than your own, and you can only sustain that usage of the ability for one minute.

listCustomFeats.name: Abhorrent Rebirth
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Trigger You are reduced to 0 Hit Points and would gain the dying condition or would otherwise die.

As your body fails, emergency hormones and stem cells kick into gear in a grotesque and horrifying manner, causing your flesh to slough off like overcooked meat revealing a slightly smaller, freshly grown version of yourself underneath. You prevent yourself from dying, regain Hit Points equal to your level, and gain temporary hit points equal to twice your level which last for one minute. You also immediately end any conditions, poisons, and diseases affecting you; this does not end any curses affecting you, but does end self-applied abilities like a barbarian’s rage or stances.

listCustomFeats.name: Abomination Magic
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Basic Eldritch Magic

You gain your choice of the initial domain spell for the abomination domain or the School of Protean Form magic school's initial school spell. For either choice, you gain it as a focus spell of your tradition. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point.

Special You can take this feat a second time, gaining the focus spell you didn’t select.

listCustomFeats.name: Absorb Magic
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Mutant Blood Essence
Trigger You are affected by a spell with the same tradition as your blood essence tradition

When faced with a magical threat, your body can absorb extreme amounts of magic to avoid being harmed. You absorb the magic entirely, becoming immune to it and regaining hit points equal to twice the spell’s rank.

listCustomFeats.name: Accumulation of Anguish
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshcraft Mutagens

You can produce a potent mutagen that overclocks a fleshwarp’s biology, vastly improving their capabilities at an increasing physical toll. You gain the Quick Alchemy benefits, creating up to 3 versatile vials during your daily preparations. You memorize the formula for the extract of anguish mutagen, and the recipe for two other alchemical mutagens to your formula book.

Special You can select this feat again at 14th level or higher; when you do, your number of versatile vials each day increases to 4. You can do this again at 16th level or higher, increasing the number to 5, and again at 18th level or higher, increasing the number to 6.

listCustomFeats.name: Acidic Bile
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You can produce and spit an extremely acidic bile. You gain an acidic spit ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 10 feet that deals 1d4 persistent acid damage. Your spit is from the sling weapon group, and when you critically hit with it, you gain its critical specialization effect. Like other unarmed attacks, you can improve this attack with handwraps of mighty blows.

Your features are mutable; you can select this feat at any level, and you can retrain into or out of this feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Acidic Spray
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

You vomit up your acidic stomach contents, spraying them over your enemies. Reduce the duration of your current mutagen by 10 minutes. All creatures within a 15-foot cone take 6d6 persistent acid damage with a basic Reflex save against your class DC. A creature that gets a critical failure on this Reflex save is also blinded for the next minute.

Level (+2) Increase the persistent acid damage by 1d6

listCustomFeats.name: Adaptive Resilience
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger You take damage

Your body rapidly adapts to threats after experiencing them. You gain resistance equal to 2 + your Constitution modifier to the triggering damage type. This doesn't apply to the triggering damage. This resistance lasts until you use this reaction again or one minute passes, whichever happens first.

listCustomFeats.name: Adept Lantern
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites lamplighter methodology

You have unlocked greater secrets from your lantern, granting you its adept benefit.

listCustomFeats.name: Advanced Abomination Magic
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Abomination Magic

You gain your choice of the advanced domain spell for the abomination domain or the advanced school spell for the School of Protean Form. You must have the initial spell from that school or domain to select it.

Special You can take this feat a second time, gaining the focus spell you didn’t select; you must still meet the requirements to do so.

listCustomFeats.name: Advanced Domain (Priest)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Priest Dedication; Domain Initiate

Your prayers have unlocked deeper secrets of your deity’s domain. You gain an advanced domain spell from one of your domains for which you have an initial domain spell (see pages 372–381).

Special You can select this feat multiple times. Each time, you must select a different advanced domain spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Advanced Gunslinging
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites steel hound methodology

You have mastered a specific technique mostly used by gunslingers. You gain the Advanced Deed for the Way you chose with your methodology.

listCustomFeats.name: Advanced Implement Domain
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; implement occultism

You’ve unlocked further magic from one of your implements. Select an implement you have that’s adept; you gain the advanced domain spell for the domain you chose for that implement.

Special You can select this feat multiple times. Each time, you must select a different implement spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Aerial Piledriver (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication
Requirements You have a creature grabbed or restrained.

Heaving both yourself and your opponent into the air, you bring them crashing to the ground. Make an unarmed melee Strike against the creature you have grabbed or restrained. This Strike deals 1d6 additional damage per weapon damage die, and it has the following additional effects on a success, failure, and critical failure.

Success The target lands prone.
Failure You lose your grip on the target, and it is no longer grabbed or restrained by you.
Critical Failure You lose both your grip on the target and your balance. You fall prone, and the target is no longer grabbed or restrained by you.

listCustomFeats.name: Agile Grace (Sword Saint)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication

Your graceful moves with agile weapons are beyond compare. Your multiple attack penalty with agile weapons and agile unarmed attacks becomes –3 for your second attack and –6 for subsequent attacks (rather than –4 and –8).

listCustomFeats.name: Alchemical Stomach
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
The chemical composition of your stomach allows you to brew alchemical products by imbibing their ingredients. You gain the advanced alchemy benefits. You can use advanced alchemy to create 2 alchemical consumables with the elixir trait. You can use your Fortitude save modifier instead of Crafting to Craft alchemical consumables with the elixir trait. You don’t need to be trained in Crafting to do so, and you don’t need alchemist’s tools when you do so.

Special You can select this feat a second time to increase the number of alchemical consumables you can create per day to 4.

listCustomFeats.name: All Together
listCustomFeats.textDescription: As a patchman that has managed to survive and grow far beyond the power your people normally see, you find yourself always wanting to help elevate others. You can use the Aid reaction, even if you haven’t prepared to do so. You gain an additional reaction each turn, which can only be used for the Aid reaction.

listCustomFeats.name: All in your Head (Psychokineticist)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychokineticist Dedication
Trigger You're about to attempt a Fortitude save or a Reflex save.

Flames scouring at your body, venom coursing through your veins—you refuse to believe they exist, and nothing can affect you if you don't believe in it. You attempt a Will save against the triggering effect, instead of a Reflex or Fortitude save. You don't gain the benefits of fortress of will or walls of will on this save.

listCustomFeats.name: Amplify Curse
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; implement occultism
Requirements The target of your Empower Implement is at least cursebound 1 and you are holding your implement

You empower your implement, amplifying the target’s curse. The target’s cursebound condition increases by 1, to a maximum of the cursebound you can inflict. You may then make a Strike against the target of your Empower Implement as a free action, using your normal multiple attack penalty.

listCustomFeats.name: Ancestral Adherent
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite Ancestral Paragon; trained in a lore skill related to your ancestry

You’ve grown an even deeper connection to your ancestry. You gain a 5th-level or lower ancestry feat.

Pathbuilder Note: Add the chosen ancestry feat as a bonus feat

listCustomFeats.name: Ancestral Embodiment
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite Ancestral Adherent; expert in a lore skill related to your ancestry

Innate ancestral memories begin to fill your head, cultural knowledge and ancestral practices flowing like instinct. You gain a 9th-level or lower ancestry feat of your choice. Additionally, you gain familiarity with weapons with your ancestry trait (elf weapons if you are an elf, for example)--for the purposes of proficiency, you treat any of these that are martial weapons as simple weapons and any that are advanced weapons as martial weapons.

Pathbuilder Note: Add the chosen ancestry feat as a bonus feat

listCustomFeats.name: Ancestral Epitome
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite Ancestral Embodiment; master in a lore skill related to your ancestry

Going beyond cultural appreciation, your very form has begun to change, becoming an idealized version of your original ancestry. You gain a 13th-level or lower ancestry feat. Additionally, if you took an attribute flaw from your ancestry during character creation, you gain an attribute boost for that attribute; if you did not, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

Pathbuilder Note: Add the chosen ancestry feat as a bonus feat. Add the skill increase, if taken, as a bonus increase

listCustomFeats.name: Ancestral Form
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You draw upon magic within your bloodline to temporarily become a glorious beacon of your heritage. You can cast sacred form once per day as a divine innate spell. When you do so, you select a deity that best represents your heritage instead of using the deity you follow. If you are at least 17th level, the spell is heightened to 8th rank.

listCustomFeats.name: Ancestral Incarnation
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite Ancestral Epitome; legendary in a lore skill related to your ancestry

Your very being warps the perception of how others view your ancestry, becoming a folk hero among your people and a symbol of the pinnacle of your culture. You gain a 17th-level or lower ancestry feat. Additionally, during your daily preparations, you can retrain any number of your ancestry feats that don’t have the lineage trait to another ancestry feat with the same ancestry trait.

Pathbuilder Note: Add the chosen ancestry feat as a bonus feat

listCustomFeats.name: Ancestral Mobility
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Your ancestry grants you a particular mobility option, such as webbed fins or large spider legs that protrude from your back. Choose one of the movement options below:
- You have fins along your legs and webbed fingers. You gain a swim speed of 15 feet.
- You have spider legs, sharp claws, or similar appendages used for climbing sheer surfaces. You gain a climb speed of 15 feet.
- You have a pair of weak, barely functional wings. You gain the Fledgling Flight strix ancestry feat, ignoring its prerequisites. This does not allow you to take other Strix feats.
- You can move along the ground or through tight spaces with ease. You can Crawl and Squeeze at up to half your Speed.
Special You can select this feat multiple times, choosing a different mobility option each time you do.

listCustomFeats.name: Arachnid Heritage
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites draconid dragon heritage

Your part-spider existence grants you certain similarities to the Anadi. You gain the Adopted Ancestry feat, selecting Anadi. You also gain Web Walker Anadi feat. You can only select Anadi feats that relate to their spider form, and cannot select any Anadi feats that grant shapeshifting.

listCustomFeats.name: Arcane Barrier
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication

You can burn arcane magic to create a shield of force around yourself. You gain the shield cantrip as an arcane innate spell. You also gain the arcane barrier focus spell, which enhances magical shields to improve your durability.

listCustomFeats.name: Arcane Weapon
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication

You learn the runic weapon spell and add it to your spell collection (this does not count against the number of spells you can add to your spell collection each day). You also gain the arcane weapon focus spell, which allows you to wield arcane weapons with ease.

listCustomFeats.name: Arcanist Crafting
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication

You can use your magic to bypass the normal requirements for crafting a magic item. You become trained in Crafting, or expert if you are already trained, and gain the Magical Crafting skill feat. When you are crafting an item with the magical trait that requires the casting of a specific spell, you can expend a spell slot of the same rank or higher as the required spell to pay that cost, even if you don’t know the required spell or have it in your collection.

listCustomFeats.name: Arcanist Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your combination of legacy and knowledge enhances your destructive power. When you Cast a Spell from your Arcanist spell slots that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, you gain a status bonus to that spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank. This applies only to the initial damage or healing the spell deals when cast. An individual creature takes this damage or benefits from this healing only once per spell, even if the spell would damage or heal that creature multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Arise to Sainthood (Priest)
listCustomFeats.textDescription: See Clerics+ Pg. 7

listCustomFeats.name: Aristocratic Erudition
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

Your upbringing has granted you a wide spread of knowledge normally unattainable by the common folk. Select two of the following options, and gain their benefits:
- You gain the Multilingual skill feat.
- You gain the Read Lips skill feat.
- You gain the Virtuosic Performer skill feat.
- You become trained in two Lore skills of your choice.
- You gain the Additional Lore skill feat. You can select this option multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Armor Specialist (Implement Occultist)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; implement occultism

You have trained hard to optimize your armor's unique protective qualities to maximize the materials used in its creation. You gain the armor specialization effects for all armors you are proficient with.

listCustomFeats.name: Armored Bruiser
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication; trained in light and medium armor

You become trained in heavy armor. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in light and medium armor (but not unarmored defense), you also gain that proficiency in heavy armor.

listCustomFeats.name: Armored Hulk
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites fury instinct; trained in light and medium armor

As opposed to the leathers of half-armors of other barbarians, you favor the stability and protection of heavy armor in battle. You become trained in heavy armor. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in light and medium armor, you also gain that proficiency in heavy armor. You can use Quick-Tempered while wearing heavy armor.

listCustomFeats.name: Armored Swiftness
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Armored Hulk; expert in Athletics

Thanks to practice and training, you can wear your heavy armor with ease and move faster in it than normal. You gain the Hefty Hauler skill feat. Ignore the reduction to your Speed from any armor you wear while you are Raging.

listCustomFeats.name: Authority*
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites obedience cause; trained in Society

Your divine presence is accepted by those that follow your laws. You gain your choice of the Group Coercion or Group Impression feat. When addressing a group of people or a figure of authority, you can use Society instead of Diplomacy or Intimidation for Make an Impression, Request, Coerce, and Demoralize checks. If you hold a higher position of authority than the target, you also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the role.

listCustomFeats.name: Autocannibalistic Spellcasting
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication
Requirements Your focus pool is missing at least 1 focus point

You can consume your own spell slots to restore your spellcasting ability. Expend spell slots whose total rank is greater than or equal to half your level, rounded up. You regain 1 Focus Point.

listCustomFeats.name: Basic Eldritch Magic
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites expert in Arcana or Occultism; Eldritch Researcher Dedication

By keeping notes within your own eldritch tome, you can utilize that knowledge to cast spells. You gain a spellbook with four common cantrips of your choice. These spells must be from the tradition you chose in the Eldritch Researcher Dedication feat. You can prepare two cantrips each day, and also gain the basic bounded spellcasting benefits. Each time you gain a spell slot of a new rank from the eldritch researcher archetype, add two common spells of that rank or lower to your spellbook. If you gain a Focus Pool from any Eldritch Researcher class feats, you Refocus by contemplating abstruse mysteries rather than praying to a god.

In addition to preparing spells from your chosen spell list, you can prepare spells from the School of Protean Form magic school. Regardless of their usual magic tradition, when you prepare spells from this school, they are spells from your chosen tradition.

listCustomFeats.name: Be Not Afraid
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Priest Dedication
Requirements You’re holding or wearing your holy symbol

Your presence is reassuring to those around you, such that you can ease their nerves. Select a creature within 10 feet that has the confused, frightened, or stupefied condition; if the creature has multiple conditions from the list, choose one. Attempt a counteract check against the condition using your Religion modifier as your counteract modifier and the condition’s source to determine the DC. You can’t treat a condition that came from an artifact or effect above 20th level unless you have the Divine Guidance skill feat; even if you do, the counteract DC increases by 10. Performing this activity on an effect that is continually applied under certain circumstances (for instance, the stupefied condition from an Oracle’s curse) has no effect as long as the circumstances continue.

Critical Success As success, but you reduce it by 2 instead.
Success Reduce the condition’s value by 1, or end the condition if it doesn’t have a value.
Critical Failure If the condition has a value, increase the condition’s value by 1.
listCustomFeats.traits: Archetype, Auditory, Concentrate, Healing, Skill, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Becoming the Beast
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

You have reached the threshold where your mutagenic form overtakes the original, the balance between the two flipping on its head. You can remain in your mutagenic form indefinitely, with the triggering mutagen lasting until you exit your mutagenic form.

listCustomFeats.name: Bend the Weather
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sea Shanty

Your connection to the seas allows you to manipulate the wind and waves with your magic. Select air or water; you add all common spells and spells you have access to with the chosen trait to your spell list. You can add these spells to your repertoire just like the spells normally on your tradition’s spell list. When you gain this feat, you can retrain existing spells to replace them with ones with the chosen trait.

Additionally, you can add two spells with the chosen trait to your repertoire. They are signature spells for you, in addition to your normal signature spells. When you gain the ability to cast a new level of spells, you can choose to switch the spells from this feat to any other spells with the chosen trait.

Special You can select this feat an additional time at 12th level, selecting the other trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Best Parts
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Monstrous Ingredients; expert in Survival

In harvesting monster ingredients, you’ve learned the best parts of each creature type to cook and eat. When you successfully harvest ingredients from a creature, you can also harvest a particularly flavorful portion of that creature. When you make a batch of consumable food items, you can add that portion into the batch, causing creatures that consume items from that batch to gain a benefit for the duration of the item’s effects or one minute, whichever is longer. The benefits gained depend on the creature the portion is harvested from, as determined by the table below. Portions have a negligible Bulk.

listCustomFeats.name: Blade Brake (Sword Saint)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication
Requirements You are wielding a melee weapon and are within reach of a hard surface
Trigger You would be moved by a forced movement effect

You plow your weapon into a floor, wall, or another sturdy surface, anchoring yourself in place. If you would be moved 20 feet or more, you are moved only 5 feet. Otherwise, you don’t move at all.

listCustomFeats.name: Blade of Law
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Hellknight Dedication

You call upon the power of law and make a weapon or unarmed Strike against a foe you have witnessed breaking the law or one of your anathemas. The Strike deals an additional die of damage, and ignores any resistances (but not immunities) to damage. You may also convert the physical damage from this attack to spirit damage.

listCustomFeats.name: Blind-Fight (Sword Saint)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication; master in Perception

Your battle instincts make you more aware of concealed and invisible opponents. You don’t need to succeed at a flat check to target concealed creatures. You’re not off-guard to creatures that are hidden from you (unless you’re off-guard to them for reasons other than the hidden condition), and you need only a successful DC 5 flat check to target a hidden creature.

While you’re adjacent to an undetected creature of your level or lower, it is instead only hidden from you

listCustomFeats.name: Bloodline Development
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication

Your sorcerous bloodline begins to manifest in ways beyond being a source of magic. Choose a sorcerer bloodline. You gain its initial bloodline spell as an arcane focus spell. Whenever you cast a bloodline spell, focus spell with the spellshape or wizard trait, or use an exploit by spending a Focus Point, you gain your bloodline’s blood magic effect.

Special You can select this feat again at 10th level; when you do you gain your bloodline’s advanced bloodline spell. You can do so for a third time at 14th level, gaining your bloodline’s greater bloodline spell.

Pathbuilder Note: Due to current limitations, mark down your chosen bloodline and bloodline spell seperately.

listCustomFeats.name: Blue-Orange Morality
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

Your glimpse into the cosmos allows you to see how petty many of its quarrels are in the grand scheme of things. You gain resistance to holy and unholy damage equal to half your level. When you make a Strike, you can have your attack gain or lose the holy or unholy trait. When you would be targeted by an effect, you can count yourself as having the holy or unholy trait. If you would already have one of those traits, you can also count yourself as not having that trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Brain Drain (Psychokineticist)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychokineticist Dedication

With a wresting of will, you siphon off a creature's mental energy to replenish your own. One non-mindless creature within 30 feet must attempt a Will save against your spell DC.

Success The creature is unaffected.
Failure The creature is stupefied 1 for 1 minute, and you regain 1 Focus Point, up to your normal maximum. You can't use Brain Drain again until after the next time you make your daily preparations.
Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is stupefied 2.

listCustomFeats.name: Brawler Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites brawler training

You can unleash a blistering array of attacks on foes you can get close to. You gain the Brawler’s Beatdown action.

listCustomFeats.name: Brutality
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

Your mutagenic form holds a certain brutal skill when inflicting harm upon others. While in your mutagenic form, you gain the critical specialization benefits for unarmed attacks. If you have the Mutagenic Armor feat, you gain the armor specialization effects for medium chain armor while you are unarmored in your mutagenic form.

listCustomFeats.name: Bulletproof Body
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

Your mutagenic flesh repels almost all types of damage. While in your mutagenic form, you gain resistance to all damage except mental, sonic, and spirit equal to 2 + the item bonus from your current mutagen. If you are a master in Fortitude saves, this resistance increases by 2.

listCustomFeats.name: Burglar Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites trained in Thievery

You become an expert in Thievery. At 7th level, you become a master in Thievery, and at 15th level, you become legendary in Thievery. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Palm an Object or Steal while within 10 feet of a willing ally.

listCustomFeats.name: Bypassing Blade
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Piercing Blade Stance

You can lunge with your blade such that it bypasses defenses, guards, and even physical obstacles. While in Piercing Blade Stance, Strikes with your chosen weapon ignore the concealed condition and all cover except total cover, as well as the circumstance bonus granted by Raising a Shield.

listCustomFeats.name: Call Aberration
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Eldritch Researcher Dedication

You can summon aberrations from beyond the veil to aid you in battle. You summon a creature that has the aberration trait whose level is 4 or more levels lower than your own to aid you in battle. This creature gains the summoned trait. You can sustain this ability for one minute.

listCustomFeats.name: Call Armor
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Hellknight Armiger Dedication

A hellknight is nothing without their armor, and you keep yours constantly at the ready. You can perform a 10-minute ritual, which has the extradimensional and magical traits, to divert a set of Hellknight plate, Hellknight half plate, or Hellknight breastplate you are wearing into an extradimensional space connected to you. While the armor is in this space, you can use a three-action activity, which has the concentrate, conjuration, and teleportation traits, to phase the armor back and instantly don it. The armor automatically phases away if you don another set of armor, if you become unconscious, or if you die. If you are incapable of wearing the armor when it phases back, it appears in your square instead.

listCustomFeats.name: Call the Storm
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Whistle the Wind

Your music shapes the very weather itself, producing powerful atmospheric conditions in the area around you. The weather around you changes as if you had gotten a success (but not a critical success) on an 8th-rank control weather ritual until the end of your next turn. You can Sustain this effect, either by using the Sustain action or casting a composition spell during your turn.

At 20th level, the control weather ritual is heightened to 9th-rank.

listCustomFeats.name: Calming Presence
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychopomp Dedication; you do not have the Sakhil Rejection feat

Your presence is supernaturally calming to those around you. You can activate or deactivate this aura as a free action on your turn. An enemy that begins its turn within a 30-foot emanation of you while this aura is active must make a Will save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC. Any effects of the aura immediately end upon leaving the aura.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to your calming presence for 24 hours.
Success Calming urges impose a –1 status penalty to the creature's attack rolls for 1 round.
Failure Any emotion effects that would affect the creature are suppressed and the creature can't use hostile actions. If the target is subject to hostility from any other creature, it ceases to be affected by your calming presence and is temporarily immune to your calming presence for 24 hours.
Critical Failure As failure, but hostility doesn't end the effect.
listCustomFeats.traits: Basic Mythic, Aura, Divine, Emotion, Incapacitation, Mental, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Case the Joint
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Burglar Dedication; expert in Stealth or Thievery

You know how to look for weak points in places you’re seeking to infiltrate, and can use these to your advantage. Before attempting an infiltration, you can spend an hour using this exploration activity to Case the target. If you do, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to any Stealth and Thievery checks you make during the infiltration. You can instead give this activity the downtime trait, spending a day to Case the target and increasing the circumstance bonus to +2.

listCustomFeats.name: Chart a Course
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pirate Dedication; expert in Sailing Lore

By spending 10 minutes of work, you can make a DC 25 Sailing Lore check (or DC 22 if you have a chart of the local seas) to plot an optimal course. On a success, the severity of environmental conditions for aquatic terrain you move through other than temperature are reduced by one step for 24 hours (two steps on a critical success). This changes moderate damage to minor damage, winds that create greater difficult terrain cause only difficult terrain, and so on.

listCustomFeats.name: Chimeras of Boundless Grandeur
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshwarper Dedication; legendary in Fleshwarp Lore

With your exceptional skill and practice, you’ve learned to improve your fleshwarps to the fullest extent of what is possible. Fleshwarps you create gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, AC, saving throws, and skill checks; this bonus increases to +2 if they are within your Fearless Master aura. You can spend 10 minutes improving a fleshwarp you’ve already created to grant it this bonus. In addition, you learn the true fleshwarping ritual to create fleshforged dreadnoughts; due to their level, ones you create must have the weak template applied to them.

listCustomFeats.name: Chosen Specialization
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication; expert in your chosen weapon

Your skill with your chosen weapon is exceptional. You gain access to the critical specialization effect for your chosen weapon. If you already have access to the critical specialization effect or you gain the effect at a later time, you also gain the critical specialization effect for axes when you critically hit with your chosen weapon. You can benefit from only one critical specialization effect at a time.

listCustomFeats.name: Clever Snares
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites outwit hunter’s edge; trained in Crafting

Your skill at outwitting your prey extends to the snares you produce. You gain the Snarecrafter Dedication archetype feat, but do not need to select two other archetype feats to be able to select another dedication feat. When you set a snare, you can choose to rig it to catch your hunted prey. If you do, only the creature you have marked as your Hunted Prey at the time of deploying the snare can trigger the snare. A snare set in this manner gains a circumstance bonus to its DC equal to your Outwit circumstance bonus to Deception, Intimidation, or Stealth (whichever is higher).

listCustomFeats.name: Clinch Strike (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication
Trigger A creature you had grabbed or restrained successfully Escapes.

Your opponents can’t slip your grasp without punishment. Make an unarmed melee Strike against the triggering creature.

listCustomFeats.name: Command Attention (Noble Scion)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You command the attention of all around you with style, ensuring their gaze falls only upon you until the end of your next turn. Whenever a creature in a 30-foot emanation around you attempts a saving throw against a different visual effect, it gets a result one degree of success better than it rolled. This is a fortune effect. When an enemy within the aura attempts to use a visual effect that involves focusing its attention on a particular creature (such as a medusa’s Focus Gaze), it must succeed at a Will save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher, in order to target any creature except you. Allies in the aura can attempt to Hide even if they don’t have cover, as you are continually providing a distraction.
listCustomFeats.traits: Archetype, Auditory, Aura, Concentrate, Emotion, Mental, Visual, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Conceal Spell (Eldritch Scoundrel)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Scoundrel Dedication

Through sheer mental effort, you can simplify the incantations and gestures needed to spellcast, leaving them barely noticeable. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell, the spell gains the subtle trait, hiding the shining runes, sparks of magic, and other manifestations that would usually give away your spellcasting. The trait hides only the spell’s spellcasting actions and manifestations, not its effects, so an observer might still see a ray streak out from you or see you vanish into thin air.

listCustomFeats.name: Concentrated Stomach
listCustomFeats.textDescription: The alchemical consumables you brew in your stomach combine with the bile you produce to create exceptionally potent spit. The damage dice of your acidic bile increases to 1d6, and when you attack with it you may have it gain the splash trait, dealing splash acid damage equal to the number of damage dice.

listCustomFeats.name: Confident Swagger
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Charmed Life, Swagger

Your sense of confidence in the face of death is infuriating. If you succeed on a saving throw you used Charmed Life on and the source of the saving throw was a creature, you can Demoralize the originating creature as a free action. You can Demoralize a foe using this, even if they are currently immune to your Demoralize due to being previously affected.

Special If you have the Bon Mot skill feat, you can choose to Bon Mot the originating creature instead of Demoralizing them.

listCustomFeats.name: Consigned by Fate
listCustomFeats.textDescription: In the end, your family line traces back to beings of considerable power, be they angelic, demonic, or otherwise, and the call of your bloodline has brought you home. You gain the Consigned Dedication* archetype feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Consume Magic
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per 10 minutes
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication
Requirements You are holding a wand or magic item with a once per day ability that hasn’t been used today whose level is your level - 4 or higher

You draw forth energy from the magic item you’re holding, using it to fuel your magic. The item’s ability counts as being expended, and you gain 1 Focus Point, which you can spend only to cast a focus spell with the spellshape trait or use an exploit feat. If you don’t spend this Focus Point by the start of your next turn, it is lost.

listCustomFeats.name: Control Aberration
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Researcher Dedication; ability to cast spells from spell slots

You can twist magic to bind an aberration to your will. If the next action you use is to cast a two-action spell that targets one creature with the aberration trait, you can transform the effects of the spell. Instead of applying the spell’s normal effects, the target becomes controlled by you if its level is equal to or lower than twice the spell’s level - 3. The target can attempt a Will saving throw to resist being controlled by you. If the target is already under someone else’s command, the controlling creature also rolls a saving throw, and the aberration uses the better result. If the target’s level is greater than the level you can control, any actions spent casting the spell and using this spellshape are wasted but the spell is not consumed. This effect has the incapacitation trait if the target isn’t mindless.

Critical Success As success, but the creature immediately goes berserk, ignoring all other commands and attempting to kill you. It also becomes immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.
Success The target is unaffected.
Failure The aberration becomes a minion under your control. The spell gains a duration of 1 minute, but it is dismissed if you or an ally attacks the minion aberration.
Critical Failure As failure, but the duration is 1 hour.

listCustomFeats.name: Crafted Reality
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Workshop On the Go; Magical Crafting

Through study of magical tomes and careful, measured action, you’ve created a small place to call your own outside of the material plane. You can spend one week of downtime to carefully and meticulously craft your extraplanar forge, which acts as a plane created by a success (but not a critical success) on an 8th-rank version of the create demiplane ritual. This demiplane exists on the Ethereal Plane, but may otherwise have any features you wish that the ritual can provide. This demiplane must be entirely new, and you can only have one demiplane created with this ability at a time. You can use this ability again to alter the properties of your demiplane, or to create a new one in the extremely rare circumstance where it is destroyed.

Your workshop tools count as a key to your demiplane, and gains the magical trait. Once per day, you can utilize your workshop tools to cast interplanar teleport as an innate spell with a tradition of your choosing (chosen when gaining this feat), targeting your crafted demiplane and appearing in a location of your choice on the demiplane. While you are on the demiplane, you can cast interplanar teleport at will, returning to your last location on a plane other than your crafted demiplane.

Level (20) Your demiplane expands further, gaining the benefits of a success on a 10th-rank version of the create demiplane ritual.

listCustomFeats.name: Craftsman Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites trained in Crafting

You become an expert in Crafting. At 7th level, you become a master in Crafting, and at 15th level, you become legendary in Crafting. Whenever you succeed at a Crafting check to Craft an Item you have the formula for, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomFeats.name: Craftsman’s Eye
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Craftsman Dedication; Magical Crafting

Whether an item is magical or not, you know how to figure out what it does with a good look. You can use Crafting to Identify Magic on any non-natural item or location. When you attempt to Identify an item or location that is natural using Crafting, you learn that it is natural but nothing else.

listCustomFeats.name: Cruel Strike
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pain Taster Dedication

You gain the sneak attack class feature, except you don’t increase the number of dice as you gain levels. You can deal sneak attack damage with simple and martial weapons from the flail weapon group, even if they are not an agile or finesse weapon.

listCustomFeats.name: Crushing Grab (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication

Like a powerful constrictor, you crush targets in your unyielding grasp. When you successfully Grapple a creature, you can deal bludgeoning damage to that creature equal to your Strength modifier. You can make this attack nonlethal with no penalty.

listCustomFeats.name: Curator’s Collection
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Extensive Collection

You have such an extensive collection that you have many weaker implements in case of an emergency. During your daily preparations, you can select an implement you don’t have but for which you have a compatible item. You gain the initiate benefits for that implement (with the compatible item becoming that implement), as well as the implement’s associated cantrip; you do not, however, gain the implement’s domain spell. You gain these benefits until your next daily preparations.

listCustomFeats.name: Curse Keeper
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication

You know how to handle strange magic items, and have learned countermeasures to avoid curses as a result. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to Identify Magic on a cursed item or a spell that has the curse trait. Additionally, you have a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against effects with the curse trait, and when you would critically fail on such a saving throw, you get a failure instead.

listCustomFeats.name: Curse of Inevitability
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Reaping Blade
Requirements you are wearing your psychopomp mask

You touch a creature with your blade, bestowing a curse of inevitability upon the target. Make a melee Strike with your reaping blade against a creature. If the attack hits, you may Spend 1 Mythic Point; if you do, the target must attempt a Will save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC. This effect has the incapacitation trait.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to your Curse of Inevitability for 24 hours.
Success The target feels a momentary shudder of doom and is stupefied 2 for 1 minute by the distracting sensation.
Failure The target becomes morose and glum as it accepts its own inevitable fate. For 1 hour, the target is stupefied 3. Each time the target gains the doomed condition, the stupefied value increases by 1, to a maximum value of stupefied 6.
Critical Failure As failure, but the effect is permanent.
listCustomFeats.traits: Basic Mythic, Curse, Divine, Misfortune, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Cut from the Air (Sword Saint)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication
Requirements You’re aware of the attack, not off-guard against it, and either have a hand free or are wielding a melee weapon
Trigger You are the target of a physical ranged Strike

You can knock aside ranged attacks. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, you knocked or cut it out of the air.

listCustomFeats.name: Cutting Flattery (Noble Scion)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication; trained in Intimidation

Repeated entries in Firebrand bragging and flyting contests have taught you how to twist pretty words into concealed insults. When you succeed at your check to Coerce a creature, the target's attitude toward you improves by one step, to a maximum of friendly, and they don't become unfriendly 1 day later.

listCustomFeats.name: Cycle Curse
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; implement occultism
Requirements The target of your Empower Implement is at least cursebound 1 because of your Empower Implement and you are holding your implement

You transfer the source of the target’s curse to another one of your implements. Select an implement you are holding. The target of your Empower Implement is affected by the chosen implement’s curse instead of the curse they are currently suffering. This effect lasts until you use this action again or they are no longer the target of your Empower Implement.

listCustomFeats.name: Death's Shadow
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Consigned Dedication; your patron is a psychopomp

A shadow of death lingers over your soul, keeping the grave at bay while bringing others closer towards it. You gain the Diehard general feat.

If you have at least two consignment feats, you gain lifesense as an imprecise sense with a range of 5 feet * your consignment tier. This allows you to sense the life force of living and undead creatures within the listed range. This sense can distinguish between the vitality energy animating living creatures and the void energy animating undead creatures, much as sight distinguishes colors.

If you have at least three consignment feats, your weapon and unarmed Strikes gain the effects of a ghost touch property rune.

If you have at least four consignment feats, you die from the dying condition at dying 8 instead of dying 5.

listCustomFeats.name: Dedicated Wrappings
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychopomp Dedication; you do not have the Sakhil Rejection feat

In a manner reminiscent of Morrignas, you can infuse your divine power into a large piece of cloth, enhancing it to divine proportions. Select one cloak, scarf, shirt, or robe to be your wrappings. While you are wearing your wrappings but otherwise unarmored, you gain a +1 item bonus to AC. This item bonus to AC is cumulative with armor potency runes on your explorer's clothing, mystic armor, bands of force, and similar effects

Additionally, while you are wearing your wrappings and your psychopomp mask, you can extend tendrils of fabric from your wrappings. You gain a wrappings unarmed attack that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage, is in the flail weapon group, and has the finesse, grapple, reach, and unarmed traits. You gain the item bonus to attack rolls and damage dice with your wrappings from the highest potency and striking runes on any handwraps of mighty blows you are wearing or any weapon you are wielding.

listCustomFeats.name: Deep Breath
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per 10 minutes
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication
Trigger Your turn begins

You take a moment to calm your breath and prepare for the next fight. You gain temporary hit points equal to your level, which last for the next minute.

listCustomFeats.name: Deep Pockets
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Stipend

Thanks to your family connections, you have learned how to turn any simple pouch, wallet, or other item typically used for storing money into an access point to your stipend. During your daily preparations, you can designate an empty version of one such item; until your next daily preparations, you can reach into that pouch to access your stipend directly, depositing and withdrawing as you wish. The magic is tied to yourself; as such, any other creature (including other members of your family) that attempts to access your stipend using it finds only the inside of the normal object.

In addition, whenever you gain money from your stipend, you count as having critically succeeded the Earn Income check.

listCustomFeats.name: Deft Activation
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Burglar Dedication; Trick Magic Item; master in Thievery

You’re so used to handling magic items and weapons that you can activate them without a second thought. When you make a check to Trick Magic Item, you can use Thievery instead of a skill matching the item’s tradition with a -2 circumstance penalty as long as you are at least trained in the tradition’s skill. You can do so with items even if you don’t know what activating them does, but increase the circumstance penalty to the check to -4 when doing so.

listCustomFeats.name: Devastating Strike
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication

Your Lightning Draw strikes with extreme precision. When you succeed or critically succeed at a Strike against a creature with Lightning Draw, you also deal 1d4 precision damage. This damage increases to 2d4 at 14th level and 4d4 at 20th level.

listCustomFeats.name: Devour Writing
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; implement occultism

You’ve learned how to harness the latent psychic energy of the written word by physically devouring scrolls and books. You gain the Devour Scroll and Devour Tome activities.

listCustomFeats.name: Devouring Counterspell
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Devour Writing
Trigger A creature casts a spell from an item such as a scroll or wand

You reach out with your magic to devour the enemy’s item before it takes effect. Attempt to counteract the triggering spell using your Occultism. On a success, the scroll is absorbed into you as if you had used Devour Scroll, ignoring the normal rank requirements; if the spell is above a rank you can normally devour, the spell fails to be absorbed but is still countered.

listCustomFeats.name: Diabolic Harbinger
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Signifier’s Sight; master in Hell Lore

Your masked presence radiates an aura of hellish authority, while your training grants you insight into everything before you. While wearing your signifier’s mask, you gain the following benefits:
- You are permanently under the effects of the telepathy spell, heightened to half your level.
- You are immune to the dazzled and blinded conditions; your mask provides magical sight which cancels out these effects when they would occur.
- You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Charisma-based skill checks.

listCustomFeats.name: Diamond Fists (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication

Your body hardens as you combine your attacks, making your finishing blows more damaging. Your unarmed attacks gain the forceful and deadly d10 traits. Any that already had one or both of these traits increase their weapon damage dice by one step.

listCustomFeats.name: Dimensional Slide
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Researcher Dedication

You can travel across the battlefield by slipping between the planes. You can cast translocate once per day as a 4th-rank occult innate spell. If you are at least 14th level, you can do so once per hour, and if you are at least 18th level, you can instead do so at will.

listCustomFeats.name: Dirty Strike
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Burglar Dedication

With a quick hand and quicker reflexes, you can distract an opponent and capitalize on that distraction in a moment’s notice. You gain the Dirty Trick skill feat, and can use the Dirty Trick action with a weapon that has the disarm, grapple, shove, or trip trait instead of a free hand. If you roll a critical success to Dirty Trick a creature, that creature is off-guard to your next attack before the end of your turn.

listCustomFeats.name: Disciple of Pain
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pain Taster Dedication

You can perform a series of self-inflicted torture routines to improve your resilience and ability in certain fields. During your daily preparations, you can perform one of the following torture regimens, granting you its benefits and penalties until your next daily preparations:
- Regimen of Acuity You recite a series of lengthy mantras while wrapping your arms in razor-edged metal. You gain a +1 status bonus to Intelligence-based skill checks as well as a -1 status penalty to Athletics checks to Disarm, Grapple, or Shove.
- Regimen of Flexibility You hyper-extend each of your joints, granting you a +1 status bonus to Dexterity-based skill checks and attack rolls and Reflex saving throws as well as a -1 status penalty to Fortitude saving throws and Strength-based checks.
- Regimen of Insight You repeatedly whip yourself while meditating on your failures, granting you a +1 status bonus to Wisdom-based skill checks and Will saving throws, as well as a -1 status penalty to Reflex saving throws.
- Regimen of Spirit You split your tongue centrally from tip to base, granting you a +1 status bonus to Charisma-based skill checks as well as a -1 status penalty to Lore skill checks.
- Regimen of Torment You eat dirt, rocks, and other indigestible matter, granting you a +1 status bonus to Constitution-based skill checks and Fortitude saving throws, as well as a -1 status penalty to Diplomacy and Deception checks.
- Regimen of Vigor You suspend yourself from a tree or similar structure by your wrists, granting you a +1 status bonus to Strength-based skill checks and attack rolls as well as a -1 status penalty to Will saving throws.

listCustomFeats.name: Disengaging Twist (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication
Trigger A creature gives you the grabbed or restrained condition.

Your ability to twist your opponents' bodies into painful locks and holds makes you particularly adept at escaping such predicaments. Attempt an Athletics check to Escape the triggering condition. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to this check.

listCustomFeats.name: Distant Spit
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Acidic Bile

You can utilize your throat muscles to launch your spit more powerfully at more extreme ranges. The range increment of your acidic spit increases to 30 feet, and it gains the propulsive trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Diverse Ancestry
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Patchmen are capable of reproducing with almost every known species, and somewhere in your bloodline lies the potential of these species. You gain the Adopted Ancestry general feat, as well as a 1st-level ancestry feat from the chosen ancestry. You can select feats that require specific physiological features; these features were always present, but become more pronounced as your ancestral heritage presents itself.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different ancestry each time. You do not gain an additional 1st-level ancestry feat when you do so.

Pathbuilder Note: Add the chosen feat as a custom feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Divine Disharmony (Occultist)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication

From your collection of religious trinkets, you pull out opposing divine objects—such as the religious symbols of two deities that are hated enemies—and combine them in a display that causes discordant clashes of divine energy that are especially distracting to the faithful. Roll your choice of a Deception or Intimidation check against the Will DC of a creature you can see within 60 feet, with the following results. If the creature is particularly devoted to a deity, such as a cleric, celestial, monitor, fiend, or other creature with divine spells, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your skill check. The GM might determine that a creature that despises all deities, such as an alghollthu, is unaffected.

Critical Success The creature is off-guard to your attacks until the end of your next turn.
Success The creature is off-guard against your attacks until the end of your current turn.

listCustomFeats.name: Domain Initiate (Priest)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Priest Dedication

Your deity bestows a special spell related to their powers. Select one domain—a subject of particular interest to you within your religion—from your deity’s list. You gain an initial domain spell for that domain, a spell unique to the domain and not available to other clerics. Each domain’s theme appears on page 39 and domain spells appear on pages 372–381.

Domain spells are a type of focus spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell, and you start with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You refill your focus pool during your daily preparations, and you can regain 1 Focus Point by spending 10 minutes using the Refocus activity to pray to your deity or do service toward their causes.

Focus spells are automatically heightened to half your level rounded up, much like cantrips. Focus spells don’t require spell slots, and can’t be cast using spell slots. Your focus pool can hold one Focus Point for each focus spell you have, up to 3 points. The full rules for focus spells appear on page 298.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different domain each time and gaining its domain spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Domain Mastery (Priest)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Priest Dedication; Domain Initiate

Your knowledge of your deities domains is flexible; with focus and preparation, you can change what powers you can access. During daily preparations, you can exchange one domain that you have gained through Domain Initiate for another; for example, if you worship Pharasma and have gained Death domain, you can exchange it for Fate, Healing, or Knowledge domain. You can also select one of your deity’s alternate domains; when you do so, it is always heightened to 1 level lower than usual for a focus spell. If you later gain the advanced domain spell for a domain you have gained through Domain Initiate, you also exchange the advanced domain spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Draconic Mutagen
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

You take on a draconic aspect while in your mutagenic form, causing your skin to grow scales and your back to hunch. When you gain this feat, select a draconic exemplar from the Dragonblood versatile heritage if you don’t already have one. While in mutagenic form, you gain the dragon trait and resistance to damage of your draconic exemplar’s type equal to 3 + your mutagen’s item bonus.

Additionally, you gain the Breath of the Dragon dragonblood ancestry feat; this action gains the mutagenic trait. If you already have this feat, it does not gain the mutagenic trait and you increase the die size of your breath by one while in mutagenic form.

listCustomFeats.name: Dreams of Beyond
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Researcher Dedication; expert in Occultism

In your sleep, your mind soars through the cosmos, observing and recording with little understanding and in ways that can be utterly terrifying or profound. Every morning, you awaken trained in a Lore skill determined by the GM, which you retain until the next time you rest for the night. This obtained lore is knowledge from the cosmos which drifts into your mind, random in nature but should be in some way relevant to the day ahead.

If you have at least five Eldritch Researcher feats, you awaken an expert in the Lore skill. If you are at least 14th level and have at least eight Eldritch Researcher feats, you awaken a master in the Lore skill.

listCustomFeats.name: Drinks for Free
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pirate Dedication; Charisma +3

Tales of your exploits are told throughout the world, with tavern keeps more than willing to grant you lodging for the prestige. You gain the A Home in Every Port general feat. Once per week per settlement (or once per day if the settlement is coastal), you can find a tavern willing to provide lodging for you and up to six allies. When you do so, along with the standard provisions, you are granted free drinks for the night. Additionally, whenever you would make a Diplomacy or Intimidation check while within a tavern, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the roll; this bonus increases to +2 if you’ve gained free lodging from that tavern with A Home in Every Port within the last week.

listCustomFeats.name: Dual Mind
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

Your twin minds allow you to offload mental effects onto your mutagenic form and vice-versa. You gain a +1 status bonus to Will saves. Whenever you fail a Will save while you have at least one usage of the Mutate action, you may choose to reroll the saving throw; if you succeed, you automatically switch to your mutagenic form if you are in your normal form, or into your normal form if you are in your mutagenic form. This counts as a usage of the Mutate action, but only expends it on a success.

listCustomFeats.name: Elbow Breaker (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication
Requirements You have a creature grabbed or restrained.

You bend your opponent’s body or limbs into agonizing positions that make it difficult for them to maintain their grip. Make an unarmed melee Strike against the creature you have grabbed or restrained. This Strike has the following effects in addition to its usual effects.

Critical Success You knock one held item out of the creature's grasp. It falls to the ground in the creature's space.
Success You weaken your target's grasp on the item. Further attempts to Disarm the target of that item gain a +2 circumstance bonus, and the target takes a –2 circumstance penalty to attacks with the item or other checks requiring a firm grasp on the item. The creature can end the effect by Interacting to change its grip on the item; otherwise, it lasts as long as the creature holds the item.

listCustomFeats.name: Elder Oath
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Researcher Dedication

Your studies have granted you an understanding of the truths of the world; that the outer gods and great old ones are all that is true in the world, and to bow before anything else is lunacy. Select an outer god or great old one; you begin to worship them as your deity, replacing any previous deities. You become trained in their divine skill, or expert if you are already trained. You have familiarity with their favored weapon–for the purposes of proficiency, you treat their favored weapon as a simple weapon if it is a martial weapon and a martial weapon if it is an advanced weapon. If you have a spell list or would gain one in future, you add their cleric spells to your spell list. These are all spells of your tradition, even if they normally would not be part of your tradition.

Additionally, your focus on your deity becomes worship instead of deep study. Any spells you gain from this archetype, including those you’ve already gained, become divine spells instead of arcane or occult. For spellcasting benefits granted by this archetype, you prepare divine spells from your spellbook instead of arcane or or occult.


Pathbuilder Note: Add the skill increase as a custom increase.

listCustomFeats.name: Eldritch Knowledge
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Researcher Dedication

Your research has informed you further and protects you from the mundane horrors of the world. You gain the Additional Lore skill feat for Aberration Lore. Additionally, you gain a +2 status bonus to saving throws against effects with the fear trait, as well as effects that inflict the confused condition. This bonus does not apply if the source of the effect has the aberration trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Eldritch Scoundrel Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites scoundrel's spellcraft

Your spell attacks deal additional damage to the unwary. When you deal sneak attack damage to a creature with a spell that costs two or more actions, your sneak attack dice become d8s.

listCustomFeats.name: Elemental Mindshift
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychokineticist Dedication

Your psychic potential is such that you can manifest psychic versions of your elements to assail your foes. Select one of your elements; any impulses of that element (including Elemental Blast) gain the mindshift trait.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different element each time.

listCustomFeats.name: Elixir Brewing
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Wandering Chef Dedication; expert in Crafting or Cooking Lore

Through practice and careful preparation, you can brew drinks that replicate the effects of elixirs. You can use your Quick Alchemy (and Advanced Alchemy, if you have it) from Wandering Chef to create alchemical elixirs in addition to other items. You immediately learn the recipes for 4 alchemical elixirs, which can be for any level of item you can create. These elixirs often take the forms of soups or broths, and require one minute to consume instead of their normal Activation time.

listCustomFeats.name: Emotional Intensity (Add as your 1st-level feat)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Yor gate is channeled through your emotions, leading to them being more potent and volatile. You must select Psychokineticist Dedication as your 2nd-level class feat.

Prerequisites: You must be a kineticist.

Psychokineticist Adjustments: You begin trained in Occultism instead of Nature. Replace the primal trait on all kineticist abilities and feats with the occult trait; in addition, Channel Elements gains the emotion and mental traits. Select Charisma or Wisdom; it becomes your key attribute. When you use Elemental Blast, your damage bonus for the 2-action version is equal to your modifier with your chosen attribute instead of your Constitution modifier. At 1st-level, you do not gain a Kineticist class feat (though you still gain your impulse feats from your gate choice as normal).

Elemental Psyche: Unlike most kineticists, you channel elemental power through your mind; in doing so, the energy ravages your mind and body and grants access to exceptional power. You gain the Unleash Elements free action.

Elemental Replenishment: Your body repairs itself innately with a mixture of psychic power and elemental material, allowing rest to alleviate the worst of your side effects. Each time you get a full night’s rest, your drained value is reduced to 0, and you regain hit points equal to the maximum hit points restored.

listCustomFeats.name: Emotional Surge (Psychokineticist)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychokineticist Dedication

Your heart soars, increasing your power for a moment. You gain a +2 status bonus to attack rolls and skill checks until the start of your next turn.

listCustomFeats.name: Endless Forms
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

Thanks to your newly acquired power, your physical appearance can bend and twist as you need it. You can cast humanoid form at will as a 5th-rank occult innate spell. When you do so, the effect lasts until dismissed.

listCustomFeats.name: Enhanced Familiar (Hellknight Signifier)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites a familiar
You infuse your familiar with additional primal energy, increasing its abilities. You can select four familiar or master abilities each day, instead of two.

listCustomFeats.name: Enhanced Familiar (SSS)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites a familiar
You infuse your familiar with additional primal energy, increasing its abilities. You can select four familiar or master abilities each day, instead of two.

listCustomFeats.name: Eternal Fear
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Sahkil Rejection
Requirements You are wearing your psychopomp mask and aren’t invisible

You temporarily contort your mask to terrify those around you. Spend 1 Mythic Point. Each creature within 30 feet that observes you must make a Will save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target becomes frightened 2.
Failure The target becomes frightened 3 and is fleeing as long as it's frightened. Even after recovering from the initial experience, the trauma is lodged in the target's mind for 1 year. Once per day, you can communicate telepathically with the target for 1 minute as long as you and the target are on the same plane. Any time a creature under the effect of Eternal Fear is in a stressful situation (such as combat or intense social pressure), they must succeed at a DC 11 flat check or become frightened 2. While Eternal Fear lasts, the target always becomes fleeing as long as it's frightened, regardless of the source of the fear. The target can attempt a new saving throw each week to remove these effects, but they can otherwise be removed only by powerful magic such as wish. You can Dismiss this secondary effect from a creature as a one action activity with the concentrate trait.
Critical Failure As failure, but the effects are permanent and the target doesn't get to attempt a weekly save to end the effect.
listCustomFeats.traits: Basic Mythic, Divine, Emotion, Fear, Incapacitation, Mental, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Ever-Watchful
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Watchful Blade Stance

You’re always prepared to take advantage of your opponent’s failed attacks. At the end of each of your turns while in Watchful Blade stance, you gain an additional reaction that you can only use to Reactive Lightning.

listCustomFeats.name: Expansive Spellcraft
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Scoundrel Dedication

You’ve adapted a wider array of spells to work with your sneak attacks. You can apply the benefits of your Piercing Spellcraft to any spell that deals damage and only targets a single creature. Additionally, if the target is off-guard, they get a -2 penalty to the saving throw against the spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Expert Eldritch Magic
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites master in Arcana or Occultism; Basic Eldritch Magic

You gain the expert bounded spellcasting benefits.

listCustomFeats.name: Expert Tapestric Spellcasting
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication; master in Occultism
