You gain the expert spellcasting benefits. You are a prepared spellcaster, and can prepare common spells from the occult spell list or any other occult spells you have access to. The spells you prepare in these slots must have the curse, darkness, extradimensional, fear, linguistic, mental, scrying, sleep, or teleportation traits.

listCustomFeats.name: Exquisite Lash
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pain Taster Dedication; Flagellation or Sacred Pain*

You imbue a strike with your own blood. You Flagellate, then Strike a creature with the flail you used in the action. If you hit, the attack gains a status bonus to damage equal to the amount of persistent bleed damage you are currently suffering. This counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty.

listCustomFeats.name: Extensive Collection
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; implement occultism

You keep an extensive collection of implements, utilizing their many powers to your benefit. You choose an additional implement, which must be a different type of implement than any of your others. You gain the initiate benefit of your new implement, as well as the associated cantrip. Select one of the associated domains for the implement you chose; you gain its initial domain spell.

Special You can select this feat again at 8th level or higher; when you do so, you gain the adept benefit for one of your implements. You can do so a third time at 18th level or higher; when you do so, you gain the paragon benefit for one of your implements.

listCustomFeats.name: Extradimensional Stash (Burglar)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Burglar Dedication, legendary in Thievery

When you perform sleight of hand, you fold space so that objects really do disappear. You create a small extradimensional space somewhere within in your clothing that can hold up to 5 Bulk worth of objects. The space functions as a bag of holding, but can hold only up to 5 Bulk, has no Bulk of its own, and can be Interacted with using only one hand.

In addition, when you Palm an Object, you can place it directly into this extradimensional space as long as the space has sufficient free space to hold the object.

listCustomFeats.name: Familial Feat (Conquerer)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You have learned specific skills from your upbringing. Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Familial Feat (Criminal)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You have learned specific skills from your upbringing. Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Familial Feat (Declining)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You have learned specific skills from your upbringing. Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Familial Feat (Ensorcelled)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You have learned specific skills from your upbringing. Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Familial Feat (Industrial)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You have learned specific skills from your upbringing. Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Familial Feat (Lawkeeper)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You have learned specific skills from your upbringing. Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Familial Feat (Legacy)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You have learned specific skills from your upbringing. Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Familial Feat (Merchant)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You have learned specific skills from your upbringing. Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You have learned specific skills from your upbringing. Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Familial Feat (Political)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You have learned specific skills from your upbringing. Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Familial Feat (Proprieter)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You have learned specific skills from your upbringing. Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Familial Feat (Royalty)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You have learned specific skills from your upbringing. Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Familial Weapon Training
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

Your family teaches you to wield a specific weapon with exceptional grace. Select a martial or advanced weapon that you have access to; you become trained in that weapon. Whenever your proficiency in any weapon increases to expert or beyond, you also gain that new proficiency with the chosen weapon.

listCustomFeats.name: Familiar (Hellknight Signifier)
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You make a pact with a creature that serves you and assists your spellcasting. You gain a familiar.

listCustomFeats.name: Familiar (SSS)
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You make a pact with a creature that serves you and assists your spellcasting. You gain a familiar.

listCustomFeats.name: Familiar Conduit (Implement Occultist)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; implement occultism; able to cast spells
Requirements You have line of effect to your familiar.

Under your tutelage, your familiar has grown attuned to the hidden currents of the world and can serve as a conduit for your magic. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell that has a range, the spell uses the familiar as its origin point.

listCustomFeats.name: Fancy Shooting
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites trained in simple and martial weapons

Select crossbows or firearms. You apply your precise strike damage on ranged Strikes you make with the weapons from the chosen group within that weapon’s first range increment. This also allows you to make ranged Strikes with weapons from the chosen weapon group for Confident Finisher and any other finisher that includes a Strike that can benefit from your precise strike. In the case of feats that require you to be wielding a melee weapon (such as Dual Finisher), you can be wielding a weapon from the chosen weapon group instead (matching the required number of hands, if mentioned); in the case of Swashbuckler feats that provide benefits to your agile or finesse melee weapons (such as Deadly Grace), these effects apply to weapons from your chosen weapon group as well.

Special You can select this feat an additional time, choosing the other weapon group.

listCustomFeats.name: Favorite Creation
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Craftsman Dedication

While most parents don’t play favorites, you certainly do. Select one weapon or set of armor you’ve crafted yourself. That weapon or armor becomes your favorite creation, and gains one initial weapon or armor modification, respectively, from the Inventor class. That item must still meet the requirements for the chosen modification, and doesn’t count as an innovation or gain any of the benefits associated (for example, the ability to Overdrive it). When you Craft a new item or upgrade an item with new runes, you can change your favorite creation to be that item.

Special You can select this feat again at 16th level, selecting a breakthrough modification for the same item. You can choose an initial modification instead if you prefer.

listCustomFeats.name: Fearless Master
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshwarper Dedication

Your undaunted and terrifying presence pushes your fleshwarps to act without mercy. Creatures with the fleshwarp trait that are under your control and within a 30-foot emanation around you gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, AC, saving throws, and skill checks as long as you aren’t frightened. Additionally, creatures affected by this aura are immune to the frightened condition as long as you aren’t frightened.

listCustomFeats.name: Feeling Your Oats (Noble Scion)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per hour
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication; trained in Deception

You are incredible, impeccable, an icon of style and grace—and everyone knows it. In this moment, you are living your fantasy, and no one can shake you out of it. Roll a Deception check. You can substitute the result of your Deception check for one Will save you would be required to attempt in the next minute.

listCustomFeats.name: Flagellation
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pain Taster Dedication
Requirements you are wielding a weapon in the flail weapon group

You flagellate yourself, drawing blood and providing clarity. You suffer persistent bleed damage equal to half your level, rounded up. Until you are no longer suffering from any form of persistent damage or one minute passes, you gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, Perception and Recall Knowledge checks, and Will and Fortitude saving throws. You do not roll to end this persistent damage at the end of the turn you use this ability.

listCustomFeats.name: Flawless Strike
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication

The wounds you inflict with your blade are gruesome. When you Strike with your chosen weapon, you critically succeed if you roll a 19 on the die as long as that result would be a success. This has no effect on a 19 if the result would be a failure.

listCustomFeats.name: Flesh Wound
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You fire to ensure that even if your shot doesn't land cleanly, it still lands close enough to deal some damage. Make a ranged Strike. It gains the following effect on a failure (though not a critical failure).

Failure Though your attack misses, it still deals one die of damage plus any damage from your weapon specialization class feature. This uses your weapon's normal damage die and damage type. This attack doesn't add extra damage from any other sources or abilities.
listCustomFeats.traits: Uncommon, Fighter, Inquisitor, Inventor, Ranger, Swashbuckler, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Fleshcraft Mutagens
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You can create elixirs infused with fleshwarping goo which can replicate grafts. You gain the advanced alchemy benefits. You can use advanced alchemy to create 3 alchemical consumables with the mutagen trait. You can use Medicine or Fleshwarp Lore instead of Crafting to Craft alchemical consumables with the mutagen trait. You don’t need to be trained in Crafting to do so, and you can use healer’s tools instead of alchemist’s tools. You also learn the formula for fleshcraft mutagens, a type of mutagen exclusive to the field of fleshcrafting that causes the drinker to temporarily grow grafts. Your formulas are stored in a formula book, but you memorize the formula for fleshcraft mutagens and don’t need to keep it written down.

Special You can select this feat again at 12th level or higher; when you do, the number of mutagens you can create with advanced alchemy increases to 5. You can do this again at 18th level or higher, increasing the number to 7.

Additionally, if you are an alchemist and gain this feat, instead of gaining the advanced alchemy benefits, you can create one additional item with advanced alchemy during your daily preparations for each time you take this feat. These items must have the mutagen trait

listCustomFeats.name: Fleshwarped Weapon
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
One of your arms has been warped to such an extent as to become a weapon in itself. While it takes the form of a weapon, it counts as an unarmed attack and has one of the following basic statistics, chosen upon gaining this feat:
- A small, swift weapon that deals 1d4 damage and has the agile and finesse traits.
- A moderately-sized weapon that deals 1d6 damage and has the finesse trait.
- A larger weapon that deals 1d8 damage.
Additionally, you select what type of damage it deals from the following options:
- A blunt weapon that deals bludgeoning damage and is in either the club or hammer weapon group.
- A pointed weapon that deals piercing damage and is in either the knife or spear weapon group.
- A sharp weapon that deals slashing damage and is in either the axe or sword weapon group.
This weapon also has the unarmed trait, and is built into your arm making it hard to conceal. At 5th level, whenever you get a critical hit with this weapon, you get its critical specialization effect.

Your features are mutable; you can select this feat at any level, and you can retrain into or out of this feat or change the type of attack you gain.

listCustomFeats.name: Fleshwarper Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Graft Technician; expert in Crafting or Fleshwarp Lore

You have learned to create fleshwarped creatures in an abominable alchemical process. You become a master in Crafting, Medicine, or Fleshwarp Lore, or another skill you are expert in if you are already a master in all three. You must be an expert in the chosen skill to become a master in it.

You learn the true fleshwarping ritual, as well as the true fleshwarping ritual to create one specific type of fleshwarp such as a grothlet. When acting as primary caster for the true fleshwarping ritual, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your primary check; you also grant this bonus to the Fortitude save made by the target as a secondary caster.

Pathbuilder Note: Add the skill increase as a custom increase.

listCustomFeats.name: Flowing Blade Stance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication
Requirements you are unarmored

You enter a stance where your strikes flow like water, allowing you to move around foes with ease. Once per round, when you Strike with your chosen weapon, you can immediately Step as a free action.

Additionally, while you are in this stance, your circumstance bonus to hit from Lightning Draw increases to +2.

listCustomFeats.name: Flowing Step
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Flowing Blade Stance

You flow through the battle, moving with speed as you stride. You gain the Feather Step general feat, ignoring its prerequisites. As long as your speed is at least 20 while in Flowing Blade Stance, you can Step 10 feet.

listCustomFeats.name: Flying Kick (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication

You launch yourself at a foe. Make a Leap or attempt a High Jump or Long Jump. At the end of the jump, if you're adjacent to a foe, you can immediately Strike that foe with an unarmed attack, even if the foe is in midair. You fall to the ground after the Strike. If the distance you fall is no more than the height of your jump, you land upright and take no damage.

listCustomFeats.name: Fogcraft
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Pirate Dedication; master in Nature or Occultism

Conjuring twisting fog into solid, familiar shapes, you craft a temporary vessel to carry you and your crew. By spending 10 minutes, you can conjure a vehicle that can be piloted using Sailing Lore whose level is less than or equal to your level - 3.

This vessel lasts for 8 hours or until destroyed, whichever comes first, and grants a +2 circumstance bonus to checks made to hide or camouflage it due to its unique composition. You also have a +2 circumstance bonus to Sailing Lore checks made to pilot your fogcraft. The ship otherwise functions as a normal version of the summoned vehicle, requiring the appropriate crew and being capable of carrying cargo; the latter is not recommended for long periods of time, as upon being destroyed or the duration ending, the ship dissipates back into fog, dropping any crew and cargo into the water. If you would create fogcraft while you have another one summoned, the original one is destroyed.

You can only summon the vehicle in the water. If you are at least 16th level, you can conjure the vehicle on land or sea, and it gains a land speed equal to its swim speed; when doing so, it appears to sail over the land without disturbing the ground.

Special This exploration activity gains your choice of the occult or primal traits. If you have the Shipmind feat, the fogcraft counts as your bound vessel in addition to the vessel you currently have bound.
listCustomFeats.traits: Rare, Archetype, Concentrate, Exploration, Summon, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Force Strike
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication

You can conjure force darts with ease, and enhance your darts with magical force. You learn the force barrage spell and add it to your spell collection (this does not count against the number of spells you can add to your spell collection each day). You can cast it at-will as an innate arcane spell, but you cannot heighten it when you do so and may only use the single-action variant. You also gain the force strike focus spell, which increases the number of force darts you can produce.

listCustomFeats.name: Force of Ego
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Psychokineticist Dedication
Requirements Your elements are unleashed

Your inner center keeps the wildly swinging elements and emotions from lashing back at you by forcing them to retreat. Your Unleash Elements ends, but you are not stupefied and don’t receive any emotional fallout effects. You cannot Unleash Elements again until the start of your next turn.
listCustomFeats.traits: Archetype, Emotion, Mental, Occult, Psyche, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Forge of Creation
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Crafted Reality; Suppliers in High Places

Through careful and difficult bending of planar magic, you have directly connected your extraplanar forge to Creation’s Forge just enough to fuel your crafting and not enough to harm any possible undead visitors. Your extraplanar forge counts as a settlement whose level is equal to your own for the purposes of Suppliers in High Places, but only for the purposes of acquiring materials. You can also utilize the raw power of creation to supplement your magic, allowing you to count as having supplied a casting of a spell of any rank or tradition while crafting there.

listCustomFeats.name: Form Lock (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication
Requirements You have a foe grabbed or restrained.

Your ability to control your own qi empowers you to pressure other creatures into resuming their true forms. Attempt an Athletics check to counteract a polymorph effect currently affecting your target. If the target is somehow under the effect of multiple polymorph effects, you can choose which one to attempt to counteract, or the GM chooses randomly if the separate effects aren't obvious. The target is then temporarily immune for 1 day.

listCustomFeats.name: Furious Form
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Master Chymist Dedication; not a Barbarian

Your mutagenic form has a far quicker temper than yourself which shows in the heat of battle. You gain the Barbarian Dedication archetype feat, ignoring its prerequisites; if you already have this feat, you may retrain it as part of gaining this feat. Your Rage action gains the mutagenic trait. When you use Mutate to transform into your mutagenic form, you can Rage as a free action. If you are raging when your mutagenic form ends, your rage also ends. You cannot use the Mutate action while in mutagenic form and raging.

listCustomFeats.name: Gift of Revelation
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Researcher Dedication

You can cast a creature’s mind into disarray by filling their mind with eldritch knowledge. You can cast confusion once per day as an occult innate spell heightened to half your level, rounded down. You become an expert in spell attack rolls and spell DCs.

If you are at least 14th level, you can instead cast never mind as an occult innate spell heightened to half your level, rounded down. In either case, while the spell is affecting a creature, their speech often devolves into a single word or phrase, such as “the end is never the end” or “halloween”.

listCustomFeats.name: Glide Through Space
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

You can alter your position in space, completely ignoring gravity or more mundane physical laws. You gain a fly speed equal to your walk speed. You don’t fall if you don't use the Fly action during your turn, nor if you’re knocked prone; instead, you remain hovering in the air, tilted at a strange angle until you right yourself. While you are prone and airborne, your Fly speed is reduced to your Crawl speed.

listCustomFeats.name: Godbreaker (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Crushing Grab; Whirling Throw
Requirements You have a creature grabbed or restrained.

You have mastered an ultimate grappling technique capable of breaking even the mightiest of foes. You hurl the creature 20 feet into the air, following behind it with a powerful jump, and then make an unarmed Strike. If the Strike is successful, you can repeat this process up to two more times, moving the creature an additional 20 feet directly up into the air with each Strike; the creature keeps the grabbed or restrained condition throughout the sequence. If you miss with any of the Strikes, Godbreaker and the grabbed or restrained condition immediately end and both you and the opponent fall, taking falling damage as normal for the total height of your jump.

If all three Strikes are successful, you immediately grab the creature and bring it crashing to the ground, dealing your unarmed Strike damage plus falling damage to it. You land on your feet adjacent to the creature, you take no damage from the fall, and the creature remains grabbed or restrained by you.

listCustomFeats.name: Graft Mastery
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your body’s strange physiology renders it perfect to accept grafts. Creatures attempting to affix a graft to you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks made to affix the graft, or increase their current circumstance bonus to doing so by +2. Additionally, you can invest one additional item with the graft trait each day; this increases to two additional items if you are at least master in Fortitude saves. Finally, you can use the higher of your class DC or spell DC instead of the graft’s DC for any grafts you have invested.

listCustomFeats.name: Grapple Ship
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Nest of Ropes
Requirements You are aboard your bound vessel

You twist the ropes of your ship to lunge out at another vessel, anchoring it to your own. Select a ship within 50 feet of your bound vessel; it must make a Fortitude saving throw against the higher of your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. On a failure, the ship’s movement speed is reduced by 10 feet, or 20 feet on a critical success. If this would reduce its speed below 0, it is pulled towards your bound vessel by the difference.

Each round, you can Sustain this effect to further reduce the vessel’s speed by the same amount. You can sustain this effect for up to a minute or until the tangle of ropes anchoring your ships is broken (64 HP, Hardness 4, AC 5 + your level). These ropes span between your vessels, and can be used to traverse between them. Any point within 15 feet of the side of the boat your ropes are anchored to counts as your vessel for the purposes of any Pirate abilities; this does not allow you to drive the vessel remotely using Mystic Sail.

Special This feat gains the occult or primal trait, matching the option you chose for the Shipmind feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Familial Feat (Conquerer)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Familial Feat

You have learned one of the greater talents of your family. Select one of your family’s Greater Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Familial Feat (Criminal)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Familial Feat

You have learned one of the greater talents of your family. Select one of your family’s Greater Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Familial Feat (Declining)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Familial Feat

You have learned one of the greater talents of your family. Select one of your family’s Greater Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Familial Feat (Ensorcelled)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Familial Feat

You have learned one of the greater talents of your family. Select one of your family’s Greater Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Familial Feat (Industrial)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Familial Feat

You have learned one of the greater talents of your family. Select one of your family’s Greater Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Familial Feat (Lawkeeper)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Familial Feat

You have learned one of the greater talents of your family. Select one of your family’s Greater Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Familial Feat (Legacy)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Familial Feat

You have learned one of the greater talents of your family. Select one of your family’s Greater Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Familial Feat (Merchant)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Familial Feat

You have learned one of the greater talents of your family. Select one of your family’s Greater Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Familial Feat (Otherworldly)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Familial Feat

You have learned one of the greater talents of your family. Select one of your family’s Greater Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Familial Feat (Political)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Familial Feat

You have learned one of the greater talents of your family. Select one of your family’s Greater Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Familial Feat (Proprietor)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Familial Feat

You have learned one of the greater talents of your family. Select one of your family’s Greater Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Familial Feat (Royalty)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Familial Feat

You have learned one of the greater talents of your family. Select one of your family’s Greater Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time. You cannot select the same feat twice, even if it could normally be taken multiple times.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Mutant Blood Magic
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mutant Blood Magic

You can cast the 3rd-rank and 4th-rank sorcerous gift spells from your chosen bloodline each once per day, as per Mutant Blood Magic. As with the 1st-rank and 2nd-rank spells, you gain the bloodline’s blood magic benefit when you do so.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Occult Knacks
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occult Knacks

Your magical repertoire has expanded to include a number of useful tools when dealing with magical threats and cursed objects. You can cast hypercognition, locate, and object reading as occult innate spells, each once per day. When you cast this object reading spell, it’s automatically heightened to half your level rounded up.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Sailor’s Spells
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sailor’s Spells; master in Nature or Occultism

You’ve expanded upon the spells you use to work on the sea. You can cast gentle landing, gust of wind, water breathing, and water walk each once per day as innate spells of your sailor’s spells tradition.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater School Understanding
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites School Understanding

You’ve learned further about your other wizard school. You gain the advanced school spell from the wizard school you chose with School Understanding.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Spellshape Knowledge
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication

You can exchange your spellshapes to suit different situations. When you make your daily preparations, you gain one arcanist archetype feat or wizard feat of 8th level or lower with the spellshape trait that you meet the prerequisites for and don't already have. You can use that feat until your next daily preparations.

Alternatively, you can choose to replace one of your spellshape feats with a different spellshape feat. This follows the same rules as retraining; you can replace spellshape feats gained through your class feats or through class features that grant you spellshape feats.

Pathbuilder Note: Add the chosen feat as a custom feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Urban Bond
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Urban Bond

You can call upon stronger magic with aid of the cities you have visited. You gain an advanced domain spell from one of your domains you selected with Urban Bond, gaining it as an Order spell.

Special You can select this feat multiple times. Each time, you must select a different advanced domain spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Greater Weapon Implement
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; implement occultism; weapon implement

You draw upon the power of your weapon implement to wield it effectively, even if it would normally be beyond your skillset. You have familiarity with all advanced weapons in your implement’s weapon group–for the purpose of proficiency, you treat any advanced weapons in your implement’s weapon group as martial weapons. Additionally, you can choose a two-handed weapon to be your weapon implement. You can use Implement’s Empowerment when wielding a two-handed weapon as long as that weapon is your weapon implement.

listCustomFeats.name: Grudging Compliment (Noble Scion)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication
Trigger An enemy within 30 feet damages you or succeeds at a skill check.

Every Firebrand can recognize the skill of others, but you've turned it into an art you can wield in combat. You compliment a foe's form or technique, and your unexpected praise distracts them from their surroundings. Attempt a Diplomacy check against that enemy's Will DC. Regardless of your result, they are temporarily immune to your Grudging Compliments for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target becomes flat-footed for 1 round.
Success The target becomes flat-footed against your attacks for 1 round.

listCustomFeats.name: Hardened Skin
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pain Taster Dedication

Your flesh has hardened to the point that it resists the kiss of most physical damage. You can etch fundamental and property runes into your skin as if it were clothing, granting you their benefits as long as you are unarmored. While you are unarmored, you gain resistance to physical damage equal to the value of your skin’s potency rune.

listCustomFeats.name: Haunting Melody
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per 10 minutes
Prerequisites Psychopomp Dedication; you do not have the Sakhil Rejection feat
Requirements you are wearing your psychopomp mask and aren’t invisible

You can channel power into your mask, whistling or singing an entrancing tune. Each living or undead enemy within a 30-foot emanation that can see you must attempt a Will save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC.

This effect lasts until the end of your next turn, but you can Sustain it. If you were invisible at the start of your turn, all targets suffer a -1 status penalty to the saving throw. Despite being a mental effect, this ability affects mindless undead; creatures with the psychopomp or sahkil trait, however, are immune to this ability.

Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to your haunting melody for 24 hours.
Failure The creature is fascinated by you. If the creature is attacked, the fascination ends.
Critical Failure As failure, but it must spend each of its actions on its turn to move closer to you as expediently as possible while avoiding obvious dangers. If a fascinated creature is adjacent to you, it stays still and doesn't act.
listCustomFeats.traits: Basic Mythic, Auditory, Concentrate, Divine, Mental, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Hazardous Blood
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger A creature critically hits you with a melee Strike

Your blood, while entirely normal for you, is too magically potent for other creatures to come in contact with. The creature must attempt a Fortitude save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC. On a failure, the creature takes 3d6 persistent acid damage, or 6d6 persistent acid damage on a critical failure. If you are at least 17th level, this damage increases to 4d6 on a failure or 8d6 on a critical failure.

listCustomFeats.name: Head Stomp (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication

Make an unarmed melee Strike against a prone target. If it hits, until the end of your next turn the target is stupefied 1 (or stupefied 2 on a critical hit) and off-guard.

listCustomFeats.name: Healthy Physiology
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Your body is particularly hardy and resilient. You gain your choice of either the Diehard or Toughness general feat.

Special You can select this feat an additional time, gaining the other option.

listCustomFeats.name: Hell’s Command
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per 10 minutes
Prerequisites Hellknight Armiger Dedication; master in Intimidation

Your voice echoes with a powerful command. You cast command at 1st rank as a divine innate spell, using your class DC or spell DC (whichever is higher).

listCustomFeats.name: Hell’s Knight
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Hellknight Dedication; expert in Hell Lore

You can imbue your weapon with hellish might. Select one weapon or handwraps of mighty blows. While you wield that weapon, it counts as being cold iron, and gains either the flaming or unholy property rune. During your daily preparations, you can change the weapon this effect applies to, grant a different rune, or both. If you are at least 18th level, you can select a greater flaming rune instead.

listCustomFeats.name: Holy Rites
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Priest Dedication

You have been taught a number of religious rites and rituals which can bless in the name of your deity. You learn the consecrate and heartbond rituals. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all Religion checks made as the primary or secondary caster in a ritual.

At 8th level and every 4 levels thereafter, you learn another uncommon ritual with a level no higher than half your level and for which you meet the prerequisites.

listCustomFeats.name: Home-Grown Symbiote
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your body has developed a symbiotic parasite that absorbs ambient magic. You gain the Ostilli Host Dedication feat, ignoring its prerequisites. If your ostilli would be removed, it immediately dies and your body regrows a new one over the course of a week without you needing to spend downtime.

listCustomFeats.name: Honest Worker
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Patchmen culture emphasizes the value of honest work and contribution to the community as a whole. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to non-Charisma-based skill checks made when performing an exploration or downtime activity. Additionally, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to Aid. Finally, you gain the Additional Lore skill feat for Labor Lore.

listCustomFeats.name: Horrific Alchemy
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshcraft Mutagens
Requirements You are holding an extract of agony or fleshcraft mutagen

Instead of imbibing the mutagen, you shake it and throw it at a creature, the toxic chemicals causing the creature to twist and warp. Make a ranged attack using the required fleshcraft mutagen. It counts as an alchemical bomb with the acid, alchemical, bomb, consumable, and infused traits. If you hit, the target takes 4d8 acid damage with a Fortitude saving throw against the higher of your class DC or spell DC. This effect has the incapacitation trait.

Critical Success The target takes half damage.
Success The target takes full damage and is drained 1.
Failure The target takes full damage and their body begins to twist under the mutating effects. The target is drained 2, and is clumsy 2 and sickened 2 until they regain hit points from an effect with the vitality or void trait.
Critical Failure As failure, but they gain the fleshwarp trait and are clumsy 3 and slowed 1. This trait and these conditions last until they are targeted by an effect that can regrow limbs, such as the regenerate spell.

Level (+2) The acid damage increases by 1d8.

listCustomFeats.name: Horrific Presence
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sahkil Rejection

Your very presence is horrifying to those around you, only growing more powerful when they move to attack you. While you are wearing your psychopomp mask, you can cast mask of terror at will as a divine innate spell, targeting only yourself. When you do so, its duration becomes indefinite, and you can Dismiss it. When a creature makes a saving throw against this effect, you can use the higher of your class DC or spell DC. The spell automatically ends when you remove your psychopomp mask.

listCustomFeats.name: Host of War
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; implement occultism

You’ve trained in the utilization of heavier armor into your combat style. You are trained in heavy armor. Whenever you gain a thaumaturge class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in medium armor, you also gain that proficiency in heavy armor.

listCustomFeats.name: Igor!
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshwarper Dedication; a retainer***

You’ve taught your retainer to act as a lab assistant, even if they aren’t on your level of brilliance. Your retainer gets an automatic success (but not critical success) when acting as a secondary caster for the true fleshwarping ritual if they aren’t the target; when they do so, they increase your circumstance bonus to the ritual by +1. Additionally, your retainer can perform the Craft downtime activity, but only to Craft fleshwarping goo when doing so through this feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Impairing Terror
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sahkil Rejection

You can warp the minds of creatures you terrify so thoroughly that it impares basic cognitive functions. While you are wearing your psychopomp mask, any creature that has the frightened condition is also off-guard against your attacks. When you inflict a creature with the frightened condition or increase their frightened value, you can spend 1 Mythic Point. If you do so, the target becomes stupefied for as long as they are frightened, with a stupefied value equal to their frightened value

listCustomFeats.name: Implement’s Focus
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; implement occultism

You draw further power from each of your implements when you maintain them. When you Refocus, you regain all your Focus Points instead of 1.

listCustomFeats.name: Impose Ego Death
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychokineticist Dedication

You channel your psychic might through your gate and into a creature’s mind, possibly obliterating their mental faculties entirely. Target creature within 30 feet takes 16d10 mental damage with a basic Will save against your class DC. A creature affected by this impulse is stunned 1 on a success, stunned 2 on a failure, or stunned 4 on a critical failure.

If this ability would reduce the target to 0 hit points, their mental faculties are annihilated, permanently reducing its Intelligence modifier to -5 and granting it the mindless trait. Such an occurrence sends the soul of the creature onto the River of Souls as if it died, but leaves the body concious and living but entirely unintelligent. If the creature’s level is less than or equal to your level - 3, you may choose to gain that creature as a minion. This gives it the minion trait, meaning it can use 2 actions when you command it, and commanding it is a single action that has the auditory and concentrate traits. You can have a maximum of four minions under your control. If not taken as a minion, the target’s autonomous functions remain but will likely starve to death due to a lack of willpower to feed itself.

Level (20th) The damage increases to 18d10.
listCustomFeats.traits: Archetype, Impulse, Incapacitation, Mental, Nonlethal, Occult, Overflow, Psyche, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Improved Familiar (Implement Occultist)
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You find it easy to attract a powerful and unusual familiar to your side. The number of abilities required to make your familiar a specific familiar is two lower than normal.

listCustomFeats.name: Improved Familiar (SSS)
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You find it easy to attract a powerful and unusual familiar to your side. The number of abilities required to make your familiar a specific familiar is two lower than normal.

listCustomFeats.name: Improved Knockback (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Knockback Strike

When you successfully Shove a creature, increase both the distance you can push the creature and the distance you can move to follow along with the target by 5 feet on a success or 10 feet on a critical success. If you push the target into another creature or obstacle, they both take 1d6 bludgeoning damage per 5 feet of movement that was prevented.

listCustomFeats.name: Improved Poison Weapon (SSS)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Poison Weapon

You deliver poisons in ways that maximize their harmful effects. When you apply a simple poison with Poison Weapon, the poison deals 2d4 poison damage instead of 1d4 poison damage. You don't waste a poison you apply with Poison Weapon on a critically failed attack roll.

listCustomFeats.name: In the Minds of Artists
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

Your magic affects creatures with exceptional creativity more than it does others, bypassing their normal resistances in favor of their passion. When a creature makes a saving throw against one of your mental spells, they suffer a -2 status penalty to the saving throw if the modifier for their Crafting, Performance, or Lore skill related to the arts is greater than or equal to their lowest save modifier. This penalty increases to -4 if that modifier is greater than or equal to their highest save modifier. This penalty doesn’t apply to creatures with the mindless trait.

Additionally, once per day, you can cast nightmare as an occult innate spell. You can only target a creature that would suffer either of the status penalties when you do so; otherwise, the spell automatically fails to take effect and is wasted. When a creature fails their saving throw against this spell, you become an expert in a Lore skill related to the target’s artistic talent (such as Painting Lore or Dance Lore) until you cast this spell again.

listCustomFeats.name: Incredible Familiar (Implement Occultist)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Enhanced Familiar

Your familiar is imbued with even more magic than other familiars. You can select a base of six familiar or master abilities each day, instead of four.

listCustomFeats.name: Incredible Familiar (SSS)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Enhanced Familiar

Your familiar is imbued with even more magic than other familiars. You can select a base of six familiar or master abilities each day, instead of four.

listCustomFeats.name: Indomitable Stance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Armored Hulk
Requirements you are wearing heavy armor

You enter a stance that makes you an immovable threat. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex and Fortitude DCs against actions with the attack trait. If you end your turn without moving from your position and are Raging, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls made using a reaction (such as attacks made with Reactive Strike) until the start of your next turn.

listCustomFeats.name: Inescapable Grasp (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication

Your grasp has a supernatural quality to it, preventing your foes from easily escaping—with or without magical assistance. If a creature you have grabbed attempts to use a teleportation spell or effect, it must succeed at a DC 15 flat check or the spell fails. If a creature you have grabbed attempts to Escape while under the effect of unfettered movement or a similar effect, it must succeed at a DC 15 flat check or be forced to roll the Escape attempt normally, rather than automatically succeeding.

listCustomFeats.name: Infernal Armor
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Hellknight Dedication; master in Hellknight plate and Hell Lore

Your armor is magically imbued with the power of hell itself. While wearing your Hellknight plate, you gain darkvision, and gain resistance to fire and poison damage equal to 1 + your number of class feats from the Hellknight archetype and other Hellknight-related archetypes.

listCustomFeats.name: Innate Telepathy
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You can communicate telepathically with creatures at a moment’s notice. You are constantly under the effects of a 4th-rank telepathy spell, except it has a range of 15 feet. If you are at least 17th level, the telepathy spell is heightened to 6th rank; its range does not increase.

listCustomFeats.name: Insightful Slice
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Watchful Blade Stance

Your sword can cut through things with a single stroke, targeting weak points and destroying them. While in Watchful Blade Stance, Strikes with your chosen weapon ignore resistance to any physical damage (such as resistance to slashing, piercing, or physical), resistance to all damage (such as the resistances of ghosts or similar spectral creatures), and Hardness (such as that on an animated object). Additionally, your Lightning Draw attacks deal additional precision damage equal to twice the number of damage dice.

listCustomFeats.name: Inspect Aura
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication

You can take in the aura of a creature, reading information about them with uncanny accuracy. You gain the Aura Sight skill feat. Instead of once per hour, you can use this ability once per 10 minutes. Additionally, when focusing on a target, you can learn any of the following additional pieces of information:
- Whether or not they are under the effects of a curse, including curses caused by magic items or by Oracle abilities.
- Whether or not they are under a polymorph or illusion effect.
- Whether or not they are a living creature.
For each of these options, you do not learn any specifics other than a yes or no.

listCustomFeats.name: Inspire Confidence
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

Perhaps in spite of your character flaws, you are capable of inspiring confidence in your allies. You gain the uplifting overture composition cantrip as a focus cantrip. Focus cantrips don’t cost Focus Points, but also do not grant you a focus point. You can use Diplomacy instead of Performance when using uplifting overture; when you do so, it gains the auditory and linguistic traits.

listCustomFeats.name: Instant Abomination
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Fleshwarper Dedication

You have learned to create small vials of concentrated fleshwarping goo, allowing you to create unstable abominations in an instant. You throw this vial at a location within 20 feet, summoning a creature that has the aberration, construct, or fleshwarp trait whose level is less than or equal to your level - 4. The chosen creature must be wholly or almost wholly biological and have an Intelligence modifier no higher than +2; for example, it can be used to summon a charnel creation or shoggoth, but cannot summon an iron warden or alghollthu master. This creature remains for 1 minute, after which it collapses back into a puddle of useless and disgusting protoplasm. You can use an action on your turn to Command a Minion; otherwise, the creature does not act due to the shock of having just been created.

If you are holding an extract of agony, you can use a free action as part of this activity to throw it onto the summoned creature.

Special If you have access to the Quick Alchemy action, it gains the follow additional option:
- Brew Abomination You quickly mix together ingredients and samples of flesh to create some more unstable fleshwarping goo. Your Instant Abomination action recharges.

listCustomFeats.name: Instant Backup
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger Your attack with a firearm misfires.

Even as your firearm misfires, you quickly draw a backup weapon. Release the misfired weapon and Interact to draw a different weapon that requires the same number of hands or fewer.
listCustomFeats.traits: Uncommon, Fighter, Inquisitor, Inventor, Ranger, Swashbuckler, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Invisible Thief
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Scoundrel Dedication; basic spellcasting benefits

You manipulate your magics to temporarily become invisible. Once per day, you can cast invisibility as an innate spell of your spellcasting archetype’s tradition. At 10th level, this spell is heightened to 4th rank.

listCustomFeats.name: Jin Speaker
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; Enhanced Familiar; implement occultism

You’ve learned the secret to binding a gennayn to your service, a small elemental genie who can aid you in a number of ways. You can select the Gennayn specific familiar; when you do so, the number of abilities required to make your familiar a Gennayn is three lower than normal (or five lower if you have the Improved Familiar feat). In addition, if your familiar is a gennayn, you gain access to the initial domain spell for the domain associated with your gennayn’s element; for example, you gain access to the initial domain spell for the Fire domain if your gennayn is a fire gennayn.

Special If you would later gain the Advanced Implement Domain feat, you can gain the advanced domain spell for your gennayn’s domain.

listCustomFeats.name: King of the Pirates
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pirate Dedication

You are king of any deck you walk aboard, with pirates across the world knowing your name. While aboard any ship, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, AC, saving throws, and skill checks. Additionally, you are permanently quickened. You can only use this extra action for the following activities:
- Drive or Mystic Sail, or as part of the two- or three-action version of that action.
- Run Over, Stop, or Take Control of a vessel.
- Aim, Load, or Launch a siege weapon.

listCustomFeats.name: Knockback Strike (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication

You focus your strength into a blow powerful enough to push an enemy away from you. Make an unarmed Strike. If you hit, attempt an Athletics check to Shove the target. This attack uses the same multiple attack penalty as your Strike, and doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty.

listCustomFeats.name: Knockout Punch
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per minute
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication

You unleash a devastating attack that can stun or even fully knock out an enemy. Make a melee unarmed Strike, with a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll if you dealt damage to the target with a melee Strike since the start of your last turn. If the attack hits, the target must make a Fortitude save against your class DC. This effect has the incapacitation trait. The target suffers a -2 circumstance penalty to this saving throw if the attack was a critical hit.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.
Success The creature is stunned 1.
Failure The creature is stunned 3.
Critical Failure The creature is knocked unconscious for one minute.

listCustomFeats.name: Knowledge of Self
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Researcher Dedication

Inherent knowledge of your very being allows you to sense when someone utters your name. You can mentally sense whenever someone (referred to as a speaker) speaks your full name within a 1-mile emanation centered on yourself. You gain a vague sense of the speaker’s identity, such as “a local farmer” or “a halfling in distress,” unless the speaker is someone you have met and interacted with before, in which case you recognize the speaker specifically.

As a reaction within 1 minute of the speaker’s utterance, you can send the speaker a telepathic prompt, asking if they intend to summon you. If they respond affirmatively, you know innately the direction of where the speaker named you and how far away that point was. This knowledge lasts until you use the reaction to ask another creature again.

At 10th level, the radius of this effect increases to 5 miles; later, it increases to 25 miles at 16th level and 100 miles at 20th level.

listCustomFeats.name: Knowledgeable Response
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Knowledge of Self

You can open a psychic connection with creatures that utter your name. When you utilize the reaction granted by a speaker saying your full name and the creature responds affirmatively, instead of knowing their direction and distance, you can establish a two-way telepathic link with the creature for up to one minute, during which you can communicate with the speaker if you share a language. Once you do so, you cannot do so again for the next hour. You can Dismiss this link.

At 16th level, the duration of this link increases to up to 5 minutes; at 20th level, this increases further to up to 10 minutes.

listCustomFeats.name: Lantern’s Light
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites lamplighter methodology

You can channel powerful light through your lantern and willpower. You can cast revealing light once per day as an occult innate spell, heightened to half your level. The source of this spell is your lantern, and you must be wielding your lantern to cast it. The DC for these spells is equal to your class DC.

If you would gain the Adept Benefits for your Lantern implement, you can instead cast cloak of light or holy light, also as innate occult spells heightened to half your level. If you gain the Paragon Benefits for your Lantern implement, you can cast one of these spells an additional time each day.

listCustomFeats.name: Leaps and Bounds
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

Your mutated physique allows you to move across the battlefield with powerful leaps. While in your mutagenic form, the distance you can move with a vertical Leap increases to 5 feet and the distance for a horizontal Leap increases to 15 feet if your Speed is at least 15 feet, or to 20 feet if your Speed is at least 30 feet.

Additionally, when you Leap while in your mutagenic form, your movement doesn’t trigger reactions, and you treat falls as 50 feet shorter. If you are a master in Fortitude saves, you always land on your feet and don’t take damage, regardless of the distance you fall.

listCustomFeats.name: Learning from Failure
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Craftsman Dedication

You’ve found you learn best from failure, with each mistake being an opportunity for growth. When you roll a critical failure to Craft an item for which you have the formula, you get a failure instead. Additionally, when you fail or critically fail a check to Craft an item, you gain a +1 status bonus to your next attempt to Craft that same item within the next week.

listCustomFeats.name: Legendary Knockout
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Knockout Punch

Such a legendary brawler you are that your every punch can be a knockout. Your Knockout Punch can be used once per round. Once a creature is hit by your Knockout Punch, it is temporarily immune to your Knockout Punch for the next minute.

listCustomFeats.name: Lingering Pain
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication

You can cause the magic of your spells to cling to your enemies. You learn your choice of the acidic burst, breathe fire, chilling spray, grim tendrils, or thunderstrike spell and add it to your spell collection (this does not count against the number of spells you can add to your spell collection each day). You also gain the lingering pain focus spell, which causes elemental damage to become persistent.

listCustomFeats.name: Living Meal
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Access You have access to this feat if you are an undead creature or are from a country with a notable undead population such as Geb
Prerequisites Wandering Chef Dedication

You know methods to prepare the flesh of humanoids such that they meet the less prepared tastes of undead creatures. When a creature eats alchemical food you’ve made using the flesh of a sapient creature, they count as having sated their craving. If the creature consuming the meal is a Ghoul, they become satiated for 1 hour.

listCustomFeats.name: Loaner Spell (SSS)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Scoundrel Dedication; basic spellcasting benefits

During your daily preparations, you can gain the assistance of an allied spellcaster to prepare one spell for the day. The spell can be up to 2nd rank. Your ally must be able to cast it from a spell slot, and you must be at least trained in the skill associated with the spell’s tradition. You can cast the prepared spell once that day without expending a spell slot, heightened to 2nd rank. If this spell isn’t normally on your archetype’s spell list, it counts as a spell of your archetype’s tradition when you prepare it this way.

Special If you have expert spellcasting benefits, you can instead select a spell of 4th rank or lower; it is automatically heightened to 4th rank. If you have master spellcasting benefits, you can instead select a spell of 6th rank or lower; it is automatically heightened to 6th rank.

listCustomFeats.name: Lockpicker’s Fingers
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Burglar Dedication

You can masterfully pick locks and disable devices, even on a crunch. When you succeed or critically succeed a check to Disable a Device or Pick a Lock, you achieve one additional success toward disabling that device or opening that lock. Additionally, if you are at least a master in Thievery, whenever you roll a critical failure on a check to Pick a Lock, you get a failure instead.

listCustomFeats.name: Maddening Gaze
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per minute
Prerequisites Eldritch Researcher Dedication

You focus your gaze upon a single living creature within 30 feet, inundating its mind with visions of alien horror and dealing 4d6 mental damage with a basic Will save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target takes half damage and is sickened 1 for 1 minute.
Failure The target takes full damage and is sickened 2 for 1 minute.
Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is sickened 2 for 1 minute and confused for as long as they are sickened.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

listCustomFeats.name: Magical Supremacy
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication; your maximum focus points is 3

Such is your connection to your innate and learned magic that you can store it in even greater quantities. The maximum number of focus points in your focus pool increases to 4, ignoring the normal limits.

listCustomFeats.name: Manifest Jin
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Jin Speaker
Requirements You are within 60 feet of your familiar and wielding your implement

You can temporarily enhance your gennayn to extraordinary levels, causing it to manifest as a powerful elemental or even genie. Summon a common creature that has the elemental trait and a level no greater than your level – 4; alternatively, you can summon a common or uncommon creature with the genie trait and a level no greater than your level - 3. In either case, the chosen creature must have the same elemental trait as your gennayn.

This creature gains the summoned trait. This creature appears in the same space as your familiar, which disappears for the duration of this ability. You can Sustain this ability for up to 1 minute. When the ability ends, the familiar appears in the space the summoned elemental occupied.

listCustomFeats.name: Masked Casting (SSS)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Hellknight Signifer Dedication
Trigger You begin Casting a Spell.
Requirements You are wearing your signifer’s mask.

You harness the magical energy flowing through your eyeless mask to effortlessly protect you from visual effects. You Avert your Gaze.

listCustomFeats.name: Mass Production
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Practiced Specialty; master in Crafting

You can Craft multiple items of your specialty at an exceptional pace. When you Craft items from your specialty, you can do so in a batch, making up to four of the same item at once with a single check. Like normal batch crafting, you need to include the raw materials for all the items in the batch at the start, you must complete the batch all at once, and this doesn’t change your rate of progress for days past the base downtime spent. If an item from your specialty can already be created in batches, you create four times as many; this stacks with other effects that would multiply the effect (such as efficient alchemy). If you are legendary in crafting, you can create eight of the same item, or eight times as many in a batch.

listCustomFeats.name: Massive Mutagen
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

Your body grows to incredible size when you mutate. While in mutagenic form, you become Large, increasing your reach to 10 feet. Your equipment grows with you.

listCustomFeats.name: Master Chymist Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Advanced Alchemy or Quick Alchemy which can be used to create alchemical mutagens

Whether through accident or intent, your imbibing of mutagens has caused a second, more monstrous personality to emerge within you. You learn the recipe for two 6th-level or lower alchemical mutagens. You gain the Mutate action, which allows you to transform into your mutagenic form. Whenever you use a mutagen, you automatically use the Mutate action as part of the same action, without counting against the number of daily uses.

Your mutagenic form is an alter ego that has different edicts and anathema from your own, an outgrowth of the mental changes caused by your frequent imbibing of mutagens you produce. Your mutagenic form shares memories and basic goals with your normal personality, but goes about meeting these goals in a different manner. Your mutagenic form is often ugly and monstrous, possibly appearing as a different ancestry or gender entirely to the point that you may look like two entirely different people. Your mutagenic form has its own name, and may attempt to maintain independent relationships and strongholds, although doing so may be difficult given their limited time existing. You and your mutagenic form may have a good or bad relationship, but are ultimately the same being and wouldn’t act against what you each believe is your own best interest.

While you are in your normal form, whenever you would suffer a critical hit or fail a Fortitude save while you have at least one usage of Mutate remaining for the day, you must make a Will saving throw against a Hard DC for your level. On a failure, you immediately use Mutate as a free action, counting towards your number of daily uses.

Special You can take Mastery Chymist Dedication even if you haven’t yet gained three feats from the alchemist multiclass archetype, and you can take Alchemist Dedication even if you haven’t yet gained three feats from the master chymist archetype. You can’t select another dedication feat until you’ve gained two other feats from the alchemist or master chymist archetypes.

listCustomFeats.name: Master Eldritch Magic
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites legendary in Arcana or Occultism; Expert Eldritch Magic

You gain the master bounded spellcasting benefits.

listCustomFeats.name: Master Tapestric Spellcasting
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Expert Tapestric Spellcasting; legendary in Occultism

You gain the master spellcasting benefits.

listCustomFeats.name: Master of Grafts
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshwarper Dedication

Your skill with fleshwarping grants you mastery over the creation and application of grafts. You gain the Graft Mastery fleshwarp ancestry feat. You can use Crafting or Fleshwarp Lore instead of Medicine to implant a graft. When making a check to implant a graft, you treat the result as if it were one degree of success better.

listCustomFeats.name: Master of Many Styles (Sword Saint)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Opening Stance
Trigger Your turn begins

You move fluidly between stances, using your mastery of combat to always adopt the best tactics. You use an action with the stance trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Master of Monsters
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshwarper Dedication

You give orders to your minions with incredible ease, directing them to fight your battles for you. You’re permanently quickened. You can use your extra action only to Command a Minion with the fleshwarp trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Master of Piercings
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Access You are from Nidal or worship Zon-Kuthon
Prerequisites Pain Taster Dedication; Magical Crafting

You know the methods to produce Nidalese Shadow Piercings, magical piercings infused with shadow magic that can enhance your abilities and pain. You learn the formulas for all items with the graft, magical, and shadow traits, and gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Crafting check to Craft those items. Additionally, you can invest one more magic item than normal, so long as that item has the graft, magical, and shadow traits.

listCustomFeats.name: Masterful Bladework
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites expert in simple and martial weapons

You gain a sense of satisfaction for excellent weapon-play. When you critically Strike with an agile or finesse melee weapon, you gain panache.

listCustomFeats.name: Masterful Mobility
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Ancestral Mobility

Your mastery over your body has improved to the point that less-natural mobility options become second nature to you. Each of your mobility options from the Ancestral Mobility feat improve according to the list below.
- Your Swim speed increases to 25 feet or your land speed, whichever is higher.
- Your Climb speed increases to 25 feet or your land speed, whichever is higher.
- Your wings evolve to their full potential. You have a fly speed of 15 feet at all times. When you use Fledgling Flight, your fly speed increases to 25 feet for that action.
- You can Crawl and Squeeze at your full Speed.

listCustomFeats.name: Mend Soul
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychopomp Dedication; you do not have the Sakhil Rejection feat

While the role of a psychopomp is to usher the dead to their rest, they are also capable of healing souls in need. You touch an injured creature, restoring hit points equal to twice your level. The creature is then immune to this effect for one day, or one hour if you have the Battle Medicine or Continual Recovery skill feats. If you have the Stitch Flesh feature, you can use this feature on undead.

listCustomFeats.name: Mental Overflow
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychokineticist Dedication

Elemental energy pours into your mind, filling it with strange planer echoes and elemental humors. Recall Knowledge using a Lore skill of your choice, even if you are not trained in it. You count your proficiency with that lore skill as being trained, or expert if you are legendary in your kineticist class DC. You gain a status bonus to this check equal to the value of your drained condition.
listCustomFeats.traits: Archetype, Impulse, Mental, Occult, Overflow, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Mixed Maneuver (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication

You leverage your knowledge of martial arts to mix different maneuvers together into a single flowing combination. Choose any two of Grapple, Reposition, Shove, and Trip. Attempt both of the attacks you chose against the same or different creatures, but don't apply the multiple attack penalty until after resolving both attacks.

listCustomFeats.name: Monstrous Ingredients
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Wandering Chef Dedication; trained in Survival

Given the scarcity of good ingredients when adventuring, you’ve learned how to make the most of the monsters you slay. You can spend one minute over the corpse of a creature to harvest it for ingredients; creatures with the summon trait cannot be harvested as their bodies dissipate too quickly. When you do so, roll to Earn Income using Survival, with a task level equal to the creature’s level. This counts as one day of earning income, and instead of gold grants you cooking ingredients with a value equal to twice the gold you would have earned.

These materials are worthless (and likely unappetizing) when sold but can be used to supplement gold when crafting items you could normally make with Wandering Chef’s Quick Alchemy (typically alchemical food); foods made using these materials are similarly worthless when sold due to the bizarre ingredients. The Bulk of these ingredients is negligible. You can only harvest ingredients from a creature once, but you can use the same result for the next hour when doing so on creatures using the same stat block.

listCustomFeats.name: Morning Work
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Craftsman Dedication

Even while out adventuring, you’ve learned to get some crafting time in. During your daily preparations, you can use the Craft downtime action, even though it is not downtime mode. When you do so, you reduce the amount of materials needed by the trained value for your level - 1, or the trained value for your level on a critical success. This can be used to continue crafting items that you started during downtime, and only uses the trained value while you are working on it during your daily preparations. You cannot do this and perform another downtime activity on the same day.

listCustomFeats.name: Munitions Crafter
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Bullets and bombs can be scarce in some parts, so you’ve learned to make your own. You become trained in Crafting and gain the advanced alchemy benefits. You can use the advanced alchemy benefits to create a number of daily consumables equal to 4 + half your level (rounded up); these consumables must be bombs or alchemical ammunition.

You gain a formula book that includes the formula for black powder and four 1st-level types of common or uncommon alchemical ammunition or bombs of your choice.

When crafting alchemical ammunition, including black powder in doses or rounds, using advanced alchemy, you create the ammunition in batches of 4 (meaning that if you were 4th level and used all of your advanced alchemy consumables to create alchemical ammunition, you could create a maximum of 24 rounds). You cannot use advanced alchemy to Craft horns or kegs of black powder.
listCustomFeats.traits: Uncommon, Champion, Exemplar, Fighter, Inquisitor, Inventor, Investigator, Ranger, Rogue, Swashbuckler, Thaumaturge, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Musashi Tactics
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication; trained in Intimidation or Diplomacy

In the style of a legendary swordsman, you anger your opponents into making mistakes. You gain the Bon Mot skill feat. When you use Bon Mot, you can make an Intimidation check against the target’s Will DC instead of a Diplomacy check. On a success or critical success with Bon Mot, the penalty also applies to attack rolls that target creatures other than you.

Special If you have the panache class feature, Bon Mot and Demoralize gain the bravado trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Mutagenic Armor
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

Your mutagenic form’s skin is tough as leather or coated in a series of scales or hard bumps. While you are in your mutagenic form and unarmored, you gain a +2 item bonus to AC. The thickness of this hide gives you a Dexterity modifier cap to your AC of +3. This item bonus to AC is cumulative with armor potency runes on your explorer's clothing, mystic armor, and bands of force.

listCustomFeats.name: Mutagenic Mastery
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mutagenic Physiology

Your mutagenic form has perfected their body, such that their abilities exceed yours by leaps and bounds. Depending on the option you selected for Mutagenic Physique, you gain one of the following benefits while in mutagenic form. You cannot benefit from one of these abilities and an apex item that provides a boost to its respective attribute at the same time.
- Colossal Strength You gain a +1 bonus to your Strength attribute or increase it to +4, whichever is higher.
