- Incongruous Dexterity You gain a +1 bonus to your Dexterity attribute or increase it to +4, whichever is higher.
- Indomitable Constitution You gain a +1 bonus to your Constitution attribute or increase it to +4, whichever is higher. This does not increase your maximum hit points; instead, increase the number of temporary hit points you gain when you Mutate by your level.

listCustomFeats.name: Mutagenic Physiology
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

Your mutagenic form has a uniquely powerful physique, regardless of what mutagen triggers its awakening. When you gain this feat, select one of the following options; you gain the benefits of that option while in mutagenic form.
- Colossal Strength Your muscles bulge and flex, threatening to break your armor and weapons as you wield them. The item bonus from your mutagen always applies to Athletics checks, Intimidation checks, and unarmed attack rolls, with a further +1 status bonus to these if the mutagen is a bestial mutagen. The damage dice of your fists become d6s, lose the finesse trait, and gain the razing trait. If you have the Smashing Fists feat, the damage dice of your fists instead increase to d8s and gain the sweep trait.
- Incongruous Dexterity Your body is lean and lithe, to the point that its movements make others uncomfortable. The item bonus from your mutagen always applies to Acrobatics checks, Stealth checks, Reflex saves, and Dexterity-based unarmed attack rolls, with a further +1 status bonus to these if the mutagen is a quicksilver mutagen. You ignore the effects of difficult terrain.
- Indomitable Constitution Your flesh knots and thickens, becoming as steel or stone. The item bonus from your mutagen always applies to Fortitude saves, with a further +1 status bonus to these if the mutagen is a juggernaut mutagen. You gain the Toughness general feat, which applies even when not in mutagenic form. Whenever you’re at maximum hit points for at least one minute, you regain the temporary hit points granted by the Mutate action.

listCustomFeats.name: Mutagenic Senses
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

Your mutagenic form has developed powerful senses. Select two of the following options when you gain this feat; you gain those options while in your mutagenic form:
- Sight You gain low-light vision, or darkvision if you already had low-light vision.
- Smell You gain scent as an imprecise sense with a range of 60 feet.
- Echolocation You gain hearing as a precise sense with a range of 30 feet.
- Vibration You gain tremorsense as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet.

listCustomFeats.name: Mutant Blood Essence
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your bloodline is infused with magic that now permeates your very being. Choose a tradition of magic; this becomes your blood essence tradition, and you gain its associated trait. Choose one cantrip from your blood essence tradition. You can cast that cantrip as an innate spell of that tradition at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up. If you have the ability to select a bloodline, such as by being a sorcerer, you must select a bloodline whose tradition matches your blood essence tradition.

listCustomFeats.name: Mutant Blood Magic
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mutant Blood Essence

You can manifest powers normally only available to sorcerers thanks to your blood essence. Select a sorcerer bloodline whose tradition matches your blood essence tradition. You can cast its 1st-rank and 2nd-rank sorcerous gift spells as innate spells of your blood essence tradition, each once per day. When you do so, you also gain the chosen sorcerer bloodline’s blood magic effect.

listCustomFeats.name: Mutant Mimicry
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites expert in Nature

You have noticed similarities between your mutations and those of other creatures, and have learned to express them. You gain your choice of the Ferocity Mimicry, Rend Mimicry, or Electrogenesis feat from the Wild Mimic archetype. If you are at least 13th level, you can instead select Trample Mimicry or Roar Mimicry; if you are at least 17th level, you can instead select Pounce Mimicry or Emergency Regeneration. You ignore the prerequisites for gaining the chosen feat.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different feat each time.

listCustomFeats.name: Mutant Physique
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Master Chymist Dedication

Basic mutagens that affect your physical form can bring out the beast within you, turn you nigh invincible, or make your body more elastic. While you're affected by one of the listed mutagens, you get an additional benefit.
- Bestial Mutagen You gain the mutagen's item bonus to your Intimidation checks. In addition, you increase the damage die size of your claws and jaws by one step, and they gain the deadly d10 trait.
- Juggernaut Mutagen You gain resistance to all physical damage equal to half your level.
- Quicksilver Mutagen You can stretch your legs and Step up to 10 feet, and you can squish and compress your body, allowing you to make it through tight spaces as if you were one size smaller, in addition to any effect from Squeezing.
Special If you can be under the effects of multiple mutagens (with the mutagenist greater field discovery, for example), you get all relevant benefits.

listCustomFeats.name: Mutant Weaponry
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
One of your mutations manifests as a natural weapon, which you’ve practiced with to use effectively. You gain that additional attack as an unarmed attack in the brawling weapon group. Choose one of the additional attacks from the list below:
- A claw unarmed attack that deals 1d6 slashing damage and has the finesse and unarmed traits.
- A hoof unarmed attack that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage and has the shove and unarmed traits.
- A horns unarmed attack that deals 1d8 piercing damage and has the unarmed trait.
- A jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d6 piercing damage and has the finesse and unarmed traits.
- A tail unarmed attack that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage and has the finesse, sweep, and unarmed traits.
Special You can select this feat multiple times, choosing a different unarmed attack each time you do.

listCustomFeats.name: Mutant’s Rush
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

You barrel forward towards your enemies, either in an attempt to smash them or simply run them down. Stride twice. Then, you may choose to take one of the following actions:
- Make a melee Strike against an enemy within your reach.
- Stride up to two additional times.

listCustomFeats.name: Mutate Weapon (SSS)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshwarped Weapon or Living Weapon

Select one unarmed attack you gained with Fleshwarped Weapon or Living Weapon. The damage die for that attack increases by one step until the end of your turn. In addition, choose to either have the attack gain a reach of 10 feet until the end of your turn or for you to gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with the chosen unarmed attack until the end of your turn.

listCustomFeats.name: Mutation Weapon Mastery
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mutant Weaponry

You’ve mastered using your unarmed attacks for combat. Whenever you get a critical hit with an unarmed attack you gained from a patchman ancestry feat, you get its critical specialization effect. Additionally, each of your unarmed attacks from the Mutant Weaponry feat improve according to the list below.
- Your claws gain the agile trait.
- Your horns gain the fatal d12 trait.
- Your tail gains the trip and backswing traits.
- Your jaws gain the grapple trait.
- Your hooves gain the backstabber trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Mystic Sail
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per round
Prerequisites Shipmind; master in Nature or Occultism
Requirements You are aboard your bound vessel

You can connect to your ship in such a way that you can control it with a thought. You Drive your bound vessel, gaining the effects of the Drive action for the same number of actions you spent to Mystic Sail and counting as piloting even if you aren’t at the helm. If you would roll a critical failure for the Piloting check, you get a failure instead.

Special This feat gains the occult or primal trait, matching the option you chose for the Shipmind feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Nest of Ropes
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Shipmind; master in Nature or Occultism
Requirements You are aboard your bound vessel

You can bend the ropes of your ship to your will, allowing you to attack with them as needed. You spend a number of actions to control your ropes with the following effects. When required, the rope used for this action has 16 HP, Hardness 4, and AC equal to 5 + your level.

[one-action] A rope from your ship curls around a creature. Select a target aboard your bound vessel. They must make a Reflex save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC, becoming grabbed on failure (or restrained in a critical failure). This condition lasts until the end of your next turn unless your target Escapes or destroys the rope.
[two-actions] A rope lashes out at a creature, possibly knocking them overboard. Select a target aboard your bound vessel. They suffer 4d6 bludgeoning damage with a basic Reflex save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC. On a failure, the target is pushed 5 feet in a direction of your choice, or 10 feet on a critical failure.
[three-actions] Ropes from your ship curl around the ankles of your foes, twisting and writhing. All enemies aboard your bound vessel must make a Reflex save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC. On a failure, the target falls and lands prone; on a critical failure, they also take 4d6 bludgeoning damage.

Special This feat gains the occult or primal trait, matching the option you chose for the Shipmind feat.

Level (+2) The damage dealt by the two-action version and the critical damage dealt by the three-action version increases by 1d6.

listCustomFeats.name: Nexian Summoning
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshwarper Dedication; legendary in Fleshwarp Lore

Through your study of fleshwarping, you’ve learned how to conjure the aspects of ancient fleshforges made by Nex long ago. You can cast summon ancient fleshforged once per day as an occult innate spell. When you do so, it uses the higher of your class DC or spell DC for any saving throws.

listCustomFeats.name: No Quarter!
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pirate Dedication; expert in Diplomacy or Intimidation

You shout an order to fight your foes without mercy. All allied creatures within a 20-foot radius gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects until the start of your next turn.

Special If you have the Shipmind feat and use this action while aboard your bound vessel, it affects all allied creatures aboard your bound vessel.
listCustomFeats.traits: Archetype, Auditory, Concentrate, Emotion, Linguistic, Mental, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Noble Scion Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Courtly Graces; you are part of a noble family

You were born into a privileged family or worked your way up to high social standing through hard work. Select a noble family. You gain your family’s Family Ability. Additionally, if your family has a Family Lore, you gain the Additional Lore skill feat for that lore.

You are bound to your family’s edicts and anathemas, but not in the same manner as deities or champions. You are free to go against or even wholesale break these edicts and anathemas; however, doing so in a public manner brings poor reputation to the family name. If your family becomes aware that you have performed acts that are anathema to them, you lose access to any feats and abilities from this archetype with the familial trait until you repent or atone with them.

listCustomFeats.name: Noble’s Ruse
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You know how to mislead an opponent in battle. You Feint. On a success, you Strike the target.

listCustomFeats.name: None for the Leeches (Pain Taster)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pain Taster Dedication

You lose blood so frequently that your body has become used to it. Increase your maximum hit points by your level. You are not required to roll recovery checks at the end of your turn when suffering from persistent damage. Additionally, the DC to stop persistent bleed damage is reduced by 5.

listCustomFeats.name: Nonlethal Spell (Eldritch Scoundrel)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Scoundrel Dedication

You can alter offensive spells to be less deadly. If your next action is to Cast a Spell that deals damage and doesn’t have the death or void trait, that spell gains the nonlethal trait (page 407).

listCustomFeats.name: Nonlethal Strikes
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite expert in simple or martial weapons or unarmed strikes

You know how to knock opponents down without killing them, even using normal weapons. You don't take the normal –2 circumstance penalty when attacking nonlethally with a weapon or unarmed strike that you are at least expert with and that lacks the nonlethal trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Occult Knacks
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication

You’ve learned a few magical tricks to assist you in the handling and understanding of magic. You can cast detect magic, know the way, and read aura as occult innate cantrips.

listCustomFeats.name: Occultist Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites trained in Occultism

You become an expert in Occultism. At 7th level, you become a master in Occultism, and at 15th level, you become legendary in Occultism. You also gain the Oddity Identification skill feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Old Family Recipe
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Wandering Chef Dedication; master in Crafting or Cooking Lore

You hold such mastery over a particular meal (likely passed down from your family) that your recipe produces far more than would normally be expected. Select one recipe for alchemical food whose level is equal to half your level or lower that you know. Whenever you craft this alchemical food during downtime or with Advanced Alchemy, you create twice as many items without an increase in cost in materials or Advanced Alchemy uses. Each time you gain a level or retrain this feat, you can swap this feat’s benefits to apply to a different recipe you know that meets the requirements.

listCustomFeats.name: Old One Ascendance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

You fully settle into your power, joining the hallowed and horrid ranks of the Great Old Ones. You can serve as a patron for witches or similar classes that use patrons. Choose a single type of patron you represent, such as Starless Shadow or The Resentment; this is typically one that grants the occult spell list, but can also be one that grants the arcane or divine spell list.

For the purposes of any of your abilities, your power always counts as being released; when you cast Release Power, you gain the benefits of the spell until you use an action with the concentrate trait to end it. You are immune to the confused condition and don’t need to eat, drink, sleep, or breathe. You also stop aging.

You can no longer truly be killed; when you die, something happens to your body as determined by you and the GM upon gaining this feat. Perhaps you dissolve into a grey sludge or a caustic mist, perhaps your body disappears leaving only apparel, or perhaps you simply remain a corpse that is unaffected by further time or damage. After 2d8 days, you rise from the dead as if raised by a critical success on a 10th rank resurrect ritual. The only way you can truly be defeated for any extended amount of time is by being banished, during which you remain trapped beyond reality until you are summoned again through a ritual that can summon an aberration of your level or higher. If you were banished by an elder sign, the DC to do so is increased by 10, decreasing by 1 for every decade that passes since you were banished.

While you are banished you can’t move, act, or speak normally, but can still grant power to your followers and communicate with them through magic or dreams. In the fullness of time and by gathering a cult, you can gain the ability to serve as a deity for classes with a deity feature, such as clerics, though whether you do so with any care is up to you. Such occurrences often take decades or centuries, falling outside the scope of this feat, but if relevant should follow rules similar to the Assume Godhood godling archetype feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Open the Vaults
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You’re trusted enough by your family to gain access to some of their more rare and valuable treasures. Select a single non-consumable item or vehicle of your level + 1 or lower that isn’t rare or unique. You gain that item on loan from your family. You must still meet any requirements to use it, and must invest it as normal. Destroying, losing, or selling this item is considered anathema to your family, though you can borrow it to other members of your party without issue. You can only have one item on loan in this manner, and can spend a week of downtime in a settlement to exchange it for another item that meets the requirements. This item must be something that your family reasonably has access to, with the full options available at your GM’s discretion.

listCustomFeats.name: Opening Stance (Sword Saint)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication
Trigger You roll initiative

At the first sign of trouble, often before you consciously realize the danger, you drop into a stance with a mere thought. Use an action that has the stance trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Order Weapon Training
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Hellknight Armiger Dedication

Your order has trained you to utilize weapons from your order with ease. You have familiarity with your order’s favored weapon–for the purposes of proficiency, you treat any of these that are martial weapons as simple weapons and any that are advanced weapons as martial weapons. Additionally, if you are at least 5th level, whenever you critically hit with your order’s favored weapon, you get its critical specialization effect.

listCustomFeats.name: Orderly Spells
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Hellknight Signifier Dedication

Add phantom pain, instant armor, haste, fire shield, rallying banner, dominate, and crusade to your spell list. You can either prepare these spells or add them to your repertoire just like the spells normally on your tradition's spell list. When you gain this feat, you can retrain existing spells to replace them with ones on this list.

In addition, your Signifier training renders these spells rote, requiring only minor preparation to use. Choose one of these two benefits.
- If you're a prepared spellcaster, you can spend 10 minutes to replace one of the spells you've prepared with a spell of the same rank from the list of orderly spells. You can do this while Refocusing.
- If you're a spontaneous spellcaster with the signature spells class feature, add two of the spells from the list of orderly spells to your repertoire. They are signature spells for you, in addition to your normal signature spells. When you gain the ability to cast a new rank of spells, you can choose to switch the spells from this feat to any other spells from the list.

listCustomFeats.name: Otherworldly Insight
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

You have an awareness that extends far beyond the mortal realm, becoming uncanny to those that pay attention. While you are conscious, you have a +2 status bonus to Perception checks and initiative rolls, and aren’t off-guard to hidden or undetected creatures of your level or lower, or creatures of your level or lower using surprise attack. Additionally, whenever you attempt a Perception check, you may spend a Mythic Point to do so at mythic proficiency.

While your power is released, you are constantly under the effects of a 6th-rank truesight spell, using your Perception modifier for the counteract check.

listCustomFeats.name: Outer Companions
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication; incredible animal companion or equivalent

Your new nature begins to extend not only to yourself but to your trusted animal companions. All of your animal companions gain the following benefits, which count as one of their specializations.
- It gains the aberration trait.
- Its Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers each increase by 1.
- Its proficiency rank in Occultism increases to expert.
- It can speak Aklo.
- It gains fast healing 5.

listCustomFeats.name: Outside Contact
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication

You have learned the names of various outsiders, allowing you to call them to your aid. Select one of the following spells: summon celestial, summon dragon, summon elemental, summon entity, summon fey, summon fiend, summon giant, summon monitor. You can cast that spell as a 5th rank innate occult spell once per day. Whenever you summon a creature in this manner, you are summoning the same creature each time you choose to summon a specific creature. At 14th level and every 2 levels thereafter, the summon spell is heightened by 1 rank (to a maximum of 9th rank when you reach 20th level).

As soon as the creature arrives, instead of giving it any other commands, you can demand that it help you with a single task. For the creature to effectively assist, you must Sustain the Spell for 1 minute, and you must understand and be understood by the creature. You can select one of the following tasks.
- Answer a question, as per the read omens spell.
- Describe the current state of a location, as per what could be seen through a clairaudience and clairvoyance spell cast at the location.
- Provide information about a subject, as per a success (but not a critical success) on the collective memories ritual.
No matter the option chosen, the information given is cryptic in nature and typically in the form of a rhyme or omen. Once the minute has passed and the task is complete, the creature immediately returns from whence it came without providing any other benefit.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different spell each time.

listCustomFeats.name: Overwhelming Counterspell
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Cost Expend a spell slot
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication; Counterspell

Through sheer magical brute force, you can counter spells even if you’ve never seen them before.

Rebuttal [reaction] Trigger A creature Casts a Spell you can see; Effect You attempt to counteract the triggering spell using the expended spell slot. If the expended spell slot isn’t at least one rank higher than the triggering spell’s counteract rank, reduce your degree of success on the counteract check by one.

Unravel [three-actions] (manipulate) You unleash a pulse of dispelling magic. Attempt a single counteract check against all magical effects within 30 feet using the expended spell slot. You can choose to exclude any effects you are aware of in this area. If the expended spell slot isn’t at least one rank higher than the affected spell’s counteract rank, reduce your degree of success on the counteract check by one.

listCustomFeats.name: Pain Mastery
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Disciple of Pain

You have learned to combine and improve your personal torments to heighten their effects. During your daily preparations, you can perform two torture regimens, gaining each of their effects. Alternatively, you can select the same regimen twice; if you do, its effects are doubled.

listCustomFeats.name: Pain Taster Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Diehard or Toughness; expert in Fortitude

You draw power from your own personal suffering. You become trained in simple and martial weapons from the flail weapon group. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency rank in all simple and martial weapons in the flail weapon group. Additionally, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against effects with the nonlethal trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Painful Flail
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pain Taster Dedication

You have mastered the art of inflicting pain with your flails. When you critically Strike with a flail you are proficient with, you gain its critical specialization benefits, and can take an alternate effect instead: the target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

listCustomFeats.name: Paired Shots
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Requirements You're wielding two weapons, each of which can be either a loaded one-handed firearm or loaded one handed crossbow.

Your shots hit simultaneously. Make two Strikes, one with each of your two ranged weapons, each using your current multiple attack penalty. Both Strikes must have the same target.

If both attacks hit, combine their damage and then add any applicable effects from both weapons. You add any precision damage, only once, to the attack of your choice. Combine the damage from both Strikes and apply resistances and weaknesses only once. This counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty.
listCustomFeats.traits: Uncommon, Fighter, Inquisitor, Inventor, Ranger, Swashbuckler, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Paragon Lantern
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Adept Lantern

You have unlocked the most powerful secrets of your lantern, granting you its paragon benefit.

listCustomFeats.name: Party Crasher (Noble Scion)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Dandy Dedication; master in Society

You attend all the fashionable society parties, no matter how exclusive they might be. Any time you encounter a social event you would ordinarily be denied access to, such as a coronation, royal gala, or other society function, you can spend 1d4 hours to secure entry without the need for a skill check. You find invitations, invitees looking for fashionable dates, temporary jobs with the caterers, event staff willing to look the other way, or some other mode of access for yourself and your allies. This ability doesn’t apply to secret events or other small private gatherings with no staff, dates, or outsiders involved.

listCustomFeats.name: Pass as Other
listCustomFeats.textDescription: While you have features that identify you as a patchman, they are easy to hide or disguise when the need arises. You never take circumstance penalties for attempting to take a disguise of a different ancestry, age, and so on, as long as the disguised form is appropriate for your size and not a specific person. You also gain a +2 status bonus to Deception checks to pass as a generic member of a species whose language you speak (such as an orc if you speak orcish) so long as you are of the appropriate size.

listCustomFeats.name: Patchman Lore
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You have listened to stories of your ancestors, and have paid close attention to the teachings of your family. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Stealth and Survival. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also gain the Additional Lore general feat for your choice of Patchman Lore or a lore skill related to your heritage (such as Azlanti Lore or Crusader Lore).

listCustomFeats.name: Peerless Patrician
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

Your skills are such that you can twist most social situations to your benefit. Once per round, when you roll a check using Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, or Society, you can roll twice and take the higher result.

listCustomFeats.name: Penetrating Fire
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Requirements You're wielding a loaded firearm or crossbow.

You blast a bullet through one foe and into another. Choose two targets, one of which would give the other lesser cover against your ranged attacks. Make a single ranged Strike with the required weapon against both targets. This attack ignores any lesser cover the nearer target provides the other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature you hit. Penetrating Fire counts as two attacks for your multiple attack penalty.
listCustomFeats.traits: Uncommon, Fighter, Inquisitor, Inventor, Ranger, Swashbuckler, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Perfect Reflexes
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication; Incredible Initiative

Your reflexes in combat are second to none. When you roll initiative, you can forgo rolling a skill check to instead receive a result of 19 + your Perception proficiency bonus (do not apply any other bonuses, penalties, or modifiers).

listCustomFeats.name: Perfect Strike
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication; expert in your chosen weapon

You have mastered your swings such that you can strike foes with little effort. When you make a Strike with your chosen weapon, you can forgo rolling an attack roll to instead receive a result of 11 + your proficiency bonus + your multiple attack penalty, or 12 + your proficiency bonus + your multiple attack penalty if it is a Lightning Draw (do not apply any other bonuses, penalties, or modifiers). This increases to 13 + your proficiency bonus + your multiple attack penalty if your current stance improves your Lightning Draw bonus.

listCustomFeats.name: Pervasive Blood Magic
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per minute
Prerequisites Mutant Blood Magic

By channeling your blood magic, you can pour energy into your spells to enhance it. If your next action is to cast a spell whose tradition matches your blood essence tradition, you gain the benefits of the blood magic effect from the bloodline you chose in the Mutant Blood Magic ancestry feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Pickpocket Mastery
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Burglar Dedication; Plant Evidence; master in Thievery

You can manage taking much larger objects from your foes, and can utilize your mugging technique to actively harm them. You can always attempt to Steal objects of light Bulk, instead of just negligible, following the normal rules. When you Steal an item, you can choose to swap it with an item in one of your hands of equal Bulk.

When you Plant Evidence on a creature, you can activate the deadly properties of the item in certain situations. When you do so, the action gains the Attack trait, and gains the following effects depending on the item being planted:
If the item you are planting has the bomb trait, the bomb detonates, losing the splash trait but dealing its normal damage to the creature, or double the normal damage on a critical success.
If the item is a contact poison or injury poison, the poison is expended and the target must make a saving throw against the poison.

Special If you have the Yoink! feat and critically succeed on the flourish version of the action, you can swap the item in the target’s hand with an item of the same bulk or less in your hand.

listCustomFeats.name: Pierce the Veil
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Researcher Dedication

Your eyes cut through mundane obstructions. You gain darkvision. At 18th level, you gain the True Perception general feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomFeats.name: Piercing Blade Stance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication
Requirements you are unarmored

You assume a stance that involves lunging with each strike of your blade. While in this stance, your chosen weapon gains a reach of 10 feet and deals piercing damage instead of its normal damage type. If your chosen weapon would already have a reach of 10 feet, its reach increases to 15 feet instead.

Additionally, while you are in this stance, your circumstance bonus to hit from Lightning Draw increases to +2.

listCustomFeats.name: Piercing Surge
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Piercing Blade Stance
Requirements You are in Piercing Blade Stance and your chosen weapon is sheathed.

You impale your blade through a foe and hold them in place. Make a Lightning Draw attack against a target within your melee reach, ignoring the flourish trait. If the Strike hits and deals damage, your target is grabbed until they successfully Escape, you attack with or sheath the used weapon, or you Release the used weapon, whichever comes first. When the target is no longer grabbed, it takes persistent bleed damage equal to the weapon’s number of weapon damage dice.

listCustomFeats.name: Pike and Strike
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Requirements You are wielding a polearm or spear in one hand, and your other hand either wields a one-handed melee weapon, shield, or is empty.

You mix your polearm strikes with alternate attacks and tactics. Make a melee Strike with a spear or polearm. If the Strike hits, you then perform one of the following actions. In either case, this counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty.
- If the target is your size or smaller, you automatically Reposition it, with the same benefits as the Reposition action (including the critical success effect, if your Strike was a critical hit). If you used a weapon with reach, use the weapon’s reach for this Reposition.
- Strike the same target with your other one-handed melee weapon (or, if your other hand is empty, with an unarmed attack), using the same multiple attack penalty as the first strike.
listCustomFeats.traits: Fighter, Flourish, Ranger, Rogue, Swashbuckler, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Pike and Strike (Pirate)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pirate Dedication
Requirements You are wielding a polearm in one hand, and your other hand either wields a one-handed melee weapon, shield, or is empty.

You mix your polearm strikes with alternate attacks and tactics. Make a melee Strike with a polearm. If the Strike hits, you then perform one of the following actions. In either case, this counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty.
- If the target is your size or smaller, you automatically Reposition it, with the same benefits as the Reposition action (including the critical success effect, if your Strike was a critical hit). If you used a weapon with reach, use the weapon’s reach for this Reposition.
- Strike the same target with your other one-handed melee weapon (or, if your other hand is empty, with an unarmed attack), using the same multiple attack penalty as the polearm strike.

listCustomFeats.name: Placate
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You’ve learned how to soothe the minds of your cousins when agitated. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, and Society checks when dealing with members of the nobility, or a +2 bonus if you are benefiting from Courtly Grace’s circumstance bonus.

listCustomFeats.name: Plant Evidence (Burglar)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Burglar Dedication, Pickpocket

You can put a single item you’re holding of light or negligible Bulk onto a person without them noticing by succeeding at a Thievery check against their Perception DC. If you have the ruffian racket, you can do this as a free action when you successfully Shove a target.

listCustomFeats.name: Pliable Physiology
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per round
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

You can rapidly manifest horrific mutations on your body at a whim, gaining their benefits as they please you. Select an item with the graft trait that is common, you have access to, or you have the recipe for. You violently grow that graft, any equipment you are wearing morphing to accommodate. You treat this graft as being invested, though it is not counted towards your number of invested items. This graft lasts until you use this action again. You can only have one graft manifested by this ability at a time; whenever you would use this action, the previous graft is replaced, dissolving back into your body. Additionally, you can use the higher of your spell or class DC when determining the DCs of any grafts you have, whether they were granted by this activity or not.

While your power is released, you can use this activity as a free action instead.

listCustomFeats.name: Poison Production
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites trained in Crafting

You know how to produce poisons from natural ingredients. You gain the advanced alchemy benefits. You can use advanced alchemy to create four alchemical poison consumables each day. You remember alchemical poison formulas and don’t need a formula book for them.

If you would later gain the Poisoner Dedication feat, increase the number of alchemical poison consumables you can create with Poisoner’s advanced alchemy by 2.

listCustomFeats.name: Poison Weapon (SSS)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon.

You apply a contact poison or injury poison to the required weapon; if you have a free hand, you can Interact to draw a poison as part of this action. This poison can be one of the simple injury poisons you can create due to this feat (see Special), or another contact or injury poison you've acquired.

Special During your daily preparations, you can prepare a number of simple injury poisons equal to your rogue level. These follow the rules for injury poisons, except that they deal 1d4 poison damage with no saving throw. Only you can apply these poisons properly, and they expire the next time you prepare.

listCustomFeats.name: Practiced Specialty
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Craftsman Dedication

You’re skilled in producing certain types of product, and are always thinking of ways you can improve it. You gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat. Additionally, you gain the formulas for four common 4th-level or lower items that fall under one of your specialties; it can be uncommon or rare if you have access to that item. Each time you gain a level after 4th, you can add the formula for one additional item from one of your specialties to your formula book; this formula can be for an item of your level or lower and must be common or an item you have access to. When crafting an item from one of your specialties for which you have the formula, increase the bonus from Specialty Crafting by +1.

listCustomFeats.name: Prepared Strike
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication

You ready yourself for battle with a hand on your blade. You gain the Incredible Initiative general feat. On your first action during combat, creatures that haven’t acted are off-guard to you.

listCustomFeats.name: Prestigious Influence
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication; expert in Diplomacy

You can pull upon your influence for minor favors or assistance in lifestyle without affecting your total wealth. You gain a pool of influence points equal to 15 * your level, which you can use to spend on services and non-material goods, with each point being equivalent to one gold. This pool replenishes at the beginning of every week, and can include the following:
- Pay for lodgings, stabling, taxes, and tools.
- Improve lifestyle quality.
- Hire animals, fixers, hirelings, researchers, spellcasting services, or transportation.
- Obtain invitations to exclusive events or entry to privileged locations.
- Start or spread rumors.
Other options may be available at the GM’s discretion; in general, you cannot permanently gain goods or wealth from this ability, and influence points can generally only be spent in settlements with 5,000 people or more or that your family has specific influence within. The exact benefits available in a location are similarly at GM’s discretion.

listCustomFeats.name: Pride of Wisdom
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshwarper Dedication

As a master over life itself, you scoff at those who would seek to place themselves or their effects over you. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saves against mental and polymorph effects, as well as a +2 circumstance bonus to your DCs against another creature’s Crafting or Medicine checks if you aren’t willing.

When you would make a save against such an effect, you can attempt to overcome it with sheer arrogance. If you choose to do so, if you roll a success, you critically succeed instead; similarly, if you fail roll a failure, you critically fail instead.

listCustomFeats.name: Priest Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites trained in Religion

Choose a deity as you would if you were a cleric. You become bound by that deity’s anathema. You become an expert in Religion. At 7th level, you become a master in Religion, and at 15th level, you become legendary in Religion. You also gain your choice of the Splinter Faith or Syncretism cleric feats, or become trained in your deity’s divine skill (or another skill of your choice if you are already trained in that skill).

Certain priest archetype feats grant you access to spells. You're trained in the spell attack modifier and spell DC statistics. Your key spellcasting attribute for Priest archetype spells is Wisdom, and they are divine spells. If you gain a Focus Pool from any Priest archetype feats, you can Refocus by praying to your deity or performing service toward their causes.

listCustomFeats.name: Priest's Hands
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Priest Dedication

Your deity provides you with the ability to heal or harm others with a touch. You gain the lay on hands devotion spell if your deity has a heal divine font or the touch of the void devotion spell if your deity has a harm divine font. If your deity allows either, select one and gain that devotion spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point.

listCustomFeats.name: Protection Circle (Occultist)
listCustomFeats.textDescription: See Witches+ Pg. 12

listCustomFeats.name: Psi Burst (Psychokineticist)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per round
Prerequisites Psychokineticist Dedication

With a passing thought, you direct violent psychic energies at a nearby creature. Target one creature within 30 feet. It takes 1d4 bludgeoning damage with a basic Reflex save. At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, the damage increases by 1d4.
listCustomFeats.traits: Archetype, Concentrate, Mindshift, Occult, Psyche, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Psychoelemental Pulse
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychokineticist Dedication

You unleash a blast of elemental might infused with energy from the Astral plane. This blast fills a 10-foot burst within 30 feet, and causes each creature within the area to take 2d4 mental damage and 2d4 damage of one of your elemental blast’s damage types with a basic Reflex save. A damage type other than a physical damage adds its trait to this impulse. A creature that critically fails this saving throw is stunned 1.

Level (+2) The mental damage increases by 1d4.

listCustomFeats.name: Psychoelemental Transformation
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Psychokineticist Dedication
Requirements Your kinetic gate is deactivated.

While many kineticists can utilize their kinetic gate to transform into beings of elemental energy, you can overwhelm yours to become a being of psychic thought. You're affected by an elemental form spell. You can heighten it to any spell rank up to half your level rounded up.

Instead of the elemental trait, you gain the astral trait. Your unarmed melee attacks are based on your key attribute, and your skill is Acrobatics. Instead of gaining abilities based on an element you choose, you gain the following abilities:

Astral fly 30 feet; physical resistance 5; Melee [one-action]: tendril (agile), Damage 2d6 mental

listCustomFeats.name: Psychokineticist Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites emotional intensity

While you may unleash your elements willingly, often your emotions get the best of you leading to it triggering involuntarily. Choose an emotion from the Emotional States listed for the Cathartic Mage archetype. You gain the Cathartic Unleash reaction. When you Unleash Elements, you gain the Emotional Fervor benefits of your catharsis emotion for the duration of your Unleash Elements.

Special If you would later gain the Cathartic Mage archetype, you must select the same emotion that you chose here; similarly, if you have the Cathartic Mage Dedication feat, you must select the same emotion that you chose for that feat. You can select the Cathartic Mage Dedication feat without requiring you to select two feats from this archetype; if you do and you aren’t already capable of casting spells from spell slots, you must select the occult spell list, and your key attribute is your spellcasting attribute for your cathartic mage spells.

listCustomFeats.name: Psychopomp Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Your Calling draws you to the place between life and death–the realm of Pharasma, and the path of a Psychopomp. You gain the ability to manifest a psychopomp mask, a death mask used to disguise your face when working among mortals. Determine the appearance of your mask; you can manifest it or unmanifest it as a free action during your turn. If you already have a similar mask (such as one granted by the Nosoi’s Mask ancestry feat) or would gain a magical mask in the future, you can transform it into your psychopomp mask during your daily preparations. While you are wearing your psychopomp mask, you are rendered immune to death effects and gain a +1 item bonus to Intimidation; this bonus increases to +2 at 16th level.

In addition, you gain the Out of Sight action, as well as the anathema “create undead.”

Out of Sight [one-action] (concentrate, divine, illusion) Frequency once per 10 minutes; Requirements you are wearing your psychopomp mask; Effect You channel the power of your mask to vanish from sight. You become invisible for the next minute. If you use a hostile action, the invisibility ends after that hostile action is complete.

listCustomFeats.name: Psychopomp Familiar
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychopomp Dedication; you do not have the Sakhil Rejection feat; familiar

Your familiar becomes a nosoi or similar small psychopomp. This familiar continues to use all the same rules as other familiars, but one of its abilities must always be speech and it has the monitor and psychopomp traits. As normal when a familiar must always have a certain ability, the speech ability counts against your familiar's abilities each day.

Your familiar can select two additional familiar abilities each day, but they must either be the second opinion, snoop, or share senses familiar ability or one of the following psychopomp familiar abilities.
- Soul Sight Your familiar gains lifesense with a range of 30 feet.
- Spirit Touch Your familiar can touch incorporeal creatures. If you have the spell delivery master ability from your familiar, any spell the familiar delivers with it gains the benefits of the ghost touch property rune.
- Augury Your familiar can glimpse the strands of fate to give you a cryptic clue regarding your future. Your familiar can cast augury once per day using your magical tradition and spell DC.

listCustomFeats.name: Psychopomp Understanding
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychopomp Dedication

Your connection to the Boneyard grants you immense insight into the living and dead. You’re affected by a constant truespeech spell, and gain lifesense as an imprecise sense with a range of 60 feet.
When you attempt a Recall Knowledge check about Pharasma, the Boneyard, or a creature with the psychopomp, sahkil, or undead trait, you can spend 1 Mythic Point to make the check at mythic proficiency.

listCustomFeats.name: Punishing Flail (Pain Taster)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pain Taster Dedication

You know how best to use your flail to draw blood. Your strikes with flails you are proficient in deal an additional 1 persistent bleed damage, or 1d6 persistent bleed damage on a critical hit. When you gain weapon specialization, the persistent bleed damage increases to 2 and 2d6 respectively. When you gain greater weapon specialization, the persistent bleed damage increases to 3 and 3d6 respectively.

listCustomFeats.name: Quick Draw
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You draw your weapon and attack with the same motion. You Interact to draw a weapon, then Strike with that weapon.
listCustomFeats.traits: Uncommon, Champion, Exemplar, Fighter, Inquisitor, Inventor, Investigator, Ranger, Rogue, Swashbuckler, Thaumaturge, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Quick Sheath
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per round
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication
Trigger Your turn begins or ends and you are wielding your chosen weapon

You Stow your chosen weapon. If you are wielding two of your chosen weapon, you can stow both.

listCustomFeats.name: Quickened Casting (Eldritch Scoundrel)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Eldritch Scoundrel Dedication

If your next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell that is at least 2 ranks lower than the highest-rank spell slot you have, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Special This can only be used on a cantrip or spell from the class matching the one you gained this feat from.

listCustomFeats.name: Raise Symbol (Priest)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Priest Dedication
Requirements You are wielding a religious symbol

You present your religious symbol emphatically. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws until the start of your next turn. While it’s raised, if you roll a success at a saving throw against a vitality or void effect, you get a critical success instead.

If the religious symbol you’re raising is a shield, such as with Emblazon Armaments, you gain the effects of Raise a Shield when you use this action and the effects of this action when you Raise a Shield.

listCustomFeats.name: Ranged Legerdemain
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Scoundrel Dedication; trained in Thievery

Your magical abilities allow you to perform fine manipulations at a distance. You gain telekinetic hand as an innate cantrip of your spellcasting tradition. You can perform Thievery skill actions at a range of 30 feet. When you do so, the action also gains the concentrate and magical traits, and you suffer a -2 penalty to any checks involved. Actions you can perform include Disable a Device, Palm an Object, Pick a Lock, and Steal, but other actions can be made at this range with the same changes at GM’s discretion.

listCustomFeats.name: Reach Spell (Eldritch Scoundrel)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Scoundrel Dedication

You can extend your spells’ range. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell that has a range, increase that spell’s range by 30 feet. As is standard for increasing spell ranges, if the spell normally has a range of touch, you extend its range to 30 feet.

listCustomFeats.name: Reactive Lightning
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication
Requirements A creature targets you with an attack, you can see the attacker, and you can Lightning Draw.
Trigger A creature within your reach attempts to Strike you.

You raise your blade to block the blow. Interact to Draw your chosen weapon; you then gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If they critically fail to strike you, you may make a Strike targeting them as if you had used Lightning Draw, ignoring the flourish trait. This Strike has a -2 penalty, doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Special If you have the Opportune Riposte reaction, this Lightning Draw attack gains the bravado trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Ready for Revelation
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites lamplighter methodology

You are always prepared for the horrors of the dark to creep into view. When rolling initiative using Perception, you can add half your Intelligence modifier, rounded down, as well as your Wisdom modifier if you are in bright light.

Additionally, while you are in bright light, you aren’t off-guard to hidden, undetected, or flanking creatures of your level or lower, or creatures of your level or lower using surprise attack. However, they can still help their allies flank you.

listCustomFeats.name: Reaping Blade
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychopomp Dedication

You can infuse a weapon with a fatal aspect, designating it as the tool you use to reap souls. During your daily preparations, select one melee weapon that deals slashing or piercing damage to become your reaping blade. You gain that weapon’s critical specialization effect, and you grant it one of the following properties: adamantine, cold iron, silver. Your Strikes with that weapon, as well as your unarmed strikes, also gain the benefits of the ghost touch property rune.

Whenever you successfully Strike a creature with your reaping blade, you deal an additional void damage if the creature is living or vitality damage if the creature is undead; this damage is equal to the weapon’s number of damage dice plus the value of the target’s doomed condition.

When you critically Strike a creature with your reaping blade, you can take an alternate critical specialization effect instead: the target must succeed at a Will save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC or increase their doomed value by 1.

listCustomFeats.name: Reaping Swing
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Reaping Blade
Requirements you are wearing your psychopomp mask

You unleash a powerful swing with your reaping blade. You gain the Vicious Swing fighter feat. When you use Vicious Swing with your reaping blade, you may give the action the death trait; if you do and hit, the target must succeed at a Will save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC; they suffer a -2 circumstance penalty to this saving throw if the attack was a critical hit and a status penalty equal to their doomed value. It is then immune to this effect for the next 24 hours. This effect has the incapacitation trait. A creature killed by your Vicious Swing or this effect can’t be returned to life or become undead except by a 9th-rank or higher ritual.

Success The target’s doomed value increases by 1.
Failure The target’s doomed value increases by 2.
Critical Failure The target’s doomed value increases by 4.

listCustomFeats.name: Reaping Throw
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Reaping Blade
Requirements you are wearing your psychopomp mask

Spend 1 Mythic Point. If you’re not currently wielding your reaping blade, it immediately teleports into your hand. You throw your reaping blade in a 60-foot line, making a Strike with that weapon against each enemy in the line, with a status bonus to hit each target equal to the value of their doomed condition. Each attack counts toward your multiple attack penalty, but your penalty doesn’t increase until you have made all your attacks. After these attacks are complete, your weapon returns to your hand.

listCustomFeats.name: Reflexive Stance (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication
Trigger You roll initiative.

You enter a stance without a thought. Use an action that has the stance trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Regal Command
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per round
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

You combine words of flattery or distaste with commands to your companions. You Command a Minion or Sustain a spell with the summon trait, then use a single action with the auditory or linguistic trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Regenerating Ichor
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Transposable Compliance

Not only does your biology provide healing, but by amplifying the excretions of ichor you can restore missing limbs and knit flesh like cloth. You can cast regenerate once per day as an innate occult spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Reknitting of Flesh
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshwarper Dedication; master in Medicine or Fleshwarp Lore

In your downtime, you’ve learned to reknit your flesh almost out of habit. You gain the Fast Recovery general feat, ignoring the prerequisites, and reduce the severity of your drained condition to 0 whenever you rest. During your daily preparations, you can provide minor, mostly harmless stitchwork to your allies to aid in their wound closure. Each willing ally that you target with this effect reduces their drained condition by 1 and regains hit points equal to your level + your Intelligence modifier. You can target up to six creatures at once with this ability. If you are legendary in Medicine or Fleshwarp Lore, you can instead target up to twelve.

listCustomFeats.name: Resilience of Steel
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Armored Hulk; master in Athletics

You’ve learned how best to use your armor to resist deadly attacks. You gain the armor specialization effects of medium and heavy armor. If you are benefiting from Raging Resistance and wearing heavy armor, you add 2 + the value of the armor’s potency rune to your Raging Resistance.

listCustomFeats.name: Resourceful Master
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Resourceful Warrior

When you use an improvised or shoddy weapon, you apply the critical specialization effects on a critical hit. If the weapon is improvised, it counts as a brawling weapon; depending on the shape and nature, your GM might determine another weapon group’s critical specialization is more appropriate.

listCustomFeats.name: Resourceful Warrior
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You are used to working with damaged or improvised weapons. You gain the Weapon Improviser Dedication feat, but do not need to select two other archetype feats to be able to select another dedication feat. The benefits of any feats from the Weapon Improviser archetype also apply to shoddy weapons.

listCustomFeats.name: Restoring Change
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

The mutagen left in your body causes you to begin healing when switching between your forms. When you enter or exit your mutagenic form, you regain hit points equal to twice your level. Additionally, you may immediately make a check to recover from persistent damage when you do so.

listCustomFeats.name: Roaring Blade Stance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication
Requirements you are unarmored

You enter a stance where your blade slices the air with sonic force. While in this stance, your chosen weapon gains the forceful trait; damage dealt by this trait is sonic instead of its normal damage type. If your chosen weapon already has the forceful trait, it deals additional sonic damage equal to the number of weapon damage dice with all attacks.

Additionally, while you are in this stance, your circumstance bonus to hit from Lightning Draw increases to +2.

listCustomFeats.name: Roll the Bones
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

As any good noble scion, you are skilled at gambling away your family’s fortune. You gain the Additional Lore skill feat for Games Lore. Whenever you would use Games Lore to gamble, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the roll.

Additionally, once per day when you roll a failure on a Games Lore check to gamble, you can re-roll the check, keeping the new result. If the dice roll of the new check is not higher than the original, the result counts as a critical failure instead of its new result.

listCustomFeats.name: Ruin Reader
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication

With a touch, you can cast yourself backwards in time, reliving events in places that have long fallen to ruin. By spending one minute in contact with a structure, you gain an idea of the structure’s history. You perceive any or all of the following information.
- The highest level item within the structure, or within 30 feet of it.
- The layout of the area of the structure within 30 feet of you.
- One piece of relevant information about the structure’s history, as per a success on a Recall Knowledge check.
This effect fails if the structure has received regular maintenance within the last year, such that it would be considered inhabited or in functioning order. A creature making a nest or camping out in the structure without maintaining the structure itself does not cause it to count as being inhabited.

If you are at least 14th level, you may also gain the benefits of the retrocognition spell targeting the structure. You may choose to heighten the effect of the spell to half your level rounded up when you do so.

listCustomFeats.name: Running Reload
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You can reload your weapon on the move. You Stride, Step, or Sneak, then Interact to reload.
listCustomFeats.traits: Uncommon, Champion, Exemplar, Fighter, Inquisitor, Inventor, Investigator, Ranger, Rogue, Swashbuckler, Thaumaturge, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Running Tackle (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication

You charge, throwing your body at your foe in a vicious tackle. Stride twice or make a High Jump or Long Jump, then attempt to Grapple or Shove. If you made a High Jump or Long Jump, you can make the Grapple or Shove at any point in the jump, but you can’t travel any farther on the jump after you do.

listCustomFeats.name: Sacral Lord (Noble Scion)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites trained in Occultism or Religion

By right of ritual or sheer stubbornness, you have claimed rulership of the land. Claim a defined territory, such as a small section of forest or river, or a district of a larger city. Within its borders, you can cast detect magic, guidance, and sigil as innate divine cantrips, and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Make an Impression on creatures that have the celestial, fiend, fey, monitor, or spirit traits.

Special You and your land are linked. Changes to one mirror themselves on the other—if you're depressed, gray rain and clammy mist might set in. These effects have no immediate mechanical impact, but they might give clues about problems afflicting the land.

listCustomFeats.name: Sacral Monarch (Noble Scion)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sacral Lord; master in Occultism or Religion

You have come into your full powers and are truly a monarch of your realm, by your own definition at least. While in your territory, you can cast banishment and inevitable disaster as innate divine spells, each once per day.

listCustomFeats.name: Sacred Geometry
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Int +2; Expert in a Lore skill related to mathematics; two feats with the spellshape trait

You can use your mastery of mathematics to weave two spellshapes into a single spell. When you use this action, select two other spellshape actions you can use. If your next action is to cast a spell that is compatible with both spellshapes, consult the Prime Constants table to determine the prime constants that can be used to cast a spell of the desired rank. Then, roll a number of d6s equal to your Intelligence modifier + half your proficiency bonus for the Lore skill you used to meet this feat’s prerequisites.

Perform some combination of addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division upon the numbers rolled that gives rise to one of the relevant prime constants. If you can produce one of the relevant prime constants, Sacred Geometry takes effect, applying both spellshapes to the spell. If you are unsuccessful, you fail to cast the spell, the action used to cast the spell is lost, and the spell slot or focus point is used up.

For example, suppose a wizard wants to use the Quickened Casting and Widen Spell spellshapes with a 2nd rank breathe fire spell. They refer to the Prime Constants table, and determine the prime constants are 11, 13, and 17. Since they have +3 Intelligence and are expert in Mathematics Lore (which they used to gain access to this feat they roll 5d6. The results of their dice pool are 6, 5, 4, 3, and 1.

They then perform the following operations to give rise to one of the prime constants they need: (6+5) + ([4-3]-1) = 11. Note they could also combine the numbers as follows: (6 x 4) - (5-1) - 3 = 17. They have produced one of the prime constants for the spell’s rank, so their spell gains the effects of both the Quickened Casting and Widen Spell spellshapes.

If the result of their dice pool were 1, 1, 1, 1, and 5, they would have been unable to produce any of the relevant prime constants. Their attempt would have been unsuccessful, and they would have expended the actions and spell slot for the spell with no effect.

Designer’s Note: This feat is not designed to be used. If you want an actually usable version of this feat, check out Wizards+.

Pathbuilder Note: Prime Constants Table can be found in the PDF

listCustomFeats.name: Sahkil Rejection
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychopomp Dedication

You have rejected the menial tasks found within serving the cycle of life and death, breaking your oaths and glutting yourself upon mortal terror. You lose the “create undead” anathema, and gain the Intimidating Strike fighter feat. In doing this, your psychopomp mask twists and warps to represent the specific terrors you inflict in your foes.

Whenever you would inflict a creature with the doomed condition or increase the value of their doomed condition, you may also increase their frightened value by the same amount. At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to the highest frightened value of creatures within 30 feet of you, excluding yourself.

Special You cannot select this feat if you have another feat that prohibits being taken if you have this feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Sailor's Spells
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pirate Dedication; trained in Nature or Occultism

Certain sailors such as yourself have learned the value of certain basic spells when at sea. Select occult or primal based on the skill you used to meet this feat’s requirements; that becomes the tradition of your sailor’s spells. You gain three cantrips of your choice as innate spells of your sailor’s spells tradition, chosen from a list based on that tradition. You also become trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs if you weren’t already.
- Occult bullhorn, guidance, haunting hymn, know the way, light, telekinetic projectile
- Primal electric arc, gale blast, guidance, know the way, light, spout

listCustomFeats.name: Sapping Symbol (Priest)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Raise Symbol
Trigger While you have your symbol raised, you are about to take damage from a melee attack

Your religious symbol glows with sacred energy, turning the attacker’s strength to weakness. Attempt a Religion check against the triggering creature’s Will DC. Regardless of the result, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is enfeebled 2 until it spends at least 1 action moving away from you.
Success As critical success, but enfeebled 1.

listCustomFeats.name: School Understanding
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication

You excelled when learning your wizard school, such that you have had time to practice the abilities of others. Select a wizard school other than your own. When you would automatically learn a curriculum spell, you can instead learn a spell from your chosen school. Additionally, you gain that school’s initial school spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Scoundrel's Focus
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Scoundrel Dedication; Focus Pool

You’ve mastered utilizing your focus. Whenever you Refocus, completely refill your focus pool.

listCustomFeats.name: Sea Legs
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You have grown heavily accustomed to work aboard ships and near the shore. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Athletics and Acrobatics checks made when moving aboard ships or underwater. This bonus also applies to your Reflex and Fortitude checks and DCs when resisting effects caused by aquatic hazards, moving ships, or abilities with the water trait.

listCustomFeats.name: Sea Shanty
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites sea singer muse

You’re familiar with the seas, and have learned methods to counter seasickness in others. You gain the sea shanty composition cantrip. You can also perform composition spells underwater without opening your mouth, the music being relayed through the waves. This also causes you to only reduce your remaining air by 1 as if you hadn’t cast a spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Seasick Grapple
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites sea reaver instinct

Whether on land or sea, you’ve learned to shake your foes in such a way that they become seasick in your arms. While you are raging and have a creature grabbed or restrained, they are sickened 1 for as long as they are grabbed or restrained by you. When the creature is no longer grabbed or restrained, it must make a Will save against your Barbarian DC or remain sickened for the next minute; if they fail, they may choose to fall prone and not remain sickened instead.

listCustomFeats.name: See Magic
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication

Your eyes detect magic innately, allowing you to read the properties of magic with ease. You gain the detect magic cantrip as an arcane innate spell. You also gain the see magic focus spell, which allows you to quickly identify the magical properties of objects and creatures.

listCustomFeats.name: Self-Modification
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshwarper Dedication

Your skill involves the warping and changing of others, so it’s no surprise you’d perform similar acts on yourself. You gain the Adopted Ancestry general feat for fleshwarps; you can select ancestry feats that would require specific physical characteristics from the ancestry. You also gain a 9th-level or lower fleshwarp ancestry feat of your choice that you meet the prerequisites for.

Special If you are a fleshwarp, you instead gain a 1st-level fleshwarp ancestry feat and a 9th-level or lower fleshwarp ancestry feat.

Pathbuilder Note Add any granted ancestry feats as custom feats.

listCustomFeats.name: Send Flying
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Knockback Strike; Knockout Punch

When you successfully hit a creature with a Knockout Punch, you can choose to send them flying as well. If the creature fails their saving throw against your Knockout Punch, they are Shoved as if you had succeeded a check to Shove them. On a critical failure, they are Shoved as if you had critically succeeded the check instead.

listCustomFeats.name: Sense Lawless
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Hellknight Dedication

You sense people who break your anathemas with a tight feeling in your throat and a pain in your temples. You can sense the presence of creatures that are actively breaking one of your anathemas within 120 feet. This acts as a vague sense, similar to a human’s sense of smell. A creature trying to use a disguise or otherwise hide its activities attempts a Deception check against your Perception DC to hide its activities from you. If the creature succeeds at its Deception check, it is then temporarily immune to your Sense Lawless for 1 day.

listCustomFeats.name: Sense Liar
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Hellknight Armiger Dedication

Your hellknight training allows you to sense lies with magical accuracy. You can cast discern lies once per day as a divine innate spell. Upon reaching 16th level, you can do so one additional time per day.

listCustomFeats.name: Sever Space (Sword Saint)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication
Requirements You are wielding a weapon that deals slashing damage or have an unarmed Strike that deals slashing damage.

You destroy the space between you and your targets, allowing you to strike with your melee weapons at great range. Make a melee Strike with the required weapon or unarmed attack. The attack gains an 80-foot reach for this Strike.

After the Strike, regardless of whether it succeeded, the world rushes to fill the space you destroyed, bringing you and the target adjacent to each other. You can choose to teleport to the closest space adjacent to the target or to attempt to teleport the target adjacent to you. If you choose the target, they can negate the teleportation if they succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC.

listCustomFeats.name: Shaper of the Seas
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Shipmind; legendary in Nature or Occultism

Your control over your ship is beyond supernatural, spanning vast distances and granting you unnatural insight. Any Pirate abilities with the magical trait that require you to be aboard your bound vessel instead require you to be within 1 mile of your bound vessel. This does not grant you the benefits of abilities that require you to be within a certain range of your vessel, such as Wings of Rope.

As a three-action activity while you are within one mile of your bound vessel, you can warp the weather itself to aid you. Weather around you changes as if you had gotten a success (but not a critical success) on an 8th-rank control weather ritual, except it affects a 1-mile emanation centered on your ship. This effect lasts for 24 hours or until you change it again.

Special This feat gains the occult or primal trait, matching the option you chose for the Shipmind feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Sheathe Strike
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication

Not only can you utilize your sheath for sword techniques, you can strike with it as its own weapon. You can make Strikes with your chosen weapon’s sheath; when you do so, it is a simple melee weapon that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage, is from the club weapon group, and has the agile, finesse, parry, and twin traits (it is twin with your chosen weapon). If you have the critical specialization effect for your chosen weapon, you also have it for your chosen weapon’s sheath.

You can bind an appropriate sheath to a copy of your chosen weapon during your daily preparations; when you do so, it gains all the fundamental and property runes of the chosen weapon while you are wielding it. However, the chosen weapon can only be stowed within that sheath to count as being sheathed; otherwise, the chosen weapon fails to sit right and cannot be used to Lightning Draw.

When you use Lighting Draw, you may Interact to draw the sheath as a free action. Your sheathe counts as your chosen weapon for effects that would allow you to make Lightning Draw attacks with multiple weapons, such as Twin Lightning.

listCustomFeats.name: Shipmind
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pirate Dedication; expert in Nature or Occultism

You and your ship are intrinsically connected, granting you knowledge of the ship that would otherwise be unnatural. By spending a week of downtime communing with and learning a ship, you can magically bind yourself to a vehicle with a swim speed or fly speed, referred to as your bound vessel. While you are within 1 mile of your bound vessel and conscious, you are aware of its current health, the number of creatures aboard it, whether or not it is moving, and the direction it is facing. You also gain the Shipsight action.

Shipsight [three-action] (concentrate, scrying) Requirements You are aboard your bound vessel; Effect You magically cast your gaze to a location aboard your ship. While this effect is active, you gain the benefits of the clairvoyance spell, except it can only target a location on your bound vessel. You can Sustain this effect, and while it is active your normal body is paralyzed.

Special This feat and the Shipsight action gain your choice of the occult or primal trait, depending on the skill you used to gain this feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Shot in the Dark
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites steel hound methodology
Requirements You're wielding a loaded firearm.

Make a Strike with a firearm. You ignore your target’s concealed condition, as well as the target’s lesser cover or standard cover; if the target had greater cover, they instead have only standard cover against the Strike. If you use the result from an Attack Stratagem for this attack, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the attack roll.

listCustomFeats.name: Signature Utensils
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Wandering Chef Dedication; expert in Crafting or Cooking Lore

You’re used to working with a particular set of cookware when making meals. During your daily preparations, you can designate a single set of cookware you own as your signature utensils. You gain a +1 item bonus to Crafting and Cooking Lore checks to Craft items you could normally make with Wandering Chef’s Quick Alchemy (typically alchemical food). If you have the Packed With Flavor feat, this item bonus increases to +2.

Additionally, when you Craft such items during downtime using these utensils, you can produce twice as many items in a single batch without spending additional preparatory time. For instance, if you are creating egg cream fizz, you can craft up to 8 in a single batch during downtime, rather than four. This doesn’t change the amount of alchemical reagents or other ingredients required to craft each item, nor does it change your rate of progress for days past the base downtime spent.

listCustomFeats.name: Siphon Curse
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; implement occultism
Requirements The target of your Empower Implement is at least cursebound 1 and you are holding your implement

You can draw the torment from curses you place to empower your attacks. You gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls until the end of your turn. You may then make a Strike against the target of your Empower Implement as a free action, using your normal multiple attack penalty.

listCustomFeats.name: Siphon Spell
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication

When you counteract enemy spells, you can sometimes siphon some of their magic into yourself. Whenever you roll a critical success on a counteract check against a spell, roll a d20 and add the counteracted spell’s rank. On a 15 or higher, you regain a Focus Point.

listCustomFeats.name: Size Control
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

You can compress or expand your released form as it fits your needs.
