When you Release Power, you can become as small as Tiny (decreasing your reach to 0 feet if you do so) or as large as Huge (increasing your reach by 5 feet if you were already Large, or 10 feet if you were Medium or smaller). You can use a single action with the concentrate trait while your power is released to change your size between Tiny and Huge, altering your reach accordingly. Additionally, while your power is released, you ignore movement penalties from difficult terrain and can Squeeze at full speed.

listCustomFeats.name: Skip Between
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sahkil Rejection

You can hop between the real and ethereal, allowing you to ambush creatures when they least expect it. While you are wearing your psychopomp mask, you move from the Universe to the Ethereal plane or vice-versa, with the effects of a 7th-rank ethereal jaunt except the effect has an unlimited duration and can be Dismissed. You can spend 1 Mythic Point when you do so; if you do, you can bring along any creatures you have grabbed or restrained. A creature returns to the Universe when they stop being grabbed or restrained by you.

listCustomFeats.name: Sleeper Hold (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication
Requirements You have a creature grabbed or restrained.

You pinch crucial points of your target's nervous system, impeding its ability to function. Attempt an Athletics check to Grapple the creature, with the following success and critical success effects instead of the usual effects.

Critical Success The target falls unconscious for 1 minute, though it remains standing and doesn't drop what it holds.
Success The target is clumsy 1 until the end of its next turn.

listCustomFeats.name: Slicing Roar
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Roaring Blade Stance

When you make a Strike in Roaring Blade stance with your chosen weapon, you can slice the air itself to strike at a distance. While you’re in Roaring Blade stance, you can make slicing roar Strikes using your chosen weapon as ranged Strikes against targets within 30 feet; you can also do so in place of Strikes made with your chosen weapon. Slicing roar Strikes deal the same number of dice and have the same die size as your chosen weapon (using the larger die if it is a two-hand weapon and you are wielding it in both hands), but deal sonic damage instead of the normal damage type. These Strikes use the same proficiency as your chosen weapon and have the forceful, nonlethal, and propulsive traits; if your chosen weapon is agile, they also have the agile trait. They do not gain the deadly trait from Lightning Draw.

If you have access to your chosen weapon’s critical specialization, your slicing roar strikes gain this effect on a critical strike: You knock the target back from you 5 feet. This is forced movement.

listCustomFeats.name: Smash and Grab
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Burglar Dedication

You can attack a creature and steal from them at the same time. Make a melee Strike against an adjacent enemy. If you hit and the target is off-guard, you can also attempt to Steal from the target, even if the target is in combat.

listCustomFeats.name: Smash from the Air (Sword Saint)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Cut from the Air

Your expertise enables you to knock away spells. You can use Cut from the Air against ranged spell attacks.

listCustomFeats.name: Smashing Fists
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Mastery Chymist Dedication

Your fists become powerful weapons while within your mutagenic form, increasing their damage dice to d6s and granting them the forceful, grapple, and razing traits, but causing them to lose the finesse trait. When you Strike using your fists in your mutagenic form, you can have your unarmed attack modifier have a Strength attribute modifier of +4 unless your modifier is higher. Additionally, you can have your fists proficiency with your fists increase to expert, or master if you are a master in Fortitude saves.

listCustomFeats.name: Song of Surrender
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You learn the song of surrender composition spell, commonly used by pirate-bards or privateers to leave victims alive but defeated.

listCustomFeats.name: Spellshapremacy
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication; spellshape feat or spell

You can channel additional magic to tie a spellshape innately into a spell. You gain the quicken spellshape focus spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Spheres of Influence
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

Your power expands to encompass domains more normally associated with the natural world. Select up to three additional domains to lay claim to, one of which must be from the list of domains you chose from the Tapestric Horror Dedication feat and two which can be any domain of your choice. Your mortal form cannot normally contain this power, however–each day during your daily preparations, decide which of your four domains you are currently embodying; you gain access to this domain for the day and can cast its domain spells as normal, while your ability to access the power of your other domains lies dormant. You learn the advanced domain spell for any domain that you have claimed with your tapestry horror abilities.

When you gain this feat, you can choose not to lay claim to one or more domains immediately, instead leaving the space open until later in your story. As long as you have one or more domains unclaimed, you can spend a Mythic Point as a single action to claim a domain, even in the heat of battle, immediately making this your active domain. This domain remains a part of your portfolio forever and cannot be changed after this point.

While your power is released, however, you can channel all of your horrific might at once, gaining access to all the domains you have claimed for the next minute. After your power stops being released, you can choose which of the four domains you retain access to until your next daily preparations.

listCustomFeats.name: Spinebreaker (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication
Requirements You have a creature grabbed or restrained.

You squeeze your opponent in a vicious bear hug, putting intense pressure on their nerves, joints, or other pain points. Attempt an Athletics check to Grapple a creature you have grabbed or restrained, with the following additional effects if you succeed.

Critical Success The target is clumsy 2 until the end of its next turn and then is clumsy 1 for 1 minute.
Success The target is clumsy 1 until the end of its next turn.

listCustomFeats.name: Spiritual Warrior
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Host of War

You channel occult magic through your armor and talismans to call upon the spirits of ancient warriors. You can cast spiritual guardian once per day as an occult innate spell. You must be wearing medium or heavy armor to do so. At 14th level and every 2 levels thereafter, the spiritual guardian spell is heightened by 1 rank (to a maximum of 9th rank when you reach 20th level).

listCustomFeats.name: Steady Implement Casting
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; implement occultism

While you may falter from blows, you know how to maintain your implement’s power through the pain. If a reaction would disrupt your spellcasting action when casting a cantrip or domain spell granted by this archetype, attempt a DC 15 flat check. If you succeed or you are holding the implement associated with the spell being cast, your action isn’t disrupted.

listCustomFeats.name: Steal Spell
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Legendary Thief; Loaner Spell

When you use Legendary Thief to steal the impossible, you can steal a prepared spell or spontaneous spell from a foe. The spell is randomly selected from the highest-level spells the foe knows and can currently cast, to a maximum of the highest level spell you can cast from spell slots; the target loses the appropriate spell slot as if they had cast it themself.

You can Cast the Spell once before your next daily preparations; this otherwise works the same as casting a Loaner Spell. You can only have one spell stolen at a time, with any new spell you steal replacing the previous one.

listCustomFeats.name: Stella's Stab and Snag (Burglar)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Burglar Dedication, expert in Thievery
Access Member of the Pathfinder Society.
Requirements You are wielding a piercing or slashing melee weapon.

You dart towards your opponent, seeking to stab them and slice their purse-strings with a single movement. Stride up to your Speed; this movement does not trigger reactions triggered by movement. At any point during this movement you can Strike an opponent within reach. If this Strike is successful, you can attempt a Thievery check to Steal from the target.

listCustomFeats.name: Step Through Reality
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

The physical dimensions of space are hardly a bother to you anymore, the simplest movements allowing you to move great distances. You gain the Feather Step general feat, ignoring its prerequisites. You can Step up to your speed, as long as you can identify the destination precisely both by its position relative to your starting position and by its appearance (or other identifying features). When you do so, your Step action gains the teleportation trait and causes you to instantly move to your destination. When an effect would allow you to Stride, you can Step instead. If you have a fly or swim speed, you can Step to a location you could fly or swim to, respectively.

listCustomFeats.name: Steward of the Great Beyond
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Researcher Dedication; ability to cast spells from spell slots
Trigger A creature Casts a Spell or uses an action that has the incarnate, summon, or teleportation trait.

You know means of keeping aberrations out of the Universe or keeping them in so you can slay them. You expend a spell slot to counter the triggering creature’s spell or action, rolling a counteract check using the expended spell’s rank and your choice of Arcana or Occultism.

listCustomFeats.name: Still the Waves
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sea Shanty

The power of your music can calm stormy seas or turn a tranquil sea to a torrent. When you cast a composition spell, you can alter the sea around you. If you choose to do so, until the start of your next turn, you create one of the following effects of your choice in a 30-foot emanation:
- Turbulent water around you calms. Whenever a creature within the area would make a check to Swim, they treat their degree of success as one higher. Creatures with a swim speed automatically count as critically succeeding.
- The seas turn rough. Whenever a creature within the area would make a check to Swim, they treat their degree of success as one lower. Creatures with a swim speed can still choose to automatically succeed, but their swim speed is halved when they do so.
Alternatively, you can spend one minute performing a ballad to the waves, causing the effect to last for one hour or until changed or dispelled, whichever comes first.

listCustomFeats.name: Stipend
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication

Your family provides you with a steady supply of income to use as you see fit. You gain a stipend, which acts as storage for money provided by your family. Each day, your stipend gains money as if you had successfully (but not critically successfully) Earned Income for that day using your Family Lore with a task level equal to your level. Your stipend does not have a maximum storage capacity; you can also deposit money into your stipend for safe storage.

You can only withdraw or deposit money while you are at a location where you can access your family’s account, such as at a bank or similar institution. Such institutions are rarely found outside of settlements of level 4 or higher. You can also gain access to this account through family connections, though the full extent of doing so is up to the GM.

listCustomFeats.name: Strange Script
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication

You have such familiarity with obscure texts that you can compel them to reveal their secrets. Once per day, you can touch a single text (such as a tome, a wall of hieroglyphics, or something similar) and understand its meaning for 1 hour. If the text is in multiple languages, you gain the ability to understand them all for only the purposes of reading the text. If the text is in a code or cypher, you don't automatically understand the text, but you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to decipher it.

listCustomFeats.name: Strangle (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Wrestler Dedication
Requirements You have a creature grabbed or restrained.

You squeeze the breath out of your foe. Make an unarmed melee Strike against the creature you have grabbed or restrained. On a success, you gain a circumstance bonus to damage equal to the number of weapon damage dice, and the target can barely speak until the start of your next turn or until it Escapes, whichever comes first. While it can barely speak, the target can’t vocalize above a hoarse whisper, and it must succeed at a DC 10 flat check or lose any action that requires speech. For an action requiring speech that is also a manipulate action, like Casting a Spell with the concentrate and manipulate trait, the target just rolls a single DC 10 flat check, rather than an additional DC 5 flat check for being grabbed.

listCustomFeats.name: Submission Hold (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Wrestler Dedication
Requirements You have a creature grabbed or restrained.

Your iron grip saps your opponent’s strength. Attempt an Athletics check to Grapple the creature you have grabbed or restrained, with the following additional effects if you succeed.

Critical Success The target is enfeebled 2 until the end of its next turn and then is enfeebled 1 for 1 minute.
Success The target is enfeebled 1 until the end of its next turn.

listCustomFeats.name: Summon Deathly Ally
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Psychopomp Dedication

You call upon your connections to the Boneyard to gain assistance from another of your kind. Spend a Mythic Point. You summon a creature that has the psychopomp trait whose level is 3 or more levels lower than your own to aid you in battle. This creature gains the summoned trait. You can sustain this ability for one minute. If you have the Sahkil Rejection feat, you instead summon a creature that has the sahkil trait.

Once per day, you can use this ability without spending a Mythic Point. If you do, the creature you summon must have a level 4 or more levels lower than your own, and you can only sustain that usage of the ability for one minute.

listCustomFeats.name: Summon Servant of Law
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per 10 minutes
Prerequisites Hellknight Armiger Dedication

You can call upon a servant of law to aid you. Summon a hell hound at a location within 30 feet. This creature gains the summoned trait. You can Sustain this ability for up to 1 minute.

Starting at 12th level, you can instead summon an axiomite; at 14th level, you can instead summon a zelekhut or greater hell hound.

listCustomFeats.name: Suplex (Brawler)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication
Requirements You have a creature grabbed or restrained.

Flexing your entire body, you heave your opponent over your head and slam them into the ground. Make an unarmed melee Strike against the creature you have grabbed or restrained. On a success, the target lands prone, and on a critical success, the target lands prone and takes an additional 2d6 bludgeoning damage. Regardless of whether the Strike is successful, you immediately release your hold on the target.

listCustomFeats.name: Suppliers in High Places
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Craftsman Dedication; Leverage Connections

You have learned to make strong contacts with suppliers of rarer materials, be it from noble courts or vast trade networks. While you are in a settlement that you can use Leverage Connections within, you count as having access to any materials whose level is less than both your own and the settlement’s level. This can include chunks of material such as dawnsilver or adamantine, spellcasting services providing the casting of a spell, or any other leveled components needed when crafting an item. You must still pay the value of the materials or services, but unless there is a specific drought of the item or service within the town, you can access it without needing to track it down.

listCustomFeats.name: Swagger
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites stylish combatant; trained in Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation

You have a confident air around you in the face of your foes that can be unnerving to many. While you are at full hit points and do not have the wounded condition, you gain a +1 status bonus to Diplomacy, Deception, and Intimidation checks, as well as AC.

listCustomFeats.name: Swagger (Pirate)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites trained in Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation

You have a confident air around you in the face of your foes that can be unnerving to many. While you are at full hit points and do not have the wounded condition, you gain a +1 status bonus to Diplomacy, Deception, and Intimidation checks, as well as AC.

listCustomFeats.name: Swallow-Slice Dance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per 10 minutes
Prerequisites Flowing Blade Stance
Requirements You are in Flowing Blade Stance and your chosen weapon is sheathed

You move across the battlefield with delicate grace and deadly precision. You Step, then Lightning Draw (ignoring the flourish trait), then Step, then Strike, then Step, then Strike. These additional Strikes gain the benefits of Lightning Draw, and the penalty to AC doesn’t apply until after the final Strike. The multiple attack penalty for the second and third strikes is -4 and -8, or -3 and -6 if the weapon is agile.

listCustomFeats.name: Sword Saint Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites sword saint’s iaijutsu

You have trained to use one of several stances utilizing your chosen weapon. Choose one 4th level Sword Saint archetype feat with the stance trait. You gain that feat, ignoring its level prerequisite.

listCustomFeats.name: Sword and Pistol
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You're comfortable wielding a firearm or crossbow in one hand and a melee weapon in the other, combining melee attacks with shots from the firearm. When you make a successful ranged Strike against an enemy within your reach with your one-handed firearm or one-handed crossbow, that enemy is off-guard against your next melee attack with a one-handed melee weapon.

When you make a successful melee Strike against an enemy with your one-handed melee weapon, the next ranged Strike you make against that enemy with a one-handed firearm or one-handed crossbow doesn't trigger reactions that would trigger on a ranged attack but not a melee attack, such as Reactive Strike. Either of these benefits is lost if not used by the end of your next turn.
listCustomFeats.traits: Uncommon, Champion, Exemplar, Fighter, Inquisitor, Inventor, Investigator, Ranger, Rogue, Swashbuckler, Thaumaturge, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Tapestric Horror Dedication
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Requirements master in Occultism

When your mind was opened to the powers of the dark tapestry, knowledge poured into you with such volume that you felt your head might burst. When you awoke the next day, you knew immediately that you were far more than you once were but less than you could be; the limitations, it seemed, came from your body. But you could break these limitations, with time, and become something greater.

You gain the aberration trait. Choose one of the following domains to lay claim to: abomination, change, delirium, dreams, nightmares, void. You learn the initial domain spell for this domain. You gain expert proficiency in spell attack rolls and spell DCs, and your spellcasting ability for this spell, as well as any spells granted by this archetype, is your choice of Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma, decided when you gain this feat.

In addition, you can release your true power in short bursts. You gain the release power focus spell. You gain a pool of Focus Points with 2 Focus Points and you can Refocus by taking 10 minutes to replenish yourself with energy drawn from the dark tapestry. These focus spells, as well as any other spells you gain from this archetype, are occult spells instead of their normal tradition.

listCustomFeats.name: Terrify the Townsfolk
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Fleshwarper Dedication

Your creations are beautiful, but others fail to see your brilliance; as such, if you cannot inspire love, you will cause fear! You can use Medicine to Demoralize and Coerce living creatures; you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to do so if the target can see a creature with the fleshwarp trait that is under your control. When you do so, these actions always have both the auditory and visual traits, and you always suffer a penalty to the check if they don’t understand your language.

listCustomFeats.name: Terrifying Strike
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication
Requirements your chosen weapon is sheathed

You strike with such resounding accuracy and speed that it terrifies those around. Make a Lightning Draw attack, ignoring the flourish trait. If the attack hits, all enemies within a 30 foot emanation that can see you must make a Will save against the higher of your class or spell DC or be frightened 1 (or frightened 2 on a critical failure). If your attack reduces the target to 0 hit points, enemies suffer a -2 circumstance penalty to this saving throw.
listCustomFeats.traits: Archetype, Concentrate, Emotion, Flourish, Mental, Visual, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: The Big Heist
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Burglar Dedication
Requirements you are in a settlement

While some pickpockets and honest citizens may earn their income slowly, you gain it in huge lump sums. Spend a week preparing and performing a heist, and make a Thievery check using the Income Earned table from the Earn Income action with a task level equal to your level or the settlement’s level, whichever is lower. No matter the result, if you use this activity more than once per 30 days in the same settlement, you suffer a -10 penalty for each additional attempt after the first, or -15 if it’s at the same location.

Critical Success The heist is a massive success, granting you currency equal to 60 times the amount of currency listed for the task level and your proficiency rank.
Success The heist is a success, granting you currency equal to 30 times the amount of currency listed for the task level and your proficiency rank.
Failure The heist is a failure and you barely make it out unnoticed. Gain currency equal to 10 times the amount listed for a failure of the task’s level.
Critical Failure The heist is a massive failure and while you get away, you’re not safe for much longer. Your reputation suffers massively in the settlement, and local authorities may be seeking your arrest or execution. The full consequences of this failure are up to the GM, but should be such that showing your face in public within the settlement becomes a major risk.

listCustomFeats.name: Thick-Skinned
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your skin is hard like leather. When you’re unarmored, you gain a +1 item bonus to AC with a Dexterity cap of +3. The item bonus to AC increases to +2 at 5th level. This item bonus to AC is cumulative with armor potency runes on your explorer's clothing, mystic armor, and bands of force; it is not cumulative, however, with other feats that grant a similar effect such as the Animal Skin barbarian feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Thinblood Resistance
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Patchmen are often experimented upon by the crueler species native to the Darklands, and you or your ancestors have built up a resistance to these experiments. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a disease or poison, you get a critical success instead. If you have a different ability that would improve the save in this way (such as the battle hardened fighter class feature), if you roll a critical failure on the save you get a failure instead.

listCustomFeats.name: Thunderous Strike
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication
Requirements your chosen weapon is sheathed

Your strike slices the sound barrier, potentially deafening nearby enemies. Make a Lightning Draw attack, ignoring the flourish trait. If the attack hits, all enemies within a 30-foot emanation that can hear you must make a Fortitude save against the higher of your class or spell DC. This effect has the incapacitation trait. If you are in Roaring Blade Stance, all enemies that fail the saving throw suffer sonic damage equal to your chosen weapon’s damage dice, or twice as much on a critical failure.

Critical Success The target is unaffected
Success The target is deafened for 1 minute and stunned 1.
Failure The target is deafened for 10 minutes and stunned 2.
Critical Failure The target is deafened permanently and stunned 3.

listCustomFeats.name: Tormenter Ascendance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sakhil Rejection

You draw upon the power of the fear you inflict to claw yourself fully into the ranks of the sahkils. You gain the sahkil and fiend traits. You become immune to disease and fear effects. So long as you inflict the frightened condition on a creature at least once per day, you do not need to eat or sleep and cease aging; as long as you are within a populated area, you can do so during a rest without requiring a check.

You can cast fear at will as a 3th-rank divine innate spell. Additionally, once per day, you can cast one of the following spells as a 9th-rank divine innate spell: confusion, phantasmal calamity, warp mind, or weird.

When you would be killed, if there is at least one creature frightened within 100 feet of you, you are instead reduced to 0 Hit Points and disappear into the creature’s mind. There, you produce a temporary immersive mindscape, as per a critical success on the construct mindscape ritual. Each night the creature rests, their mind travels to the dreamscape where you torment them to regain power, gaining the benefits of their rest in addition to your own but depriving them of the benefits of rest. You cannot leave this realm until you are fully healed or the victim dies of exhaustion; when you leave, the immersive mindscape collapses. If you would be killed within the Ethereal Plane (including within this immersive mindscape), you are killed permanently.

listCustomFeats.name: Torturer’s Mettle
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pain Taster Dedication

You gain pleasure and vitality from your own suffering. When you end your turn while suffering persistent damage and don’t recover from it, you gain temporary hit points equal to half your level which last until the start of your next turn.

listCustomFeats.name: Touches of Ancestry
listCustomFeats.textDescription: While you’re certainly more aberrative and warped by the fleshwarping process, your original ancestry is still discernible. You gain the Adopted Ancestry general feat and can choose any common or uncommon humanoid ancestry with the feat, and can select ancestry feats that would require specific physical characteristics from the ancestry (such as the Tusks orc feat). You also gain the Additional Lore skill feat for your chosen ancestry’s Lore, such as Dwarven Lore or Ratfolk Lore.

listCustomFeats.name: Touches of Heritage
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Touches of Ancestry

You’ve searched inwards to your original self and emerged with memories of your former heritage. You gain the benefits of a heritage from the ancestry you chose for Touches of Ancestry.

listCustomFeats.name: Trickster's Breadth
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Eldritch Scoundrel Dedication; expert spellcasting benefits

Your spellcasting extends further, allowing you to use additional minor magics. Increase the number of spell slots you gain from your spellcasting archetype by 1 for each spell rank other than your four highest spell slots from that archetype.

Pathbuilder Note Add the additional spell slots manually.

listCustomFeats.name: Tut-Tut (Noble Scion)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Noble Scion Dedication
Trigger You hit a creature with a melee attack roll.

The Sapphire Butterfly is not one for violence when simply intimidating a foe will do. From that vigilante's techniques, you've learned how to pull a deadly blow at the last moment, threatening your target instead of striking them. Rather than dealing damage with the triggering Strike, attempt an Intimidation check with a +2 circumstance bonus to Demoralize all enemies within 30 feet who can see you. If you critically succeed at your check to Demoralize the target of your Strike, their attitude toward you improves by one step while they also become frightened 2.
listCustomFeats.traits: Archetype, Emotion, Fear, Mental, Press, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Twin Lightning
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Sword Saint Dedication
Requirements You have two weapons sheathed, at least one of which is your chosen weapon

You unleash a dual slice with two weapons, incorporating your Lightning Draw technique. Make Lightning Draw attacks, ignoring the flourish trait, one with each weapon; if one of the weapons isn’t your chosen weapon, you instead Interact to Draw it and Strike. Both Strikes must have the same target, and use your current multiple attack penalty. If the second Strike is made with a weapon that doesn’t have the agile trait, it takes a –2 penalty.

If both attacks hit, combine their damage, and then add any other applicable effects from both weapons. You add any precision damage only once, to the attack of your choice. Combine the damage from both Strikes and apply resistances and weaknesses only once. This counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty.

listCustomFeats.name: Unceasing Anatomy
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

In your released form, your body grows a variety of stability and sensory appendages, causing your containment to become extremely difficult. While your power is released, you gain all-around vision and are permanently under the effects of an unfettered movement spell heightened to half your level, rounded down. Finally, you may choose to automatically succeed on saving throws you make to resist effects with the teleportation trait as long as the source is of your level or lower, or half your level or lower if the effect is a spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Underworld Guide
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You have a particular knack for traveling within the Darklands. You gain your choice of the Forager or Terrain Expertise (underground) general feat. You also gain the Additional Lore general feat for Darklands Lore.

listCustomFeats.name: Unspeakable Presence
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

Your released form is horrific to behold, capable of killing creatures that get too close. You gain an aura of mortal terror that’s a 10-foot emanation, or a 20-foot emanation while your power is released. An enemy that enters or ends its turn in the aura must attempt a Will save against the higher of your spell DC or class DC.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune to your Unspeakable Presence for 10 minutes.
Success The creature is frightened 1 and temporarily immune to your Unspeakable Presence for 1 minute.
Failure The creature is frightened 2.
Critical Failure The creature’s mind reels in the face of your true form. It must attempt a Fortitude save against the higher of your spell DC or class DC. On a failure, the creature dies; otherwise, it is frightened 4.
listCustomFeats.traits: Basic Mythic, Aura, Death, Emotion, Fear, Incapacitation, Mental, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Urban Arcana
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites city order

Through focus, you can call upon magic tied to the cityscape. Add bullhorn, musical accompaniment, lock, object reading, knock, phantom crowd, locate, wanderer’s guide, liminal doorway, outcast’s curse, strange geometry, aura of the unremarkable, planar palace, hidden mind, and resplendent mansion to your spell list. You can prepare these spells just like you can any spell on the primal spell list once you can prepare spells of their rank as a druid. These are primal spells when you prepare them this way, even though they normally aren’t on the primal list.

If you are in an urban environment, you can spend 10 minutes connecting to the city to replace one of the spells you’ve prepared with a spell of the same rank from this list of spells. You can do this while Refocusing.

listCustomFeats.name: Urban Bond
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites city order

You can call upon magic with aid of the cities you have visited. Select the Cities, Family, Glyph, Knowledge, or Protection domain and gain its initial domain spell as an order spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Special You can select this feat up to three times, choosing another domain and gaining its initial domain spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Urbanwalk
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You move through cities and crowds without issue. You gain your choice of the Eyes of the City or Streetwise skill feats. You ignore difficult terrain caused by crowds, and can allow up to 5 willing creatures to do the same as long as they remain within 60 feet of you. When you Tumble Through a humanoid creature, you can use Society instead of Acrobatics.

listCustomFeats.name: Usher Ascendance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychopomp Dedication; you do not have the Sakhil Rejection feat

Through dedication to your calling, you have been welcomed into the ranks of the psychopomps. You gain the monitor and psychopomp traits. You become immune to disease and gain fast healing 10. You cease aging, and cannot die from old age.

You can cast vision of death at will as a 4th-rank divine innate spell. Additionally, you can cast manifestation once per day, but only in a manner that pronounces judgment as a psychopomp, typically either to restore a dead or destroyed creature to life, bind a creature to the Boneyard, or banish a creature from the Boneyard.

When you would be killed, you are instead reduced to 0 Hit Points, become unconscious, and are immediately transported to the Boneyard at Pharasma’s side. After 1 hour, you regain 5 hit points and reawaken, after which you are given the opportunity to continue serving as a psychopomp or pass along to the River of Souls. If you choose to continue serving, you can’t leave the Boneyard for the next week, during which you perform the duties of a psychopomp without leaving the plane; afterwards, you may appear anywhere in the Universe of your choice adjacent to a creature with the dying condition.

listCustomFeats.name: Usher’s Translocation
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychopomp Dedication; you do not have the Sakhil Rejection feat

You can travel across the battlefield by slipping between the planes. While you are wearing your psychopomp mask, you can cast translocate as a 4th-rank divine innate spell at will. When you do so, unlike normal for translocate, you can bring another willing creature with you; if you do so, you can only travel up to 60 feet.

listCustomFeats.name: Usurp Spell
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Cost Expend a spell slot with a rank greater than the targeted spell (see below)
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication

You can use raw magical energy to usurp control over a spell. When you use one of these activities, you must spend a spell slot with a rank greater than the rank of the spell you are attempting to usurp, or the activity fails and the spell slot is wasted.

Rebuttal [reaction] Trigger A creature Casts a Spell that targets at least one creature; Effect You bend the magic to target other creatures. Make an Arcana check against the creature’s spellcasting DC. On a success, select new targets for the triggering spell.

Unravel [three-actions] (manipulate) Select a creature that could Sustain a Spell on its next turn and make an Arcana check against their spellcasting DC.

Failure The target’s spell is unaffected.
Success You temporarily usurp control over one of the target creature’s sustainable spells. You are treated as the caster of the spell, until the start of your next turn. You may immediately Sustain the spell as a free action. At the start of your next turn, you may choose to have the spell immediately end instead of reverting to the original caster’s control.
Critical Success As success, but you wholly usurp control, being treated as the caster for the remainder of the spell’s duration in place of its original caster. At the start of each of your turns while controlling the spell, you may choose to end the spell immediately.

listCustomFeats.name: Vanth Wings
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychopomp Dedication

You sprout a set of skeletal wings from your back which you can extend or retract at will. While you are wearing your psychopomp mask, you can manifest these wings as a free action, granting you a fly speed equal to your land Speed and the Flyby Attack action.
While your wings are manifested, you gain resistance to cold damage equal to your level.

Flyby Attack [two-actions] Effect You Fly and can make a Strike at any point along the way.

listCustomFeats.name: Versatile Intimidation
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Hellknight Armiger Dedication; expert in Intimidation

You can bend your powers of intimidation to other charismatic means. Select Deception, Diplomacy, or Performance. You can use Intimidation instead of the chosen skill for Skill Actions that would normally use the chosen skill. In addition, you can use your proficiency rank in Intimidation to meet the prerequisites of skill feats that require a particular proficiency rank in the chosen skill.

listCustomFeats.name: Visage of Eternity
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Tapestric Horror Dedication

You gaze into a creature’s eyes, showing them visions of the eternity that exists beyond them. You can cast confusion once per 10 minutes as an occult innate spell. When you do so, it gains the visual trait. When you cast it while your power is released, the spell is heightened to 8th rank.

listCustomFeats.name: Void Touch
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Elder Oath

You can, with a touch, afflict creatures with energy from the Dark Tapestry itself. You gain the touch of the void devotion spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, and you can Refocus by praying to your god. You become an expert in spell attack rolls and spell DCs.

listCustomFeats.name: Wandering Emotions
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per round
Prerequisites Psychokineticist Dedication
Requirements You used your most recent action to use an impulse

When your Elements are Unleashed, each burst of power folds space around you, and you travel through one of those folds. You teleport 15 feet to a square you can see.
listCustomFeats.traits: Archetype, Concentrate, Occult, Psyche, Teleportation, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Warp Defense
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication

You can shape a spell to attack an enemy from an unexpected weakness, even if it would normally be impossible. You learn the sure strike spell and add it to your spell collection (this does not count against the number of spells you can add to your spell collection each day). You also gain the warp defense focus spell, which allows you to change the type of save creatures make against your spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Warp Rune
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Cost Expend a spell slot
Prerequisites Arcanist Dedication

You can channel raw magic to fundamentally alter a weapon’s rune or enhance the weapons of those around you.

Rebuttal [reaction] Trigger You successfully Strike a creature with a weapon that has the corrosive, flaming, frost, shock, or thundering rune; Effect Your magic warps the rune. You may change the triggering rune to a different one of the runes on the list. This Strike deals additional damage equal to the rank of the expended spell, with a damage type matching the chosen rune. This change lasts for up to one minute, Sustaining it whenever you Strike a creature with that weapon. If the weapon has the greater variant of one of these runes, you may exchange it for the greater variant of one of the other runes on the list instead. If the weapon’s damage type is the same as that of the property rune, you may change the damage type of the weapon to match.

Unravel [three-actions] (manipulate) You unleash a pulse of runic might that enhances the weapons of your allies. All weapons within a 30-foot emanation that are being held by an ally gain a +1 item bonus to attack and damage rolls for the next minute. This item bonus increases to +2 if the expended spell slot is rank 7 or higher, or +3 if the expended spell slot is rank 10.

listCustomFeats.name: Watchful Blade Stance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Reactive Lightning
Requirements you are unarmored

You enter a stance of guarded movement and defensive posturing. While your chosen weapon is sheathed, you reduce the circumstance penalty to AC from Lightning Draw by 1 (typically to -1), or 2 if you are at least 14th level. Additionally, when you use Reactive Lightning, you can Strike if the triggering creature fails or critically fails to strike you and the attack was made without a multiple attack penalty.

Additionally, while you are in this stance, your circumstance bonus to hit from Lightning Draw increases to +2.

listCustomFeats.name: Ways of the City
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites city order

Just as a normal druid may know how to traverse certain paths in a city, you find it easy to move through the urban landscape unimpeded. When attempting to Disable a Device or Pick a Lock, you can use Nature instead of Thievery as you magically work the mechanisms. When you do so, you are not required to be holding or wearing a thieves’ toolkit.

Additionally, while you are in an urban environment but not inside of a private residence, you aren’t off-guard to hidden, undetected, or flanking creatures of your level or lower, or creatures of your level or lower using surprise attack. Creatures in these situations can still help their allies flank you. You can gain these benefits inside of private residences you are invited or allowed into.

listCustomFeats.name: Weakness in Numbers
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You know how to manipulate crowds to your advantage, striking them when they are weak or using them to entrap foes. When determining if your foe is flanked, you treat all squares occupied by a crowd, swarm, or troop as if they were occupied by an ally with a melee reach of 5 feet. Additionally, your attacks and spells count as dealing area damage when made against swarms and troops.

Special If you would gain an animal companion, these benefits extend to them as well.

listCustomFeats.name: Weaver of Terror
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Consigned Dedication; your patron is a sahkil

You feed upon the fear of others, sowing terror that your masters may reap. You gain a status bonus to saving throws against fear effects equal to your consignment tier.

If you have at least two consignment feats, when you critically hit a creature with a Strike, the creature is frightened 1 with a Will save against the higher of your class or spell DC. This is a critical specialization effect.

If you have at least three consignment feats, when you deal damage to a frightened creature within 30 feet with an attack or spell, that creature can’t reduce their frightened condition below 1 until the beginning of your next turn.

If you have at least four consignment feats, you have been taught to sup upon fear the fear of others like your masters. When you deal damage to a creature within 30 feet with an attack or spell, you regain hit points equal to 3 * their frightened value. If you would damage multiple creatures with this attack, you gain hit points equal to the highest frightened value among them.

listCustomFeats.name: Weeping Wounds (Pain Taster)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Pain Taster Dedication

Your strikes draw fountains of blood. The first time each turn you Strike a creature during a round and deal persistent bleed damage, but the target is already suffering from persistent bleed damage, they immediately suffer their existing persistent bleed damage as if it were the end of their turn. This does not cause them to make a flat check to recover from the persistent bleed damage.

listCustomFeats.name: Whimsical Purchase
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Stipend

You have learned to keep a certain amount of pocket change to the side in order to buy trinkets that spark your fancy. When you make your daily preparations in a settlement, you can select any item that you have access to with a level less than or equal to your level or the settlement’s level (whichever is lower). You gain that item until you use this ability again, after which you lose track of the item as it no longer interests you. While you certainly bought the item yourself for a good sum of money, its extravagance or peculiarity makes it worthless to sell due to it matching your own particular tastes.

listCustomFeats.name: Whistle the Wind
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per minute
Prerequisites Sea Shanty

Your music tames the wind, calling it to aid you and your allies. If the next action you use is to Cast a composition spell, you also cast gust of wind as a 1st-rank innate occult spell without expending a spell slot. When you do so, the spell can originate from any creature that is affected by the composition spell.

listCustomFeats.name: Wielder of Esoterica
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Occultist Dedication; expert in Occultism

You have a specialty in working with magic items, and can activate them thanks to your intuitive knowledge of their nature. You gain the Trick Magic Item skill feat. When you make a check to Trick Magic Item, you can use Occultism instead of a skill matching the item’s tradition as long as you are at least trained in the tradition’s skill. When you critically succeed a check to Trick a Magic Item, you can spend actions to activate the item for the next minute instead of for the rest of your turn.

listCustomFeats.name: Willbreaker
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Brawler Dedication
Trigger You reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee strike or successfully knock a creature unconscious with a melee strike

Your KOs are a spectacle, bringing terror to enemies near you. All enemies within a 15-foot emanation that can see you suffer a -1 circumstance penalty to Will saving throws for the next minute. If the triggering attack is a critical hit, this penalty increases to -2.

listCustomFeats.name: Winds of Vengeance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Prerequisites Whistle the Wind

You can entwine your music with a song that conjures a devastating natural storm. If the next action you use is to Cast a composition spell, you also cast wrathful storm as a 9th-rank innate occult spell without expending a spell slot. You can Sustain this spell as normal, or can Sustain it by casting a composition spell during your turn.

listCustomFeats.name: Wings of Rope
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Nest of Ropes

The rope aboard your ship carries you through the air as needed. While you are within 50 feet of your bound vessel, you gain a 25-foot fly speed. If you would fall into range of your bound vessel, you can Arrest a Fall before you land.

Special This feat gains the occult or primal trait, matching the option you chose for the Shipmind feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Wondrous Specialty
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Practiced Specialty

When you get into the swing of crafting an item, you can make exceptional progress in record time. When you succeed a check to Craft an item for which you have the formula during downtime, you reduce the materials needed to complete the item by an additional amount equal to the trained value for your level, or your level + 1 if you critically succeed. You do not receive this benefit when crafting during your daily preparations via the Morning Work feat.

listCustomFeats.name: Workshop On the Go
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Craftsman Dedication

You have a favorite set of artisan’s tools that you use for everything, even when other options are available; you never leave home without it. Select a set of tools or a toolkit that you can use for Crafting; if you don’t have one, you gain a level 0 version of them for free. These become your workshop tools. These tool’s Bulk is reduced by 1 for you (to a minimum of L). You gain a +1 item bonus when using these tools, or increase their existing item bonus by +1; this additional bonus increases to +2 if you are legendary in Crafting. You have a -1 penalty to checks made to Craft items without your workshop tools, but can replace them by spending a week of downtime Crafting using a new set.

listCustomFeats.name: Wrack
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Hellknight Armiger Dedication

You can channel your power into your touch, causing incredible pain. You gain the savor the sting domain spell as a devotion spell. You can Refocus by meditating on the nature of your tenets. If you’re not already, you become trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs, and your key spellcasting attribute is your choice of Charisma, Intelligence, or Wisdom.

listCustomFeats.name: Yamaraj Feather Cloak
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Psychopomp Dedication; you do not have the Sakhil Rejection feat

From your back drapes feathers similar to those of a Yamaraj; if you have wings, they sprout across them where there are bones. You become immune to electricity damage. Whenever you would take electricity damage if not for your immunity, you gain fast healing equal to your level on your next turn; if you would already have fast healing, your fast healing instead increases by your level on your next turn.

listCustomFeats.name: Yoink!
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisites Burglar Dedication
Requirements You have at least one hand free. You must be able to hold the targeted item in one hand.

To the unexpecting, you can take an item straight from an enemy’s hand. Attempt to Disarm the target, using a Thievery check instead of an Athletics check, with a +2 circumstance bonus if the target is off-guard.

When you use this action, you can grant it the incapacitation and flourish traits; if you do, on a critical success, you take the item from the target’s grasp with the required open hand. On a failure or critical failure, the target has a +2 circumstance bonus to their Reflex DC to resist Disarm attempts for the next minute.

listCustomHeritages.name: Arachnocentauroid Fleshwarp
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: You are a specific form of fleshwarp that blends a humanoid upper half atop a giant spider. Instead of Medium, your size is Large. You gain a climb speed equal to your land speed - 10. You can select ancestry feats from the anadi ancestry, in addition to those from your own ancestry, as long as the feats are related to your spider physiology (such as Skittertalk, Web Walker, or Web Weaver).

listCustomHeritages.name: Azlanti-Blooded
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: You can trace your lineage back to the first Azlanti that escaped the Earthfall underground, and keep your ancestor’s innate ambition. Select a general feat of your choice for which you meet the prerequisites (as with your ancestry feat, you can select this general feat at any point during character creation).

listCustomHeritages.name: Crusader-Blooded
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: You are descended from those who experienced corrupting energies from the Worldwound, and can still harness their blessings in a pinch. You gain the Mutant Blood Essence ancestry feat, selecting the divine tradition.

listCustomHeritages.name: Mixed-Blooded
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: Your bloodline comes from so many places that keeping track becomes pointless; in the end, you prominently display features from a given ancestry. You gain the Diverse Ancestry ancestry feat.

listCustomHeritages.name: War-Blooded
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: Your physical changes are recent, a result of the extreme magic unleashed by the Godsrain, and have shaped you with innate knowledge of battle. You gain familiarity with greatswords–for the purpose of proficiency, you treat greatswords as simple weapons. You gain the Additional Lore skill feat for Warfare Lore.

listCustomHeritages.name: Wild-Blooded
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: The changes to your body come from wild magic, likely coming from an accident, natural disaster, or travel through the Mana Wastes. Choose acid, cold, electricity, fire, force, sonic, vitality, or void. You gain resistance to that energy type equal to half your level (minimum 1). You also gain the Shift Resistance reaction.

listCustomSpells.name: Already Dead
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Focus, Magus, Manipulate, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Requirements Your chosen weapon is sheathed

You cut into an enemy while dashing past them, only to reveal to them that the initial strike was, in fact, far more deadly than they had anticipated. Make a Lightning Draw attack against a target, then Stride; this movement doesn’t trigger reactions from the target. If the attack hits, the target suffers 4 persistent bleed damage with a basic Fortitude save against your spell DC.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2

listCustomSpells.name: Arcane Barrier
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Focus, Manipulate, Spellshape, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Duration 1 minute

You channel magic to enhance a spell, granting you a barrier of magical force. If your next action is to Cast a wizard Spell that targets yourself and either grants you a bonus to AC (such as shield) or damage resistance or immunity (such as resist energy), you channel your focus to spread it out. You gain 10 temporary Hit Points, which last for one minute.

Heightened (+1) The temporary Hit Points increase by 5.

listCustomSpells.name: Arcane Weapon
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Focus, Manipulate, Spellshape, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Duration 10 minutes

You enhance your combat abilities with a single weapon to masterful levels. If your next action is to Cast a non-cantrip wizard Spell that either targets a weapon you are wielding (such as runic weapon) or creates a weapon for you to wield (such as blazing armory), you can attune it to your magic and martial abilities. For the next 10 minutes or the duration of the spell, whichever is shorter, when you Strike with that weapon, you can use your spell attack proficiency instead of your proficiency with the weapon.

listCustomSpells.name: Best Left Forgotten
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Earth, Emotion, Fear, Focus, Mental, Sorcerer, Visual, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet
Targets 1 creature standing on solid ground
Saving Throw Will

The earth shapes itself to reveal long-buried secrets to the target, secrets that it had hoped to forget. The target suffers 1d4 persistent mental damage with a basic Will save. On a failure, the target is also frightened 1 (or frightened 2 on a critical failure)

As part of casting the spell, if you can see or sense the target, you can attempt to Recall Knowledge on them with a +2 circumstance bonus. On a success, in addition to the information you gain from Recall Knowledge, you learn about what the creature sees. This grants you one of the following effects as determined by the GM:
- The fear is irrelevant to you. You learn any weaknesses to damage the target has, or that it has no damage weaknesses.
- The fear is relevant to you. You learn what the fear appears as visually as well as the creature’s outward reaction to seeing it. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Charisma and Perception checks made against that creature for the next minute. The GM should only grant this effect if the creature has secrets that would be valuable to learn (such as a possible motive you aren’t aware of or a familial connection they keep secret).

Heightened (+1) The persistent mental damage increases by 1d4.

listCustomSpells.name: Boost Spell
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Focus, Spellshape, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
You channel magic to enhance your magic in a feedback loop. If your next action is to Cast a wizard Spell, you gain a +1 item bonus to your spell attack rolls and spell DCs for that spell.

Heightened (6th) The item bonus increases to +2.
Heightened (9th) The item bonus increases to +3.

listCustomSpells.name: Buried Alive
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Earth, Focus, Incapacitation, Manipulate, Sorcerer, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Claws, hands, and similar appendages emerge from the ground, seeking to pull the target beneath the earth. This effect behaves similarly to an affliction, requiring a saving throw upon casting and each time you Sustain the Spell. Each time the creature’s stage increases, it loses a round of breath if it was fully submerged before its stage increased.

Saving Throw Reflex; Stage 1 2d6 bludgeoning damage and the creature is partially submerged in the earth, becoming immobilized; Stage 2+ 3d6 bludgeoning damage and the creature is pulled 5 feet beneath the earth and must hold its breath to avoid suffocation. For each stage after 2, the creature is pulled a further 5 feet below the ground.

The creature can use the Escape action to attempt to pull itself from the earth, with two successes or a critical success reducing the creature’s Stage by 1; each time it fails, however, it loses an additional round of breath if it is submerged (or 2 rounds if it critically fails) but doesn’t increase its stage or lose its escape progress.

If the creature is killed or knocked unconscious while partially or fully submerged, you may have its body resurface after one minute or remain buried in the earth. If the spell ends or is not sustained and the creature is not unconscious or dead, the creature immediately resurfaces. If the creature was at least stage 2, it resurfaces prone.

listCustomSpells.name: Call Aquatic Ally
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Focus, Manipulate, Sorcerer, Summon, Water, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet
Duration sustained up to 1 minute

You summon a creature with the amphibious, aquatic, or water trait whose level is -1 to fight for you.

Heightened (2nd) Level 1.
Heightened (3rd) Level 2.
Heightened (4th) Level 3.
Heightened (5th) Level 5.
Heightened (6th) Level 7.
Heightened (7th) Level 9.
Heightened (8th) Level 11.
Heightened (9th) Level 13.
Heightened (10th) Level 15.

listCustomSpells.name: Elevate Spell
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Focus, Spellshape, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened: You channel magic through your focus to enhance your spells. If your next action is to Cast a wizard Spell, that spell is heightened to half your level, rounded up.

listCustomSpells.name: Force Strike
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Focus, Manipulate, Spellshape, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
You divide your force shards using the math of fractals, allowing you to create far more than normal. If your next action is to Cast force barrage as a wizard spell or innate arcane spell, you channel these mathematics into the spell. You fire two additional shards.

Heightened (+1) You fire one additional shard.

listCustomSpells.name: Form of the Ocean
listCustomSpells.traits: Aura, Concentrate, Focus, Sorcerer, Water, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Area 30-foot emanation
Duration 10 minutes

You enter a more aquatic form, granting you benefits while underwater. You can breathe underwater, and gain a swim speed equal to your Speed, or increase your existing swim speed by 5 feet if that would be higher. You can extend these benefits to allies within a 30-foot emanation.

When immersed in water, you gain 30 ft wavesense as a precise sense, and gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC. You also become immune to environmental damage caused by extreme pressure.

Heightened (5th) You gain 30 ft telepathy, which increases to 100 ft when underwater. You can only use this telepathy to communicate with creatures with a swim speed, regardless of intelligence. This telepathy is also granted to willing creatures of your choice within a 30-foot emanation, but can only be used to speak to you or other creatures granted this telepathy.
Heightened (7th) You gain resistance to cold damage equal to this spell’s rank.
Heightened (9th) Your wavesense increases to 60 feet, and you gain the benefits of a 4th-rank unfettered movement spell while immersed in water.

listCustomSpells.name: Know the Streets
listCustomSpells.traits: Rare, Cantrip, Concentrate, Hex, Witch, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Your patron tells you of goings on within the city. When you cast this spell, attempt a Recall Knowledge check using your Settlement Lore. The DC is usually an Easy DC for your level, but the GM can assign a different DC based on your ability to connect with the city. You can choose to automatically fail this check. The effect depends on the result of your check.

Critical Failure You cannot hear the city for now.
Failure You connect to the city, but receive nothing except a reassuring chill. You gain temporary hit points equal to this spell’s rank which last until the start of your next turn.
Success As failure, but you receive information related to current goings-on within the city, such as the actions of a random person or an event occuring at this moment. This knowledge grants you a +1 status bonus to the next skill check or saving throw you make before the start of your next turn. You are then immune to the success and critical success effects of this spell for one minute.
Critical Success As success, but the status bonus increases to +2. The information granted is particularly relevant, such as the goings-on of a person you know or an event you are interested in, though even then it is rarely more than a glimpse or hint.

listCustomSpells.name: Lingering Pain
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Focus, Manipulate, Spellshape, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened: You anchor the elements of your next spell to the creatures it targets. If your next action is to Cast a Spell that deals energy damage, the spell deals additional persistent damage of the same energy type equal to half the damage dice dealt to the target, rounded up, or half the damage dealt by the spell if it deals flat damage, rounded up. If the spell deals multiple types of damage, it only counts energy damage dice and each type of energy damage inflicts its own separate persistent energy damage.

listCustomSpells.name: Quicken Spellshape
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Focus, Manipulate, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened: You force raw power into a spell to alter its properties. The next activity you use with the spellshape trait before the end of your turn costs one less action to use; if this would reduce it to 0 actions, its usage becomes a free action.

listCustomSpells.name: Release Power
listCustomSpells.traits: Rare, Concentrate, Focus, Mythic, Polymorph, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Duration 1 minute
Requirements You aren’t fatigued and your power isn’t released

Unebbing power courses into your body, raw potential rarely seen in mortals and immortals alike surging to breach your skin. While your power is released:
- You become Large if you weren’t already, increasing your reach by 5 feet if you were Medium or smaller.
- You are concealed to creatures without true seeing as your true body becomes only partially visible within the physical world.
- You gain a +1 status bonus to your attack rolls, DCs, and saving throws.

Your power remains released for 1 minute, until you fall unconscious, or until the encounter ends, whichever comes first. You can't voluntarily end this release. When the spell ends, you become fatigued for the 10 minutes.

Special You can spend a Mythic Point when casting this spell to do so without expending a focus point. Additionally, if you have the Rage action, you can cast Release Power as a free action whenever you Rage, granting it the rage trait when you do so.

listCustomSpells.name: Sea Shanty
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Auditory, Bard, Cantrip, Composition, Concentrate, Fortune, Mental, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Area 30-foot emanation

Trigger You or an ally within 30 feet rolls a saving throw against an effect that inflicts clumsy, confused, enfeebled, fatigued, frightened, sickened, or stupefied

You sing a tune that relieves common ailments of the sea. Roll a Performance check. You and allies in the area can use the better result between your Performance check and the saving throw. If you are on a ship or similar vessel, you can instead choose to affect all allied creatures on the ship instead.

listCustomSpells.name: See Magic
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Focus, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet
Targets 1 creature, item, or location

You focus your gaze upon a single target, be it a creature, item, or location. You Identify Magic on the target as if you had spent 10 minutes performing the exploration activity. You can use Arcana when you do so, even if it is of a different tradition. You can choose to forgo rolling a skill check to instead receive a result of 10 + your proficiency bonus (do not apply any other bonuses, penalties, or modifiers).

Heightened (5th) You gain a +1 status bonus to the Arcana check, or can get a result of 11 + your proficiency bonus.
Heightened (8th) You gain a +2 status bonus to the Arcana check, or can get a result of 12 + your proficiency bonus.

listCustomSpells.name: Song of Surrender
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Auditory, Bard, Composition, Concentrate, Focus, Incapacitation, Linguistic, Mental, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 30 feet
Targets 1 creature
Duration 1 round
Defense Will

You perform a song that urges your foes to surrender. The target must make a Will save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and immune to this ability for 24 hours.
Success The creature is unaffected.
Failure The creature must spend the first action on its next turn to either drop any weapons it is wielding or falling prone (its choice). If it doesn’t have a weapon or cannot drop it, it must drop prone. It can't Delay or take any reactions until it has obeyed this order. If it is already prone and doesn’t have a weapon, the creature spends its first action doing nothing.
Critical Failure As failure, but the creature spends its entire turn doing this (with any actions not spent dropping weapons or falling prone being wasted).

Heightened (5th) You can target up to 3 creatures.
Heightened (8th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

listCustomSpells.name: Summon Sea Beast
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Focus, Incarnate, Manipulate, Sorcerer, Water, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Range 100 feet
Duration until the end of your turn

You cast your mind into the depths of the ocean, using your elemental magic to have a beast from its depths swim through your location and unleash devastation. The beast appears as a gargantuan creature, and has both a fly speed and swim speed of 60 feet. When you cast the spell, you can choose the type of aquatic creature that appears, such as a kraken, sea serpent, or nasurgeth.

Arrive (emotion, fear, mental) Thalassophobia The beast appears before your foes reminding them of just how big creatures in the ocean can become. Each enemy within a 60-foot emanation must make a Will save or be frightened 2 (or frightened 3 and fleeing on a critical failure)

Depart (water) Titanic Wake The beast departs in a dive through the elemental plane of water and back to its home. All creatures within a 30-foot emanation take 5d8 bludgeoning damage (basic Reflex save) and are knocked prone on a failure.

Heightened (+1) Increase the departure damage by 1d8.
listCustomSpells.duration: until the end of your turn

listCustomSpells.name: Thousand Faces
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Druid, Focus, Manipulate, Polymorph, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Duration 10 minutes

You can shift your appearance to that of another person, disguising yourself or granting yourself particular skill sets. You polymorph into any form listed in humanoid form, which lasts for 10 minutes. When you do so, you gain all the effects of the shape you chose from a version of the spell heightened to thousand face's rank.

Your control over your humanoid form is notably more intense, drawing upon the talents and capabilities of those you come across. When you enter a humanoid form in this manner, select one skill and one language. You become trained in it if you were not already and learn that language if you don’t already know it. You also gain a +1 status bonus to skill checks using the chosen skill. This bonus increases to +2 if this spell is cast at rank 4 or higher, or +3 if this spell is cast at rank 8 or higher. These benefits last for the duration of the spell.

listCustomSpells.name: Walk in the Dark
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Darkness, Focus, Manipulate, Sorcerer, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened:
Area 10-foot emanation
Duration 1 minute

The area around you darkens and grows quiet, still as the earth beneath your feet. The area of this spell has the effects of the darkness spell heightened to this spell’s rank. Additionally, sound does not enter or travel within the area, silencing all sound in or passing through it. Sonic attacks and auditory actions within the area have a range of 5 feet instead of their normal range, and cannot reach outside of the area; similarly, these attacks and actions cannot target creatures inside the area unless they are within 5 feet of the user. Creatures within this radius that can’t see through the darkness spell and don’t have tremorsense suffer a -1 penalty to Will saving throws.

You gain tremorsense as a precise sense within the range of the spell. Once per round on subsequent turns, you can Sustain the spell to increase the emanation’s radius by 10 feet.

listCustomSpells.name: Warp Defense
listCustomSpells.traits: Uncommon, Concentrate, Focus, Manipulate, Spellshape, 3rd Party
listCustomSpells.descriptionHeightened: You alter the very nature of a spell, causing it to target different defenses. If your next action is to Cast a Spell that requires a Fortitude, Reflex, or Will saving throw, you can have the target or targets make a different one of the listed saving throws instead; for example, if the modified spell would require a Fortitude save, you could have the target make a Reflex or Will save instead. If the spell targets multiple creatures, they must all make the same type of saving throw. If the spell requires multiple saving throws, you can change each save individually.

listCustomSpecial.name: Abomination Magic
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain your choice of the initial domain spell for the abomination domain or the School of Protean Form magic school's initial school spell. For either choice, you gain it as a focus spell of your tradition.

listCustomSpecial.name: Additional Lore
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Additional Lore skill feat. You can select this option multiple times.

listCustomSpecial.name: Additional Retainer
listCustomSpecial.description: At 6th level, you gain the Additional Retainer*** archetype feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Advanced Abomination Magic
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain your choice of the advanced domain spell for the abomination domain or the advanced school spell for the School of Protean Form. You must have the initial spell from that school or domain to select it.

listCustomSpecial.name: Advanced Weapon Training
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Ancestral Mobility
listCustomSpecial.description: Your ancestry grants you a particular mobility option, such as webbed fins or large spider legs that protrude from your back. Choose one of the movement options below:

listCustomSpecial.name: Antagonize
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Aquatic
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your bloodline descends from the ocean depths, connected to undersea empires of old or great oceanic beasts.

Tradition primal; Bloodline Skills Athletics, Nature
Sorcerous Gifts cantrip: spout, 1st: briny bolt, 2nd: sea surge, 3rd: scrying ripples, 4th: grasp of the deep, 5th: control water, 6th: personal ocean, 7th: hungry depths, 8th: whirlpool, 9th: implosion
Bloodline Spells initial: call aquatic ally, advanced: form of the ocean, greater: summon sea beast
Blood Magic–Blessing of the Deep Elemental magic infuses you and those you summon. You or a creature you have summoned that has a swim speed gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

listCustomSpecial.name: Aristocratic Erudition
listCustomSpecial.description: Select two of the following options, and gain their benefits:

listCustomSpecial.name: Authority*
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Back to Back
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Battle Assessment
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Beneath Notice
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Black Market Contact***
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Blessed Sacrifice
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Blind-Fight
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Bondkeeper
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your style relies not just on your own skill but working with a partner. You are trained in one skill of your choice, and gain a 1st or 2nd-level teamwork feat of your choice, ignoring the prerequisites. You also gain the Reinforce Teamwork free action. Teamwork feats can be found in Feats+ by Team+.

Pathbuilder Note: Add the skill increase and teamwork feat as bonus feats

listCustomSpecial.name: Bottomless Bag*
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Brawler’s Beatdown
listCustomSpecial.description: Make two attacks from the following: Disarm, Grapple, Shove, Strike, or Trip. You cannot select the same option twice, and apply your multiple attack penalty to these attacks normally. If you choose to Strike, you can only use an unarmed attack or a one-handed agile melee weapon.

listCustomSpecial.name: Brutal Beating
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Buckler Dance
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Cathartic Unleash
listCustomSpecial.description:
Requirements You’re in an encounter or are about to roll initiative and you aren’t stupefied
Trigger determined by your catharsis emotion

Without conscious effort, your mind unleashes your element in response to emotional stimuli. If your Kinetic Aura isn’t active, it immediately activates and you Unleash Elements without needing to use an overflow impulse. You gain the catharsis activation effects listed for your catharsis emotion. When your Unleash Elements end, you also suffer the listed emotional fallout. Your emotions count as settled when you can use Unleash Elements again.

listCustomSpecial.name: Cavalier’s Banner
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: City Order
listCustomSpecial.description:
Ecosystems can exist even within urban environments, and you help to shepherd these abnormal ways of life.

Order Skill Society
Druid Feat Urbanwalk
Order Spell thousand faces
Anathema Favor a certain group within a settlement over any other. (This doesn’t prevent you from helping opposing groups within a city or fighting groups that would harm a city, but you should treat each group with the same level of scrutiny and respect).

listCustomSpecial.name: Climb Speed
listCustomSpecial.description: You have spider legs, sharp claws, or similar appendages used for climbing sheer surfaces. You gain a climb speed of 15 feet.

listCustomSpecial.name: Command Attention
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Conqueror
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your family line consists of great warriors, generals, and soldiers, with their military history being their greatest pride. They may be major players in the support of the current regime, mercenaries with wealthy and important clientele, or even the leaders of a roaming barbarian clan.

Family Edicts settle matters through blades not words, prove yourself in martial matters
Family Anathema surrender anything of importance that you have claimed through violence

Family Lore Heraldry Lore or Warfare Lore
Family Ability You gain the Marshal Dedication feat, ignoring its prerequisites.
Family Feats Battle Assessment, Duelist’s Challenge, Play to the Crowd, Reactive Striker
