Greater Family Feats Back to Back, Instant Armor, Mobile Shot Stance

listCustomSpecial.name: Corsair
listCustomSpecial.description: You are used to moving across the decks of ships, avoiding enemy movements, and leaping over attacks at a moment’s notice. You are trained in Athletics. When you Balance, Board, High Jump, or Long Jump, the action gains the bravado trait.

listCustomSpecial.name: Crawl
listCustomSpecial.description: You can move along the ground or through tight spaces with ease. You can Crawl and Squeeze at up to half your Speed.

listCustomSpecial.name: Criminal
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your family earns their wealth and power through illicit means, and stays in power by continuing to do so. They may be smugglers or manufacturers of illicit goods, mob bosses, or even pirates!

Family Edicts always show proper respect to members of the family, don’t do what you’re good at for free
Family Anathema put the family’s racket at risk

Family Lore Heraldry Lore or Underworld Lore
Family Ability You gain the sneak attack class feature, except it deals 1d4 precision damage and you don't increase the number of dice as you gain levels. At 6th level, the damage increases to 1d6. You can deal sneak attack damage with any weapon, not just the weapons listed in the sneak attack class feature. This benefit doesn't apply to a simple weapon with a damage die greater than d8 or a martial or advanced weapon with a damage die greater than d6. (Apply any abilities that alter the damage die size first.) If you already have the sneak attack class feature, you instead deal an additional 1 precision damage with your sneak attacks, increasing to 2 precision damage at 6th level. This ability serves as the rogue's ruffian racket for the purpose of meeting prerequisites.
Family Feats Mug, Plant Evidence, Poison Weapon, Safe House
Greater Family Feats Beneath Notice, Menacing Prowess, Opportune Backstab

listCustomSpecial.name: Dazzling Display
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Declining
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your family was great… once. Now, it coasts off of ever-dwindling old money, spent over decades or centuries of descent. Now, while they still hold power and wealth, they are a shell of their former selves. Adventurers from these families may be seeking to restore them to their former glory, though others may wish to use what remains to cast it aside and start anew.

Family Edicts seek to restore the family’s glory, act as befitting the family we once were
Family Anathema accepting insults to the family’s honor no matter the truth

Family Lore Genealogy Lore or a lore related to your family’s former business (such as Farming Lore or Mercantile Lore)
Family Ability You gain the Leverage Connections skill feat and the Untrained Improvisation general feat. The DC of your recovery checks is equal to 9 + your dying value, or 8 + your dying value if you have the Toughness general feat.
Family Feats Duelist’s Challenge, Folktales Lore, Second Shield, Never Tire
Greater Family Feats Buckler Dance, Read Disaster, Spiritual Sense

listCustomSpecial.name: Decry Thief
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Deep Earth
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your bloodline echoes from the depths of the earth, where only rock, darkness, and the things that can subsist off of either lie.

Tradition primal; Bloodline Skills Nature, Stealth
Sorcerous Gifts cantrip: scatter scree, 1st: shockwave, 2nd: tremorsense, 3rd: cave fangs, 4th: grasping earth, 5th: speak with stones, 6th: ravenous darkness, 7th: heaving earth, 8th: earthquake, 9th: one with the land
Bloodline Spells initial: best left forgotten, advanced: walk in the dark, greater: buried alive
Blood Magic–Earthen Flesh Your skin hardens, granting you a +1 status bonus to AC or Fortitude saving throws until the start of your next turn.

listCustomSpecial.name: Deity Skill
listCustomSpecial.description:
You become trained in your deity’s divine skill (or another skill of your choice if you are already trained in that skill).

Pathbuilder Note: Add the chosen skill as a custom skill increase.

listCustomSpecial.name: Demolition Charge
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Devour Scroll
listCustomSpecial.description:
Requirements You are holding a scroll whose rank is less than or equal to half your level, rounded down.

You rapidly devour the scroll, taking its magic into yourself. You can cast the spell inscribed on the scroll once as an occult spell of the scroll’s tradition and of the same rank as the devoured scroll. Intelligence is your spellcasting attribute modifier for this spell. If the spell is not on the occult spell list, you must make an Occultism check with a Hard DC for the spell’s rank when you devour the scroll; on a failure, the scroll is wasted. This counts as ingesting the scroll for the purposes of any abilities or effects such as the sickened condition.

You can only have one spell stored through this ability at a time, and the magic of a spell stored in you in this manner dissipates during your daily preparations, causing the stored spell to be lost. When you Devour a Scroll while you still have an innate spell granted by this action, the old spell is lost and you become sickened 1 for one minute after devouring the scroll. If you would retch while sickened because of this, you also cough up small pieces of paper and sparks of magic with no additional mechanical effect.

listCustomSpecial.name: Devour Tome
listCustomSpecial.description:
Frequency once per day
Requirements You are holding a book whose level is less than your own and are below your maximum number of focus points.

You magically devour the book, pressing it to your chest and absorbing it into your body. You regain one Focus Point.

listCustomSpecial.name: Diehard
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Diehard general feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Distracting Flattery
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Duelist’s Challenge
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Eerie Proclamation (use the higher of your class or spell DC)
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Electrogenesis
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Electrogenesis feat from the Wild Mimic Archetype.

listCustomSpecial.name: Elemental Familiar
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Emergency Regeneration
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Emergency Regeneration feat from the Wild Mimic Archetype.

listCustomSpecial.name: Ensorcelled
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your family’s power comes from magic in its many forms, which they keep close to their chest. They may be court wizards and magicians, members of an “all-powerful” sorcerous lineage, or even collectors of magical oddities and cursed items which they use to maintain their status.

Family Edicts turn magic to the family’s benefit, keep the people guessing about the source of your family’s power
Family Anathema revealing the secrets of the family

Family Lore None
Family Ability Select Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion. You become trained in that skill, or another skill of your choice if you are already trained. At 3rd level, you become an expert, at 7th level, you become a master in that skill, and at 15th level, you become legendary in that skill. This skill counts as your Family Lore for the purposes of any feats or abilities. You also gain a single cantrip of your choice with a tradition matching the chosen skill.
Family Feats Magical Scholastics, Spell Protection Array, Thaumaturgic Ritualist, Turn Away Misfortune
Greater Family Feats Eerie Proclamation (use the higher of your class or spell DC), Greater Magical Scholastics, Soulsight

Pathbuilder Note: Add the chosen skill as custom skill increases at the appropriate levels.

listCustomSpecial.name: Envenom
listCustomSpecial.description: You have mastered the usage of poisons against your hunted prey. When you strike your hunted prey with a poisoned weapon, the DC of any saving throw the poison requires uses the higher of your class DC or the poison’s DC. You also gain the Poison Weapon feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Exemplary Finisher (Bondkeeper)
listCustomSpecial.description: The ally you’re in a Teamwork with gains a +2 circumstance bonus to hit the foe until the start of your next turn.

listCustomSpecial.name: Exemplary Finisher (Corsair)
listCustomSpecial.description: You can Disarm the target as a free action immediately after the finisher. The weapon or unarmed strike you used to make the finisher counts as having the disarm trait for this attempt.

listCustomSpecial.name: Exemplary Finisher (Wandweaver)
listCustomSpecial.description: You are quickened until the end of your turn. You can only use this action to Trick a Magic Item or as part of Activating a Magic Item.

listCustomSpecial.name: Expert Backstabber
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Eyes of the City
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Eyes of the City skill feat

listCustomSpecial.name: Family Feat (Conquerer)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Family Feat (Criminal)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Family Feat (Declining)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Family Feat (Ensorcelled)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Family Feat (Industrial)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Family Feat (Lawkeeper)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Family Feat (Legacy)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Family Feat (Proprietor)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Family Feat (Royalty)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Fearful Feast
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Fearful Feast advanced domain spell.

listCustomSpecial.name: Feast Planner
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Fermenting Liquors
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Ferocity Mimicry
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Ferocity Mimicry feat from the Wild Mimic Archetype.

listCustomSpecial.name: Flash Your Badge
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Flowing Blade Stance
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Flowing Blade Stance feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Folktales Lore
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Forager
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Forager general feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Gadget Specialist
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Gang Up
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Gossip Lore
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Grand Dance
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Greater Family Feat (Conquerer)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Greater Family Feat (Criminal)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Greater Family Feat (Declining)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Greater Family Feat (Ensorcelled)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Greater Family Feat (Industrial)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Greater Family Feat (Lawkeeper)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Greater Family Feat (Legacy)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Greater Family Feat (Merchant)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Greater Family Feat (Otherworldly)
listCustomSpecial.description: Select one of your family’s Family Feats. You gain that feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Greater Family Feat (Political)

listCustomSpecial.description: Your proficiency ranks for heavy armor increases to master.

listCustomSpecial.description: Your proficiency ranks for heavy armor increases to master.

listCustomSpecial.name: Improved Familiar
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Industrial
listCustomSpecial.description:
An ancestor of yours created something incredible or revolutionized an industry, and your family continues their work through generations. They may have been the inventor of important technology, founder of a series of factories, or a driving force behind the infrastructure of a city.

Family Edicts solve problems with your own hands, seek opportunities for your family’s work to be used
Family Anathema damage or besmirch what your family has built

Family Lore Engineering Lore or Mercantile Lore
Family Ability You become trained in Crafting, or another skill of your choice if you are already trained. You gain your choice of the Alchemist Dedication, Craftsman Dedication, or Inventor Dedication feat. You must meet the prerequisites for the chosen dedication feat.
Family Feats Demolition Charge, Gadget Specialist, Reverse Engineering, Tamper
Greater Family Feats Magical Scrounger, Persistent Creation, Ubiquitous Gadgets

Add the chosen dedication feat as a bonus feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Inspired Stratagem
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Instant Armor
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Interrogate
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Jester's Calling
listCustomSpecial.description:
Trickery is in your nature; even if you’re not doing so maliciously, you can’t help but enjoy the looks on the faces of those you fool. When you attempt a check to Create a Diversion or Feint, you can spend a Mythic Point to attempt the check at mythic proficiency. The first time each day you critically succeed on a check to Create a Diversion or Feint a creature that isn’t your ally, you regain a Mythic Point.

Edicts draw attention with your tricks, raise spirits through your antics, balance wit with wisdom

Anathema cause harm with your tricks to those that don’t deserve it, fail to get the last laugh, take a joke too far

listCustomSpecial.name: Just One More Thing
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Lamplighter
listCustomSpecial.description:
Within the Darklands, light often comes at a premium, and cities built down there may never know the light of day. You are used to walking dark streets like these, casting light into shadows and investigating those who hide from the light of day.

You become trained in Occultism. You gain the initiate benefit for the Lantern implement from the Thaumaturge class, as well as a mundane hooded lantern that acts as your implement. While you are wielding your lantern implement, you can cast illuminate and light as innate occult cantrips. Intelligence is your spellcasting attribute modifier.

listCustomSpecial.name: Lamplighter Methodology
listCustomSpecial.description: Placeholder for feat requirements.

listCustomSpecial.name: Lawkeeper
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your family draws their power from the law itself, enforcing the codes they are sworn to with an even and firm hand.

Family Edicts bring public justice to lawbreakers, refuse the implication of corruption
Family Anathema break the laws your family is bound to serve

Family Lore Legal Lore or Lore for the city or settlement your family presides over
Family Ability You gain the On the Case investigator class feature, which grants you the Pursue a Lead activity and Clue In reaction. If you already have this activity and reaction or would later gain it, you instead gain the Solid Lead investigator feat.
Family Feats Decry Thief, Interrogate, Quick Draw, Reactive Pursuit
Greater Family Feats Flash Your Badge, Just One More Thing, Unfazed Assessment

listCustomSpecial.name: Lay on Hands
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the lay on hands devotion spell if your deity has a heal divine font.

listCustomSpecial.name: Legacy
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your family descends from a great hero of the realm who once saved the city, country, or even world. Now, your family rides off of their wealth and influence, perhaps even following in their footsteps. It is equally possible, however, that you may come from a line of great and terrible villains, and your family seeks to avenge or continue their dark legacy.

Family Edicts emulate the aspects of your forebearer, continue your forebearer’s work
Family Anathema consort with the enemies of your forebearer

Family Lore Forebearer Lore, which applies to the history and beliefs of your forebearer
Family Ability You gain the Familial Weapon Training archetype feat, selecting a weapon related to your forebearer. Select two distinct groups, one to whom your forebearer is famous and one to whom they are infamous. The two groups can be broad, but must have distinct limits; for example, they could be the people of a specific kingdom, criminals within a given city, denizens of a given plane, or elves as a whole. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Persuasion checks with the former and Intimidation checks with the latter, as well as Deception checks with both. Additionally, you can use your Forebearer Lore to Recall Knowledge about these groups as if it were an unspecific lore about that group.
Family Feats Blessed Sacrifice, Quick Mount, Remember Your Training, Trap Finder
Greater Family Feats Advanced Weapon Training, Blind-Fight, Unshakable Idealism

listCustomSpecial.name: Legendary Crafting
listCustomSpecial.description: At 15th level, you become legendary in Crafting.

listCustomSpecial.name: Legendary Occultism
listCustomSpecial.description: At 15th level, you become legendary in Occultism.

listCustomSpecial.name: Legendary Religion
listCustomSpecial.description: At 15th level, you become legendary in Religion.

listCustomSpecial.name: Legendary Thievery
listCustomSpecial.description: At 15th level, you become legendary in Thievery.

listCustomSpecial.name: Lift Nature's Caul
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Lift Nature's Caul domain spell.

listCustomSpecial.name: Magical Adaptation
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Magical Scholastics
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Magical Scrounger
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Masquerade of Seasons Stance
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Master Crafting
listCustomSpecial.description: At 7th level, you become a master in Crafting.

listCustomSpecial.name: Master Occultism
listCustomSpecial.description: At 7th level, you become a master in Occultism.

listCustomSpecial.name: Master Religion
listCustomSpecial.description: At 7th level, you become a master in Religion.

listCustomSpecial.name: Master Thievery
listCustomSpecial.description: At 7th level, you become a master in Thievery.

listCustomSpecial.name: Masterful Hunter Upgrade (Envenom)
listCustomSpecial.description:
You know exactly how to apply your poisons for maximum injury. When you strike your hunted prey with a poisoned weapon, the poison gains the virulent trait; if it already has the virulent trait, the target treats their first saving throw against the poison as one degree of success worse.

Additionally, when you deal damage to your hunted prey with a simple poison, the poison deals 2d4 poison damage, or 4d4 poison damage if you have the Improved Poison Weapon feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Menacing Prowess
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Merchant
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your family makes its living buying and selling goods, often producing some themselves. They may be the owners of trade caravans, producers of excellent goods, or simply masters of market manipulation.

Family Edicts respect clients of your family, seek opportunities for profit
Family Anathema live a lifestyle devoid of your family’s opulence

Family Lore None
Family Ability You gain the Merchant Dedication** archetype feat. Mercantile Lore counts as your Family Lore for the purposes of any feats or abilities. Additionally, you gain the Stipend archetype feat.
Family Feats Distracting Flattery, Magical Scholastics, Munitions Crafter, Practiced Specialty
Greater Family Feats Bottomless Bag*, Morning Work, Predictive Purchase

listCustomSpecial.name: Mobile Shot Stance
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Morning Work
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Mug
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Multilingual
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Multilingual skill feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Munitions Crafter
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Mutant Mimicry
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain your choice of the Ferocity Mimicry, Rend Mimicry, or Electrogenesis feat from the Wild Mimic archetype. If you are at least 13th level, you can instead select Trample Mimicry or Roar Mimicry; if you are at least 17th level, you can instead select Pounce Mimicry or Emergency Regeneration. You ignore the prerequisites for gaining the chosen feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Mutate
listCustomSpecial.description:
Frequency twice per day

You transform into your mutagenic form, which lasts for the duration of the mutagen which triggered this ability. If you did not consume a mutagen to activate this ability, you gain the benefits of one of the following mutagens at the highest level you can create, which counts as the mutagen you imbibed to trigger this ability: bestial mutagen, juggernaut mutagen, quicksilver mutagen.

While in your mutagenic form, your fists lose the nonlethal trait, and you gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to half your level; these are in addition to any other temporary hit points granted by drinking the mutagen.

Alternatively, you can use this action to exit your mutagenic form; this still consumes a usage of the action and ends the mutagen effect.

listCustomSpecial.name: Never Mind
listCustomSpecial.description: If you are at least 14th level, you can instead cast never mind as an occult innate spell heightened to half your level, rounded down. In either case, while the spell is affecting a creature, their speech often devolves into a single word or phrase, such as “the end is never the end” or “halloween”.

listCustomSpecial.name: Never Tire
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Noble Family
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your family determines the knowledge and abilities you begin with, and shape your access to certain abilities that would normally be beyond your reach. A noble family entry contains the following information:

Family Edicts and Anathema Edicts and anathema connected to your family. You are not required to follow these edicts and anathema, but breaking them in public causes you to lose access to abilities with the familial trait until you set things right.

Family Lore A lore skill associated with your family, often with multiple choices. You gain the Additional Lore skill feat for the chosen lore, though some families may have an ability that alters this.
Family Ability An ability key to your family, granted by your fortunate noble birth and upbringing. If it grants a feat, you ignore the prerequisites and level requirement.
Family Feats and Greater Family Feats Feats associated with your family that can be gained through the Familial Feat and Greater Familial Feat archetype feats.

listCustomSpecial.name: Opportune Backstab
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Order Magic
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Otherworldly
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your family is foreign, even more so than many. Your lineage is drawn from another plane, be it a Court of Elementals, Fey, or even powerful Devils. As such, while you lack more standard influence, on your best days you can call the services of immortals to your aid.

Family Edicts seek power connected to your home plane, find alliances in other travelers from your plane
Family Anathema act in a way that would be disgraceful to your home plane

Family Lore Lore related to your family’s plane of origin (such as Hell Lore or Plane of Fire Lore)
Family Ability You gain the Familiar and Enhanced Familiar class feats. This familiar acts as your assistant, butler, or similar, having been supplied by your family to accompany you. If you already have a familiar, you instead gain the Enhanced Familiar and Improved Familiar class feats
Family Feats Elemental Familiar, Masquerade of Seasons Stance, Pactbinder Dedication, Spot Translate, You’re an Embarrassment!
Greater Family Feats Grand Dance, Improved Familiar, Magical Adaptation

listCustomSpecial.name: Pactbinder Dedication
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Persistent Creation
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Piercing Blade Stance
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Piercing Blade Stance feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Plant Evidence
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Play to the Crowd
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Poison Resistance
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Poison Weapon
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Political
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your family’s power is a majority political by volume, with their ability to stay on top being dependent on their information and public perception. They may be wealthy socialites, local politicians, or even information brokers.

Family Edicts know the affairs of your allies and rivals, act always with consideration and forethought
Family Anathema undermine the political station of your family

Family Lore Legal Lore or Underworld Lore
Family Ability You gain the Aristocratic Erudition archetype feat, ignoring its prerequisites. Additionally, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Charisma-based skill checks made against multiple targets. This bonus also applies to Charisma-based skill checks against creatures you are adjacent to as long as you are the only creature adjacent to them.
Family Feats Antagonize, Expert Backstabber, Gossip Lore, Poison Resistance
Greater Family Feats Black Market Contact***, Sound Mirror, Spy’s Countermeasures

listCustomSpecial.name: Pounce Mimicry
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Pounce Mimicry feat from the Wild Mimic Archetype.

listCustomSpecial.name: Practiced Specialty
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Predictive Purchase
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Priest Feat
listCustomSpecial.description: You also gain your choice of the Splinter Faith or Syncretism cleric feats, or become trained in your deity’s divine skill (or another skill of your choice if you are already trained in that skill).

listCustomSpecial.name: Priest's Hands Spell
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the lay on hands devotion spell if your deity has a heal divine font or the touch of the void devotion spell if your deity has a harm divine font. If your deity allows either, select one and gain that devotion spell.

listCustomSpecial.name: Proprietor
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your family owns something which grants them their wealth, and from this ownership prosperity flows. They may be powerful landlords, owners of mines or lumber mills, or managers of a fleet of ships-for-hire.

Family Edicts bring prosperity to those in your family’s stewardship, seek to swear others to your family
Family Anathema refuse your family’s obligations, damage the profitability of your family’s land or assets

Family Lore Accounting Lore or a Lore associated a terrain (such as Forest Lore or Mountain Lore)
Family Ability You gain the Order Explorer druid feat, and the granted feat gains the familial trait. You are not bound by that order’s anathema unless you are a Druid or would later gain the Druid archetype; if this becomes the case, you count as a member of the chosen order for the purpose of meeting feat requirements. You become trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs.
Family Feats Brutal Beating, Fermenting Liquors, Order Magic, Settlement Scholastics
Greater Family Feats Feast Planner, Gang Up, Inspired Stratagem

listCustomSpecial.name: Quick Draw
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Quick Mount
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Raging Resistance (Sea Reaver)
listCustomSpecial.description: You resist bludgeoning and cold damage. You are also immune to environmental damage caused by pressure, even when not raging.

listCustomSpecial.name: Reactive Pursuit
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Reactive Striker
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Read Disaster
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Read Lips
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Read Lips skill feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Reinforce Teamwork
listCustomSpecial.description:
Frequency once per round
Requirements You are within 10 feet of an ally you’re in a Teamwork with and don’t have panache

You momentarily confer with your ally before moving into action. You gain panache until the end of your next turn.

listCustomSpecial.name: Remember Your Training
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Rend Mimicry
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Rend Mimicry feat from the Wild Mimic Archetype.

listCustomSpecial.name: Reverse Engineering
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Roar Mimicry
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Roar Mimicry feat from the Wild Mimic Archetype.

listCustomSpecial.name: Roaring Blade Stance
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Roaring Blade Stance feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Royalty
listCustomSpecial.description:
You come from a prominent royal family, often the line of the king, queen, or similar title. You may be the first in line to the throne or a thousand names down the list, but your name alone holds power.

Family Edicts proudly wield the power of your name, act decisively and with public confidence, appear unshakeable and never show weakness
Family Anathema commit treason upon your family

Family Lore Lore related to your nation (such as Cheliax Lore or Jalmeray Lore)
Family Ability You gain the Leader Dedication*** archetype feat, ignoring its prerequisites. At 6th level, you gain the Additional Retainer*** archetype feat. These feats, as well as any feats gained from the Leader archetype, gain the Familial trait.
Family Feats Authority*, Cavalier’s Banner, Distracting Flattery, Safe House
Greater Family Feat Command Attention, Dazzling Display, Statement Strut

listCustomSpecial.name: Safe House
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Scramble Body
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Scramble Body school spell.

listCustomSpecial.name: Sea Reaver Instinct
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your rage channels the power of the oceans deep, surging through you like a tempest. You are most at home when you are near the sea, and instinctually familiar with aquatic travel.

Instinct Ability–Marine Terror

Increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 3, or 4 if you are swimming. You gain a swim Speed equal to your Speed, and can hold your breath for four times as many rounds as normal. You ignore concealment caused by fog, mist, rain, sleet, snow, wind, or similar coastal weather effects, as well as difficult terrain caused by shallow water. You also gain the Underwater Marauder skill feat.

Specialization Ability (7th)

Increase the damage from Rage from 3 to 7, or 8 if you are swimming. If you have greater raging specialization, instead increase the damage from Rage to 13, or 16 if you are swimming.

Raging Resistance (9th)

You resist bludgeoning and cold damage. You are also immune to environmental damage caused by pressure, even when not raging.

listCustomSpecial.name: Sea Singer
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your muse is tied to the deep blue sea, its songs and mysteries calling out to you. Perhaps you draw inspiration from a deity of the sea such as Gozreh, great mythical sea beasts like the kraken, or even the vast ocean waves themselves.

Muse Feat Sea Shanty
Muse Spell tailwind

listCustomSpecial.name: Second Shield
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Settlement Scholastics
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Shift Resistance
listCustomSpecial.description:
Frequency once per day
Trigger You suffer acid, cold, electricity, fire, force, void, vitality, or sonic damage from a spell

You shift your resistance to match the triggering damage type until you use this reaction again. This does not reduce the damage from the triggering spell.

listCustomSpecial.name: Shifting Form
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Shifting Form school spell.

listCustomSpecial.name: Silvertongue’s Calling
listCustomSpecial.description:
Words are the most powerful tool in your arsenal, and you twist them better than anyone to help yourself and your allies. When you attempt a check to Create Forgery, Impersonate, or Lie, you can spend a Mythic Point to attempt the check at mythic proficiency. The first time each day you critically succeed on a check to Create Forgery, Impersonate a person you’ve met, or Lie to a creature who isn’t your ally, you regain a Mythic Point.

Edicts use other’s assumptions against them, gain the upper hand in social situations, elevate yourself through your words

Anathema allow your enemies to know your plans before they’re enacted, refuse to use leverage or dirt during a negotiation

listCustomSpecial.name: Soulsight
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Sound Mirror
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Specialization Ability (Sea Reaver)
listCustomSpecial.description: Increase the damage from Rage from 3 to 7, or 8 if you are swimming. If you have greater raging specialization, instead increase the damage from Rage to 13, or 16 if you are swimming.

listCustomSpecial.name: Spell Protection Array
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Spiritual Sense
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Splinter Faith
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Splinter Faith cleric feat

listCustomSpecial.name: Spot Translate
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Spy’s Countermeasures
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Statement Strut
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Steel Hound
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your specialty lies in the hunt of your targets, pursuing them like a bloodhound and taking them down if need be. Making use of firearms as your primary weapon, you become a deadly threat to any creature that has entered your sights.

You’re trained in Intimidation, and gain the Warning Shot gunslinger feat. Select a Gunslinger’s Way, and gain its Initial Deed. When you use an action to Devise a Stratagem, you can reload as part of the same action.

listCustomSpecial.name: Steel Hound Methodology
listCustomSpecial.description: Placeholder for feat requirements.

listCustomSpecial.name: Streetwise
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Streetwise skill feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Swim Speed
listCustomSpecial.description: You have fins along your legs and webbed fingers. You gain a swim speed of 15 feet.

listCustomSpecial.name: Sword Saint Stance
listCustomSpecial.description: Choose one 4th level Sword Saint archetype feat with the stance trait. You gain that feat, ignoring its level prerequisite.

listCustomSpecial.name: Syncretism
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Syncretism cleric feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Tamper
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Terrain Expertise (Underground)
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Terrain Expertise general feat for Underground environments.

listCustomSpecial.name: Thaumaturgic Ritualist
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: The Chill in the Streets
listCustomSpecial.description:
Your patron never came to you; they were always with you, from the day you came screaming into the world and onto its streets. It has whispered into your ear since then; the safe routes, lost coin, and hidden mysteries. Even now your patron, your home, speaks to you, seeks to keep you safe, and for you to do the same. Your patron is a place, not a person, and it will be with you until one of you crumbles.

Spell List primal
Patron Skill Lore skill for your settlement (such as Absalom Lore or Katapesh Lore). You gain the Additional Lore skill feat for that lore.
Settlement Patron Select one settlement whose level is at least 4; this settlement is your patron, and grants you its blessing while within its walls. While you are within this settlement, you gain a +1 status bonus to Initiative rolls, as well as Perception, Settlement Lore, Society, Stealth, and Sense Motive checks. This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level.
Changing Settlements While extremely uncommon, it is possible for witches with this patron to change which settlement they are bound to. By spending 30 days spending time in and building rapport with a new settlement, they can bond to a new settlement. This severs their bond with their previous settlement.
Lesson of the Path Home Your patron assures you that home is where the heart is, and your heart will always be with them. You gain the know the streets hex and your familiar learns know location.
Familiar of Friendly Streets Your patron provides you a sense of home, even far away. When you Cast or Sustain a hex while within 15 feet of your familiar, you count as being within your city for the next minute. You also become concealed until the start of your next turn as your presence becomes unnoteworthy.

listCustomSpecial.name: Touch of the Void
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the touch of the void devotion spell if your deity has a harm divine font.

listCustomSpecial.name: Toughness
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Toughness general feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Trample Mimicry
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Trample Mimicry feat from the Wild Mimic Archetype.

listCustomSpecial.name: Trap Finder
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: True Perception
listCustomSpecial.description: At 18th level, you gain the True Perception general feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Turn Away Misfortune
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Two Lore Skills
listCustomSpecial.description: You become trained in two Lore skills of your choice.

listCustomSpecial.name: Ubiquitous Gadgets
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Underworld Guide
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain your choice of the Forager or Terrain Expertise (underground) general feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Unfazed Assessment
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Unleash Elements
listCustomSpecial.description:
Requirements You’re in an encounter, your kinetic gate is active, and you aren’t stupefied

You pry deep into your kinetic gate, drawing forth an intense psychic power. If your next action is to use an impulse with the overflow trait, you unleash your elements at a physical and mental cost. Your Elements remain Unleashed for 2 rounds, until you fall unconscious, or until your kinetic aura deactivates, whichever comes first. You can’t voluntarily quell your unleashed elements, nor can you willingly deactivate your kinetic aura while your Elements are Unleashed. While your Elements are Unleashed, the following effects occur:
- The elements of your aura swirl around you, manifesting in forms representing your emotions and thoughts.
- When you use a damaging impulse, you gain a status bonus to its damage equal to half your level, rounded up. This applies only to the initial damage the impulse deals when used. An individual creature takes this damage only once per impulse, even if the spell would damage or heal that creature multiple times.
- When you use an overflow impulse, your kinetic gate doesn’t deactivate; however, each time you use an overflow impulse (including the one you used to Unleash your Elements), you become drained 1 or increase your drained value by 1.
- You can use actions that have the psyche trait.
After your unleashed elements subside, your mind must recover from the strain of channeling your gate so completely. You’re stupified for 1 minute, with a value equal to your drained condition.

listCustomSpecial.name: Unshakable Idealism
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomSpecial.name: Urbanwalk
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain your choice of the Eyes of the City or Streetwise skill feats.

listCustomSpecial.name: Virtuosic Performer
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the Virtuosic Performer skill feat.

listCustomSpecial.name: Wandweaver
listCustomSpecial.description:
You wield magic items as easily as any blade, interlacing them into your attacks. You become trained in your choice of Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion and gain the Trick Magic Item feat. When you Trick a Magic Item, the action gains the bravado trait.

Pathbuilder Note: Add the chosen trained skill as a custom skill increase

listCustomSpecial.name: Wings
listCustomSpecial.description: You have a pair of weak, barely functional wings. You gain the Fledgling Flight strix ancestry feat, ignoring its prerequisites. This does not allow you to take other Strix feats.

listCustomSpecial.name: You’re an Embarrassment!
listCustomSpecial.description: You gain the chosen feat as a bonus feat, ignoring its prerequisites.

listCustomAncestries.name: Patchman
listCustomAncestries.description:
Rarely seen on the surface or in public until more recent years, patchmen remain a hardy and friendly (if dispersed) folk. Despite having only recently begun to organize and collectivise as people, patchmen are oddly synchronized as a people, often sharing similar values and beliefs despite differences in origin, lifespan, and location. One can only assume these convergent beliefs stem from the harsh and short lives they live, which in turn build a people that live life to its fullest and form unbreakable bonds with those they trust. Their appearance often scares away others, but they stand as a testament to not judge books by their cover.

If you want a character with a harsh exterior and kind interior or an adventurer seeking to make the most of the world despite its flaws, you should play a patchman.
listCustomAncestries.languages:
Sakvroth
Common
Additional languages equal to your Intelligence modifier (if it’s positive). Choose from Caligni, Draconic, Dwarven, Gnomish, Kholo, Orcish, and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).
listCustomAncestries.special: Darkvision You can see in darkness and dim light just as well as you can see in bright light, though your vision in darkness is in black and white.

listCustomClasses.name: Fighter (Brawler)

listCustomSpecials.name: Reactive Strike
listCustomSpecials.description:
Trigger A creature within your reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

You lash out at a foe that leaves an opening. Make a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If your attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, you disrupt that action. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

listCustomSpecials.name: Brawler Training
listCustomSpecials.description: You remain maneuverable in combat, trading blows with opponents while breaking their rhythm through martial techniques. You must select Brawler Dedication as your 2nd-level class feat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Brawler Adjustments
listCustomSpecials.description:
You are no longer proficient in heavy armor, and your proficiency for heavy armor does not increase as you level. You are trained in martial weapons instead of expert; at 13th level, you become an expert, and at 19th level you become a master. When their proficiency in a weapon group improves through a fighter feature, martial weapons in that group increase at the same rate as advanced weapons. Additionally, you do not gain the Shield Block general feat or your 1st level class feat.

You must select Athletics instead of Acrobatics as your trained skill choice. When you select a feat for Combat Flexibility, you can select a Brawler or Martial Artist archetype feat instead; you must still meet the level requirement and other prerequisites for that feat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Martial Arts
listCustomSpecials.description: You gain the Martial Artist Dedication. You can take other Dedication feats, even if you have not taken two other Martial Artist feats. At 5th level, your unarmed strikes become magical, allowing them to get past resistances to non-magical attacks.

listCustomSpecials.name: Wrestling Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: You know techniques to grapple, strike, and pin enemies even while you are at a disadvantage. You gain the Titan Wrestler skill feat. You also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Fortitude and Reflex DCs when resisting an opponent’s attempt to Grapple, Shove, Trip, or Swallow you Whole.

listCustomSpecials.name: Bravery
listCustomSpecials.description: Having faced countless foes and the chaos of battle, you have learned how to stand strong in the face of fear. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to expert. When you roll a success at a Will save against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead. In addition, anytime you gain the frightened condition, reduce its value by 1.

listCustomSpecials.name: Fighter Weapon Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description:
Hours spent training with your preferred weapons, learning and developing new combat techniques, have made you particularly effective with your weapons of choice. Choose one weapon group. Your proficiency rank increases to master with the simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks in that group, and to expert with the advanced weapons in that group. You gain access to the critical specialization effects of all weapons and unarmed attacks for which you have master proficiency.

Pathbuilder Note: Due to limitations, all weapons have had their training improved. You still select a group, and only weapons from that group get improved.

listCustomSpecials.name: Martial Arts
listCustomSpecials.description: At 5th level, your unarmed strikes become magical, allowing them to get past resistances to non-magical attacks.

listCustomSpecials.name: Battlefield Surveyor
listCustomSpecials.description: Whether taking stock of an enemy army or simply standing guard, you excel at observing your foes. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master. In addition, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks for initiative, making you faster to react during combat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Battle Hardened
listCustomSpecials.description: Your experience in battle helps protect you against magic and toxins alike. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Combat Flexibility
listCustomSpecials.description:
You can prepare your tactics to suit different situations. When you make your daily preparations, you gain one fighter feat of 8th level or lower that you meet the prerequisites for and don't already have. You can use that feat until your next daily preparations.

When you select a feat for Combat Flexibility, you can select a Brawler or Martial Artist archetype feat instead; you must still meet the level requirement and other prerequisites for that feat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Armor Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You have spent so much time in armor that you know how to make the most of its protection. Your proficiency ranks for light and medium armor, as well as for unarmored defense, increase to expert. You gain the armor specialization effects of medium and heavy armor.

listCustomSpecials.name: Fighter Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: Your practiced techniques have made you even more formidable. Your proficiency rank for your fighter class DC increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Legend
listCustomSpecials.description:
You've learned fighting techniques that apply to all armaments, and you've developed unparalleled skill with your favorite weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increase to master. Your proficiency rank for advanced weapons increases to expert.

You can select one weapon group and increase your proficiency ranks to legendary for all simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks in that weapon group, and to master for all advanced weapons in that weapon group.

Pathbuilder Note: Due to limitations, all weapons have had their training improved. You still select a group, and only weapons from that group get improved.

listCustomSpecials.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: Your damage from weapon specialization increases to 4 with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert, 6 if you're a master, and 8 if you're legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Improved Flexibility
listCustomSpecials.description:
Your extensive experience gives you even greater ability to adapt to each day's challenges. When you use combat flexibility, you can gain two fighter feats instead of one. While the first feat must still be 8th level or lower, the second feat can be up to 14th level, and you can use the first feat to meet the prerequisites of the second feat. You must meet all of the feats' prerequisites.

When you select a feat for Combat Flexibility, you can select a Brawler or Martial Artist archetype feat instead; you must still meet the level requirement and other prerequisites for that feat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Tempered Reflexes
listCustomSpecials.description: Practiced reflexes let you find safety even in the face of cataclysmic explosions. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Reflex save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Armor Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: Your skill with armor improves further. Your proficiency ranks for light and medium armor, as well as for unarmored defense, increase to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Versatile Legend
listCustomSpecials.description: You are nigh-unmatched with any weapon. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons and unarmed attacks increase to legendary, and your proficiency rank for martial weapons and advanced weapons increases to master. Your proficiency rank for your fighter class DC increases to master.

listCustomClasses.description: Far more focused than a normal fighter, brawlers cast aside the heavy arms and weapons of fighters and the monastic practices of monks to unleash brutal attacks upon their foes. Mastering unarmed combat and light weaponry, they mix their fighting ability with non-standard combat skill, interweaving maneuvers into their attacks. Adapting to enemy actions is their greatest advantage, and a brawler can be found laying into a foe one moment and holding them in place for an ally the next.

listCustomClasses.name: Fighter (Hellknight Aspirant)

listCustomSpecials.name: Reactive Strike
listCustomSpecials.description:
Trigger A creature within your reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

You lash out at a foe that leaves an opening. Make a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If your attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, you disrupt that action. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

listCustomSpecials.name: Hellknight Aspirant Training
listCustomSpecials.description: You have dedicated yourself to becoming a hellknight, both in name and spirit. You must select Hellknight Armiger Dedication as your 2nd-level class feat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Hellknight Aspirant Adjustments
listCustomSpecials.description: You do not gain the Combat Flexibility feature at 9th level, nor do you gain Improved Flexibility at 15th level. You gain Battlefield Surveyor at 9th level instead of 7th level. When you would select a weapon group to improve your proficiency with (such as with Fighter Weapon Mastery at 5th level), you instead select your order’s Favored Weapon or weapons (but not their weapon group).

listCustomSpecials.name: Hellknight Order Exemplar
listCustomSpecials.description:
At 7th level, you gain the Order Training archetype feat, as well as the Advanced Order Training archetype feat at 11th level.

Additionally, at 15th level, you gain the Hellknight Order Cross-Training archetype feat. When you make your daily preparations, you can retrain this Hellknight Order Cross-Training feat to change which lesser order benefit you gain from the feat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Bravery
listCustomSpecials.description: Having faced countless foes and the chaos of battle, you have learned how to stand strong in the face of fear. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to expert. When you roll a success at a Will save against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead. In addition, anytime you gain the frightened condition, reduce its value by 1.

listCustomSpecials.name: Fighter Weapon Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description:
Hours spent training with your preferred weapons, learning and developing new combat techniques, have made you particularly effective with your weapons of choice. Choose one weapon group. Your proficiency rank increases to master with the simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks in that group, and to expert with the advanced weapons in that group. You gain access to the critical specialization effects of all weapons and unarmed attacks for which you have master proficiency.

When you would select a weapon group to improve your proficiency with (such as with Fighter Weapon Mastery at 5th level), you instead select your order’s Favored Weapon or weapons (but not their weapon group).



Pathbuilder Note: Due to limitations, all weapons have had their training improved.

listCustomSpecials.name: Battlefield Surveyor
listCustomSpecials.description: Whether taking stock of an enemy army or simply standing guard, you excel at observing your foes. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master. In addition, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks for initiative, making you faster to react during combat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Battle Hardened
listCustomSpecials.description: Your experience in battle helps protect you against magic and toxins alike. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Order Training
listCustomSpecials.description: You gain the Order Training archetype feat

listCustomSpecials.name: Armor Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You have spent so much time in armor that you know how to make the most of its protection. Your proficiency ranks for light, medium, and heavy armor, as well as for unarmored defense, increase to expert. You gain the armor specialization effects of medium and heavy armor.

listCustomSpecials.description: Your practiced techniques have made you even more formidable. Your proficiency rank for your fighter class DC increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.description:

You can select one weapon group and increase your proficiency ranks to legendary for all simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks in that weapon group, and to master for all advanced weapons in that weapon group.

When you would select a weapon group to improve your proficiency with (such as with Fighter Weapon Mastery at 5th level), you instead select your order’s Favored Weapon or weapons (but not their weapon group).

Pathbuilder Note: Due to limitations, all weapons have had their training improved. You still select a group, and only weapons from that group get improved.

listCustomSpecials.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: Your damage from weapon specialization increases to 4 with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert, 6 if you're a master, and 8 if you're legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Hellknight Order Cross-Training
listCustomSpecials.description: You gain the Hellknight Order Cross-Training archetype feat

listCustomSpecials.name: Tempered Reflexes
listCustomSpecials.description: Practiced reflexes let you find safety even in the face of cataclysmic explosions. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Reflex save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Armor Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: Your skill with armor improves further. Your proficiency ranks for light, medium, and heavy armor, as well as for unarmored defense, increase to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Versatile Legend
listCustomSpecials.description: You are nigh-unmatched with any weapon. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increase to legendary, and your proficiency rank for advanced weapons increases to master. Your proficiency rank for your fighter class DC increases to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Advanced Order Training
listCustomSpecials.description: You gain the Advanced Order Training archetype feat

listCustomSpecials.name: Shield Block
listCustomSpecials.description: You gain the Shield Block general feat, a reaction that lets you reduce damage with your shield.

listCustomClasses.description: While many may join the ranks of the Hellknights over the course of their lifetime, some are brought into their order at a young age, being trained from birth to enforce law and order. While many are native to Cheliax, many orders recruit from beyond the country's borders, with many recruits joining during or shortly after the Fifth Mendevian Crusade. Given the abundance of demons and devils within the Sightless Sea, it is no surprise that Hellknights from far and wide would come to enforce the laws of the surface on an otherwise lawless sea.

listCustomClasses.name: Magus (Sword Saint)

listCustomSpecials.name: Sword Saint's Iaijutsu
listCustomSpecials.description: You practice combat armed with only a blade, utilizing rapid slashes from a sheathed position to land devastating blows. You must select Sword Saint Dedication as your 2nd-level class feat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Sword Saint Adjustments
listCustomSpecials.description:
Select a single melee weapon of uncommon rarity or lower from the knife or sword weapon groups. That weapon becomes your chosen weapon. If your chosen weapon is advanced, you become trained in that weapon. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency with your chosen weapon. Certain abilities may require your chosen weapon to be sheathed; to meet this requirement, you must not be wielding any copies of your chosen weapon, must have at least one copy of it stowed, and must have enough hands to wield it free.

Pathbuilder Note: Chosen weapon can't be selected due to limitations. As such, all weapons are marked as scaling like your chosen weapon.

listCustomSpecials.name: Lightning Draw
listCustomSpecials.description:
Requirements your chosen weapon is sheathed

You draw your weapon and attack with it, lowering your guard for a brutal strike. Interact to draw your chosen weapon, then Strike with that weapon. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to that Strike, and your weapon gains the deadly d6 weapon trait. If the weapon already has the deadly trait, increase the size of the deadly damage die by one step instead of giving it deadly d6. If the weapon already has the deadly d12 trait, it deals an additional 1d12 damage on a critical hit instead of increasing its die size.

You then suffer a -2 circumstance penalty to AC until the start of your next turn.

listCustomSpecials.name: Without Equal
listCustomSpecials.description: Your skill with your chosen weapon cannot be matched, transcending even the greatest of warriors. Your proficiency with your chosen weapon increases to legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Arcane Cascade
listCustomSpecials.description:
Requirements You used your most recent action to Cast a Spell or make a Spellstrike. You need to meet this requirement only to enter the stance, not to remain in it.

You divert a portion of the spell’s magical power and keep it cycling through your body and weapon using specialized forms, breathing, or footwork. While you’re in the stance, your melee Strikes deal 1 extra force damage. This damage increases to 2 if you have weapon specialization and 3 if you have greater weapon specialization. Any Strike that benefits from this damage gains the arcane trait, making it magical.

If your most recent spell before entering the stance was one that can deal damage, the damage from the stance is instead the same type that spell could deal (or one type of your choice if the spell could deal multiple types of damage).

listCustomSpecials.name: Conflux Spells
listCustomSpecials.description:
You learn a conflux spell from your hybrid study (page 38), and you can cast additional conflux spells by selecting certain feats. Conflux spells are magus-specific spells created for combat and are a type of focus spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell, and you start with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You refill your focus pool during your daily preparations, and you can regain 1 Focus Point by spending 10 minutes using the Refocus activity to both study your spellbook and perform a physical regimen. Magus conflux spells appear on pages 143–144.

Focus spells are automatically heightened to half your level rounded up. Focus spells don’t require spell slots, nor can you cast them using spell slots. Taking feats can give you more focus spells and increase the size of your focus pool, though your focus pool can never hold more than 3 points. The full rules can be found on page 300 of the Core Rulebook.

listCustomSpecials.name: Spellbook
listCustomSpecials.description:
Every arcane spell has a written version, usually recorded in a spellbook. You start with a spellbook worth 10 sp or less, which you receive for free and must study to prepare your spells each day. The spellbook contains your choice of eight arcane cantrips and four 1st-level arcane spells. You choose these from the common spells on the arcane spell list or from other arcane spells you gain access to. Your spellbook's form and name are up to you. It might be anything from a sturdy book with a secure latch entitled Theses on the Stratagems of Supernatural Warfare to a tattered collection of training pamphlets with your name scrawled on the cover.

Each time you gain a level, you add two more arcane spells to your spellbook, of any level of spell you can cast. You can also use the Arcana skill to add other spells that you find in your adventures (see Learn a Spell). Though you lose some lower spell slots as you increase in level, you keep the spells in your spellbook and can prepare them in your higher-level slots as normal.

If you have a spellbook from multiple sources (such as being a magus with the Wizard Dedication feat), you can use the same spellbook for all your spells.

listCustomSpecials.name: Spellstrike
listCustomSpecials.description:
Frequency until recharged (see below).

You channel a spell into a punch or sword thrust to deliver a combined attack. You cast a spell that takes 1 or 2 actions to cast and requires either a spell attack roll or a saving throw. You imbue its effects into an attack instead of executing the spell normally. Make a melee Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack. This counts as two attacks for your multiple attack penalty, but you don’t apply the penalty until after you’ve completed the Spellstrike. The infusion of spell energy grants your Strike the arcane trait, making it magical. If the spell required a spell attack roll, use your Strike’s results to determine the effects of both the Strike and the spell. If it required a save, the target of the Strike rolls its saving throw normally, though if your Strike was a critical failure, the target is unaffected.

After you use Spellstrike, you can’t do so again until you recharge your Spellstrike as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. You also recharge your Spellstrike when you cast a conflux spell that takes at least 1 action to cast; casting a focus spell of another type doesn’t recharge your Spellstrike.

listCustomSpecials.name: Spellstrike Specifics
listCustomSpecials.description:
Though the base Spellstrike rules cover most spells, various modifications apply to more complicated spells when loaded into your fist, blade, or other attack.

One Target: The spell targets only the target of your Strike, even if it normally allows more targets. This includes area spells, which only the target attempts a saving throw against. Any ongoing effects of the area, such as the difficult terrain from scatter scree, affect only the target’s space. Some feats let you affect more creatures.

Reach: The coupled spell affects the target using the reach of the weapon or unarmed attack you make your Spellstrike with. For instance, gouging claw would affect a creature beyond the reach of your hand if you used a weapon with reach, and frostbite would affect only a creature in your weapon’s reach, even though the spell’s range is longer.

Ancillary Effects: Your spell still has any non-targeted effects that might affect creatures other than the target, as well as any ongoing effects starting from the moment you hit with the Strike. For example, scatter scree would still create difficult terrain in the target’s space (as mentioned above) and tangle vine’s circumstance penalty would last for its normal duration. The spell takes effect after the Strike deals damage; if the Strike has other special effects, the GM determines whether they happen before or after the spell.

Multiple Defenses: Any additional rolls after the initial spell attack still happen normally, such as the Fortitude save attempted by the target of a disintegrate spell. Similarly, a spell that allows you to attack with it again on subsequent rounds would only combine a Strike with its initial attack roll, not with any later ones.

Invalid or Immune Target: If the target you hit wouldn’t be a valid target for the spell, the spell is still expended but doesn’t affect the target. If the target is immune to your attack but not the spell, it can still be affected by the spell.

Variable Actions: Some spells have different effects based on the number of actions you spend to cast them. You choose whether to use the effects of the 1- or 2-action version of the spell when you use Spellstrike. A spell has to take exactly 1 or 2 actions; you can’t use Spellstrike with a spell that takes a free action, reaction, or 3 or more actions.

Spellshape: You typically can’t use spellshape with Spellstrike because spellshape actions require the next action you take to be Cast a Spell, and Spellstrike is a combined activity that doesn’t qualify.

listCustomSpecials.name: Perfect Blade
listCustomSpecials.description:
You wield your blade with a magical focus, combining your stance and blade techniques with the arcane and martial might of magus techniques.

When you use Lightning Draw, you can spend an additional action to Spellstrike with your chosen weapon instead of making a normal Strike. If you are able to Lightning Draw using two weapons, the Spellstrike applies to the first Strike that hits.

While you are in a stance granted by the Sword Saint archetype and your most recent action this turn was to Cast a Spell or make a Spellstrike, you can use a free action with the concentrate trait to empower that stance, granting it the benefits of your Arcane Cascade stance until you exit the stance. While your stance is empowered, you count as being in Arcane Cascade stance for the purposes of any abilities. If you would later gain the Capture Magic feat, you can use that reaction to empower your stance instead of entering Arcane Cascade stance.

Conflux Spell already dead
Studious Spell (7th) see the unseen
Studious Spell (11th) slow
Studious Spell (13th) translocate

listCustomSpecials.name: Lightning Reflexes
listCustomSpecials.description: Your reflexes are lightning fast. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You've dedicated yourself to learning the intricacies of your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increase to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Studious Spells
listCustomSpecials.description:
Your hybrid study grants you additional spells that can enhance your power in combat. You gain two special 2nd-level studious spell slots, which can be used to prepare gecko grip, sure strike, water breathing, and an additional spell depending on your hybrid study. You add any spells from this class feature to your spellbook. At 11th level, the extra slots increase to 3rd level and you add haste and an additional spell depending on your hybrid study. At 13th level, the extra slots increase to 4th level and you add fly and an additional spell depending on your hybrid study.

See specific hybrid studies for more information.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: You can inflict greater injuries with your favored weapons. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Alertness
listCustomSpecials.description: You remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Expert Spellcaster
listCustomSpecials.description: Your fundamental understanding of magic improves, making your spells harder to resist. Your proficiency ranks for arcane spell attack rolls and spell DCs increase to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Resolve
listCustomSpecials.description: You've steeled your mind with resolve. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Medium Armor Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You've learned to defend yourself better against incoming attacks. Your proficiency rank for unarmored defense increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: You fully understand your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increase to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: Your damage from weapon specialization increases to 4 with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert, 6 if you're a master, and 8 if you're legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Juggernaut
listCustomSpecials.description: Your body is accustomed to physical hardship and resistant to a wide range of ailments. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Master Spellcaster
listCustomSpecials.description: You fortify your spells with masterful prowess. Your proficiency ranks for arcane spell attack rolls and spell DCs increase to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Double Spellstrike
listCustomSpecials.description:
You can extend the magic of spells you store with Spellstrike. After you make a Spellstrike with a spell cast from a spell slot, you retain an echo of the spell, stored in your body. The next time you Spellstrike, you can cast the same spell again without expending a spell slot.

If you choose to cast a different spell with Spellstrike, or you go 1 minute without using the stored spell, the stored spell dissipates harmlessly.

listCustomSpecials.name: Medium Armor Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: You've learned to defend yourself better against incoming attacks. Your proficiency rank for unarmored defense increases to master.
