listCustomClasses.description:
Following a long and storied practice of swordsmanship, sword saints wander the world seeking out new challenges, greater foes, and true mastery over their chosen weapon. Masters of the practice of iaijutsu, their attacks are made quickly but deliberately, unsheathing their blade and attacking with it in a single fluid motion. Such swift singular attacks often leave the opponent reeling, but in turn open the sword saint to reprisal.

Sword saints are also masters of technique, falling into specific stances that make best use of their unique fighting style. This allows their blade to take on almost supernatural qualities on top of any others they may grant it with their own magic. As such, sword saints take multiple different forms, with magi, monks, and swashbucklers each having their own take on the fighting style.

Pathbuilder Note: Chosen weapon can't be selected due to limitations. As such, all weapons are marked as scaling like your chosen weapon.

listCustomClasses.name: Monk (Sword Saint)

listCustomSpecials.name: Sword Saint's Iaijutsu
listCustomSpecials.description: You practice combat armed with only a blade, utilizing rapid slashes from a sheathed position to land devastating blows. You must select Sword Saint Dedication as your 2nd-level class feat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Sword Saint Adjustments
listCustomSpecials.description:
Select a single melee weapon of uncommon rarity or lower from the knife or sword weapon groups. That weapon becomes your chosen weapon. If your chosen weapon is advanced, you become trained in that weapon. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency with your chosen weapon. Certain abilities may require your chosen weapon to be sheathed; to meet this requirement, you must not be wielding any copies of your chosen weapon, must have at least one copy of it stowed, and must have enough hands to wield it free.

Pathbuilder Note: Chosen weapon can't be selected due to limitations.

listCustomSpecials.name: Lightning Draw
listCustomSpecials.description:
Requirements your chosen weapon is sheathed

You draw your weapon and attack with it, lowering your guard for a brutal strike. Interact to draw your chosen weapon, then Strike with that weapon. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to that Strike, and your weapon gains the deadly d6 weapon trait. If the weapon already has the deadly trait, increase the size of the deadly damage die by one step instead of giving it deadly d6. If the weapon already has the deadly d12 trait, it deals an additional 1d12 damage on a critical hit instead of increasing its die size.

You then suffer a -2 circumstance penalty to AC until the start of your next turn.

listCustomSpecials.name: Without Equal
listCustomSpecials.description: Your skill with your chosen weapon cannot be matched, transcending even the greatest of warriors. Your proficiency with your chosen weapon increases to legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Powerful Fist
listCustomSpecials.description: Your fists are deadly weapons. The damage die for your fist increases to 1d6 instead of 1d4. You don’t take the normal –2 circumstance penalty when making a lethal attack with your fist or any other unarmed attacks.

listCustomSpecials.name: Incredible Movement
listCustomSpecials.description: You move like the wind. You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speed whenever you’re not wearing armor. The bonus increases by 5 feet for every 4 levels you have beyond 3rd.

listCustomSpecials.name: Mystic Strikes
listCustomSpecials.description: Focusing your will into your physical attacks imbues them with mystical energy. Your unarmed attacks become magical, allowing them to get past resistances to non-magical attacks. However, you still need an item such as handwraps of mighty blows to gain an item bonus to attack rolls or increase your attacks' weapon damage dice.

listCustomSpecials.name: Expert Strikes
listCustomSpecials.description: You’ve practiced martial arts and have now surpassed your former skill. Your proficiency ranks for unarmed attacks and simple weapons increase to expert. When you get a critical hit with an unarmed attack in the brawling group, you get its critical specialization effect.

listCustomSpecials.name: Perception Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Path to Perfection
listCustomSpecials.description: You have progressed along your own path to enlightenment. Choose your Fortitude, Reflex, or Will saving throw. Your proficiency rank for the chosen saving throw increases to master. When you roll a success on the chosen saving throw, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Will
listCustomSpecials.description: Your proficiency rank for Will increases to master. When you roll a success on the chosen saving throw, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Fortitude
listCustomSpecials.description: Your proficiency rank for Fortitude increases to master. When you roll a success on the chosen saving throw, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Reflex
listCustomSpecials.description: Your proficiency rank for Reflex increases to master. When you roll a success on the chosen saving throw, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: You’ve learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you are an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you’re a master, and 4 if you’re legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Metal Strikes
listCustomSpecials.description: You can adjust your body to strike with the mystic energy of rare metals. Your unarmed attacks are treated as cold iron and silver. This allows you to deal more damage to a variety of supernatural creatures, such as demons, devils, and fey.

listCustomSpecials.name: Monk Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: Your proficiency rank for your monk class DC increases to expert. If you have qi spells, your proficiency rank for spell attacks and spell DCs increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Second Path to Perfection
listCustomSpecials.description: You’ve learned to find perfection in every success. Choose a different saving throw than the one you chose for your path to perfection. Your proficiency rank for the chosen saving throw increases to master. If you roll a success with the chosen saving throw, you instead critically succeed.

listCustomSpecials.name: Graceful Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: You move with perpetual grace, turning aside blows. Your proficiency rank for unarmored defense increases to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Master Strikes
listCustomSpecials.description: You’ve honed your body into an even deadlier weapon. Your proficiency ranks for unarmed attacks and simple weapons increase to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: Your damage from weapon specialization increases to 4 with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you’re an expert, 6 if you’re a master, and 8 if you’re legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Third Path to Perfection
listCustomSpecials.description: You have made great progress in your personal studies of enlightenment. Choose one of the saving throws you selected for path to perfection or second path to perfection. Your proficiency rank for the chosen type of save increases to legendary. When you roll a critical failure on the chosen type of save, you get a failure instead. When you roll a failure on the chosen type of save against an effect that deals damage, you take half damage.

listCustomSpecials.name: Adamantine Strikes
listCustomSpecials.description: When you focus your will into your limbs, your blows are as unyielding as the hardest of metals. Your unarmed attacks are treated as adamantine.

listCustomSpecials.name: Will (Third Path)
listCustomSpecials.description: Your proficiency rank for Will increases to legendary. When you roll a critical failure on the chosen type of save, you get a failure instead. When you roll a failure on the chosen type of save against an effect that deals damage, you take half damage.

listCustomSpecials.name: Fortitude (Third Path)
listCustomSpecials.description: Your proficiency rank for Fortitude increases to legendary. When you roll a critical failure on the chosen type of save, you get a failure instead. When you roll a failure on the chosen type of save against an effect that deals damage, you take half damage.

listCustomSpecials.name: Reflex (Third Path)
listCustomSpecials.description: Your proficiency rank for Reflex increases to legendary. When you roll a critical failure on the chosen type of save, you get a failure instead. When you roll a failure on the chosen type of save against an effect that deals damage, you take half damage.

listCustomSpecials.name: Graceful Legend
listCustomSpecials.description: Your sublime movement grants you unparalleled protection and offense. Your proficiency rank for unarmored defense increases to legendary, and your proficiency rank for your monk class DC increases to master. If you have qi spells, your proficiency rank for spell attack modifiers and spell DCs increases to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Perfected Form
listCustomSpecials.description: You have purged incompetence from your techniques. On your first Strike of your turn, if you roll lower than 10, you can treat the attack roll as a 10. This is a fortune effect.

listCustomClasses.description:
Following a long and storied practice of swordsmanship, sword saints wander the world seeking out new challenges, greater foes, and true mastery over their chosen weapon. Masters of the practice of iaijutsu, their attacks are made quickly but deliberately, unsheathing their blade and attacking with it in a single fluid motion. Such swift singular attacks often leave the opponent reeling, but in turn open the sword saint to reprisal.

Sword saints are also masters of technique, falling into specific stances that make best use of their unique fighting style. This allows their blade to take on almost supernatural qualities on top of any others they may grant it with their own magic. As such, sword saints take multiple different forms, with magi, monks, and swashbucklers each having their own take on the fighting style.

Pathbuilder Note: Chosen weapon can't be selected due to limitations. As such, all weapons are marked as scaling like your chosen weapon.

listCustomClasses.name: Rogue (Eldritch Scoundrel)

listCustomSpecials.name: Sneak Attack
listCustomSpecials.description:
When your enemy can't properly defend itself, you take advantage to deal extra damage. If you Strike a creature that has the off-guard condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, a ranged weapon attack, or a ranged unarmed attack, you deal an extra 1d6 precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown melee weapon, that weapon must also be agile or finesse.

As your rogue level increases, so does the number of damage dice for your sneak attack. Increase the number of dice by one at 5th, 11th, and 17th levels.

listCustomSpecials.name: Surprise Attack
listCustomSpecials.description: You spring into combat faster than foes can react. On the first round of combat, if you roll Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are off-guard to you.

listCustomSpecials.name: Deny Advantage
listCustomSpecials.description: As someone who takes advantage of openings, you are careful not to leave such gaps yourself. You aren't off-guard to hidden, undetected, or flanking creatures of your level or lower, or creatures of your level or lower using surprise attack. However, they can still help their allies flank.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Tricks
listCustomSpecials.description:
You gain expert proficiency in simple weapons and unarmed attacks. When you critically succeed at an attack roll against an off-guard creature while using an agile or finesse weapon or an agile or finesse unarmed attack, you apply the critical specialization effect for that weapon or unarmed attack.

You become expert in spell attack modifiers and spell DCs.

listCustomSpecials.name: Scoundrel's Spellcraft
listCustomSpecials.description: Eldritch scoundrels utilize magic in place of more traditional weapons. Using their knowledge, they sneak spells past defenses as if they were another knife in their arsenal. You must select Eldritch Scoundrel Dedication as your 2nd-level class feat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Piercing Spellcraft
listCustomSpecials.description:
Whether you’re using magic items, wielding innate magic, or dabbling in spellcasting, you can sneak spells past your foes’ defenses as easily as any blade. When you succeed at a spell attack roll against a single creature and the spell deals damage, you can apply any abilities granted by Rogue features or feats that would normally apply when you Strike a creature. If your spell targets multiple creatures, apply any of these effects to only one target. A critical success on a spell attack roll counts as a critical success on a Strike for the purposes of these effects.

This allows you to apply effects like Sneak Attack to off-guard creatures you successfully hit with a spell attack roll, but also allows you to apply effects like Sly Striker to creatures you hit that aren’t off-guard. Further, if a rogue action would require you to have first made a Strike against a creature, you can use that action if you Cast a Spell instead. You must still meet the other requirements for the action.

listCustomSpecials.name: Evasive Reflexes
listCustomSpecials.description: You've learned to move quickly to avoid explosions, dragons' breath, and worse. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Reflex save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Perception Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: You've developed keen awareness and attention to detail. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary

listCustomSpecials.name: Debilitating Strike
listCustomSpecials.description:
Trigger Your Strike hits an off-guard creature and deals damage.

You apply one of the following debilitations, which lasts until the end of your next turn.
  • Debilitation The target takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.
  • Debilitation The target becomes enfeebled 1.

listCustomSpecials.name: Debilitating Spell
listCustomSpecials.description:
Trigger You succeed at a spell attack roll against an off-guard creature and deal damage.

You apply one of the following debilitations, which lasts until the end of your next turn:
- Debilitation The target takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.
- Debilitation The target becomes stupefied 1.

listCustomSpecials.name: Debilitating Spell
listCustomSpecials.description: You can also take advantage of openings with your spells. You gain the Debilitating Spell free action. Whenever you would add a debilitation to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Strike, you also add it to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Rogue Resilience
listCustomSpecials.description: Your physique is incredibly hardy. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Rogue Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: Your techniques are now harder to resist. Your proficiency rank for your rogue class DC increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Greater Rogue Reflexes
listCustomSpecials.description: You elude danger to a degree that few can match. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to legendary. When you roll a critical failure on a Reflex save, you get a failure instead. When you roll a failure on a Reflex save against a damaging effect, you take half damage.

listCustomSpecials.name: Perception Legend
listCustomSpecials.description: You notice things almost impossible for an ordinary person to detect. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Light Armor Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You've learned how to dodge while wearing light or no armor. Your proficiency ranks for light armor and unarmored defense increase to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Master Tricks
listCustomSpecials.description:
You've mastered a rogue's fighting moves. Your proficiency ranks increase to master for all simple weapons and unarmed attacks.

You become master in spell attack modifiers and spell DCs at 13th level.

listCustomSpecials.name: Double Debilitation
listCustomSpecials.description:
Your opportunistic attacks are particularly detrimental. When you use Debilitating Strike, you can apply two debilitations simultaneously; removing one removes both.

When you use Debilitating Spell, you can apply two debilitations simultaneously; removing one removes both.

listCustomSpecials.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: Your damage from weapon specialization increases to 4 with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert, 6 if you're a master, and 8 if you're legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Agile Mind
listCustomSpecials.description: You play mental games and employ cognitive tricks to throw off mind-altering effects. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success at a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Spellshredding
listCustomSpecials.description: You’ve learned the secret to striking a creature’s spellcasting ability itself, curing off an unwary foe from their magic entirely. Your proficiency rank for your rogue class DC increases to master. You gain the Spellshred free action.

listCustomSpecials.name: Spellshred
listCustomSpecials.description:
Trigger You succeed at a spell attack roll against an off-guard creature and deal damage

The target attempts a Fortitude save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. It then becomes temporarily immune to your Spellshred for 1 day.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target is stupefied 2 until the end of your turn.
Failure The target is stupefied 2 and unable to take the Cast a Spell action for 4 rounds.
Critical Failure As failure, but the target is stupefied 4 for 4 rounds, unable to take the Cast a Spell action for two hours, or killed (your choice).

listCustomSpecials.name: Spell Proficiency
listCustomSpecials.description: Your methods of attack focus around spellcraft instead of weapons. You become expert in spell attack modifiers and spell DCs at 5th level, and become master in spell attack modifiers and spell DCs at 13th level.

listCustomSpecials.name: Spell Training
listCustomSpecials.description:
Choose a 2nd-level archetype that has a basic, expert, and master spellcasting feat. You gain that archetype’s dedication feat as a bonus feat even though you don’t meet its level prerequisite, though you must meet its other prerequisites. You may also ignore the requirement of selecting 3 feats from that dedication. You can choose the spellcasting ability score for the archetype you chose as your key ability score.

Pathbuilder Note Add the selected dedication feat as a bonus feat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Eldritch Scoundrel Adjustments
listCustomSpecials.description: You do not select a rogue’s racket. You no longer gain proficiency in martial weapons, and your proficiency with martial weapons does not improve with the Weapon Tricks or Master Tricks class features. At 19th level, you do not gain the Master Strike class feature.

listCustomSpecials.name: Light Armor Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: Your skill with light armor improves, increasing your ability to dodge blows. Your proficiency ranks for light armor and unarmored defense increase to master.

listCustomClasses.description: A properly placed spell can be just as deadly as any knife, and eldritch scoundrels take advantage of this factor to the extreme. Striking at weak points with magical precision, you trade the direct magical expertise of many for the finesse to use it when you need it most. You may be a thief who picked up a little magic or a mage who turned towards less scholarly pursuits, but the magic you’ve learned allows to handle magical security measures and strange threats far better than a common thief.

listCustomClasses.name: Swashbuckler (Sword Saint)

listCustomSpecials.name: Sword Saint's Iaijutsu
listCustomSpecials.description: You practice combat armed with only a blade, utilizing rapid slashes from a sheathed position to land devastating blows. You must select Sword Saint Dedication as your 2nd-level class feat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Sword Saint Adjustments
listCustomSpecials.description:
Select a single melee weapon of uncommon rarity or lower from the knife or sword weapon groups. That weapon becomes your chosen weapon. If your chosen weapon is advanced, you become trained in that weapon. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency with your chosen weapon. Certain abilities may require your chosen weapon to be sheathed; to meet this requirement, you must not be wielding any copies of your chosen weapon, must have at least one copy of it stowed, and must have enough hands to wield it free.

Pathbuilder Note: Chosen weapon can't be selected due to limitations.

listCustomSpecials.name: Lightning Draw
listCustomSpecials.description:
Requirements your chosen weapon is sheathed

You draw your weapon and attack with it, lowering your guard for a brutal strike. Interact to draw your chosen weapon, then Strike with that weapon. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to that Strike, and your weapon gains the deadly d6 weapon trait. If the weapon already has the deadly trait, increase the size of the deadly damage die by one step instead of giving it deadly d6. If the weapon already has the deadly d12 trait, it deals an additional 1d12 damage on a critical hit instead of increasing its die size.

You then suffer a -2 circumstance penalty to AC until the start of your next turn.

listCustomSpecials.name: Without Equal
listCustomSpecials.description: Your skill with your chosen weapon cannot be matched, transcending even the greatest of warriors. Your proficiency with your chosen weapon increases to legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Panache
listCustomSpecials.description:
You care as much about the way you accomplish something as whether you actually accomplish it in the first place. When you perform an action with particular style, you can leverage this moment of verve to perform spectacular, deadly maneuvers. This heightened state of flair is called panache.

You gain panache by performing actions that have the bravado trait. Tumble Through and additional actions determined by your swashbuckler's style (see below) gain the bravado trait when you use them. The GM might determine that a check to perform a particularly daring action, such as swinging on a chandelier or sliding down a drapery, can gain the bravado trait. These checks typically involve at least a single action and a non-trivial DC. Normally, you gain and use panache only in combat encounters; when an encounter ends, you lose panache.

Powerful finisher actions, including Confident Finisher, can be used only while you have panache and cause you to lose your panache.

listCustomSpecials.name: Precise Strike
listCustomSpecials.description:
When you make a Strike with an agile or finesse melee weapon or agile or finesse unarmed attack, you deal 2 additional precision damage. If the Strike is part of a finisher, the additional damage is 2d6 precision damage instead.

As your swashbuckler level increases, so does your additional damage for precise strike. At 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th level, increase the amount of additional damage on a Strike by 1 and the additional damage on a finisher by 1d6.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You’ve dedicated yourself to learning the intricacies of your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increase to expert. You gain access to the critical specialization effects of all weapons for which you have expert proficiency.

listCustomSpecials.name: Exemplary Finisher
listCustomSpecials.description:
You execute your finishing moves with spectacular flair, adding special effects to your finishers. If a Strike you make as part of a finisher hits a foe, you add one of the following effects to the Strike, depending on your swashbuckler's style

Iaijutsu: You Stow your chosen weapon.

listCustomSpecials.name: Assured Evasion
listCustomSpecials.description: Your ability to elude danger is matchless. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to legendary. When you roll a critical failure on a Reflex save, you get a failure instead. When you roll a failure on a Reflex save against a damaging effect, you take half damage.

listCustomSpecials.name: Reinforced Ego
listCustomSpecials.description: You’ve steeled your mind with resolve. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Stylish Combatant
listCustomSpecials.description: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to skill checks with the bravado trait while in a combat encounter. While you have panache, you gain a +5-foot status bonus to your Speeds.

listCustomSpecials.name: Iaijutsu
listCustomSpecials.description: When you Interact to Stow your chosen weapon, you gain panache until the end of your next turn. You also gain the Masterful Bladework swashbuckler feat, ignoring its prerequisites. When you make a Lightning Draw attack, you can use a one-action activity with the finisher trait instead of making a normal Strike. That finisher must still use your chosen weapon.

listCustomSpecials.name: Confident Finisher
listCustomSpecials.description:
You make an incredibly graceful attack, piercing your foe’s defenses. Make a Strike with the following failure effect.

Failure You deal half your precise strike damage to the target. This damage type is that of the weapon or unarmed attack you used for the Strike.

listCustomSpecials.name: Fortitude Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: Your physique has grown hardy in your adventures. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Opportune Riposte
listCustomSpecials.description:
Trigger An enemy within your reach critically fails on a Strike against you.

You take advantage of an opening from your enemy's fumbled attack. You either make a melee Strike against the triggering enemy or attempt to Disarm it of the weapon it used for the Strike.

listCustomSpecials.name: Vivacious Speed
listCustomSpecials.description: When you’ve made an impression, you move even faster than normal, darting about the battlefield with incredible speed. Increase the status bonus to your Speeds from stylish combatant to a +10-foot status bonus; this bonus increases by 5 feet at 7th, 11th, 15th, and 19th levels. When you don’t have panache, you still get half this status bonus to your Speed, rounded down to the nearest 5-foot increment.

listCustomSpecials.name: Confident Evasion
listCustomSpecials.description: You’ve learned to move quickly to avoid explosions, a dragon’s breath, and worse. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Reflex save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Continuous Flair
listCustomSpecials.description: While not equal to your panache in combat, you have a dramatic flair about you in any situation. The circumstance bonus from Stylish Combatant applies in exploration mode.

listCustomSpecials.name: Keen Flair
listCustomSpecials.description: You inflict devastating attacks on even well-defended foes. When you Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack with which you have master proficiency, if you roll a 19 on the die and the roll is a success, you critically succeed instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Eternal Confidence
listCustomSpecials.description:
As a swashbuckler at the peak of your skill, you swell with confidence in every attack. Your proficiency rank for your swashbuckler class DC increases to master.

When you Strike as part of a finisher or Opportune Riposte, you can give the Strike the failure effect from the Confident Finisher action, including the increase from Precise Finisher if you have that feat. You can do so only if the Strike uses a weapon or unarmed attack that you could use for Confident Finisher.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: You’ve learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you are an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you’re a master and 4 if you’re legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Swashbuckler Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You perform swashbuckling techniques with exceptional flair, making them harder to resist. Your circumstance bonus from Stylish Combatant increases to +2. Your proficiency rank for your swashbuckler class DC increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Perception Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: Through your adventures, you’ve developed keen awareness and attention to detail. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: You fully understand your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple and martial weapons and unarmed attacks increase to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Light Armor Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You’ve learned to dodge while wearing light or no armor. Your proficiency ranks for unarmored defense increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: Your damage from weapon specialization increases to 4 with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you’re an expert, 6 if you’re a master, and 8 if you’re legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Light Armor Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: Your skill with light armor improves, increasing your ability to dodge blows. Your proficiency ranks for unarmored defense increases to master.

listCustomClasses.description:
Following a long and storied practice of swordsmanship, sword saints wander the world seeking out new challenges, greater foes, and true mastery over their chosen weapon. Masters of the practice of iaijutsu, their attacks are made quickly but deliberately, unsheathing their blade and attacking with it in a single fluid motion. Such swift singular attacks often leave the opponent reeling, but in turn open the sword saint to reprisal.

Sword saints are also masters of technique, falling into specific stances that make best use of their unique fighting style. This allows their blade to take on almost supernatural qualities on top of any others they may grant it with their own magic. As such, sword saints take multiple different forms, with magi, monks, and swashbucklers each having their own take on the fighting style.

Pathbuilder Note: Chosen weapon can't be selected due to limitations. As such, all weapons are marked as scaling like your chosen weapon.

listCustomClasses.name: Thaumaturge (Implement Occultist)

listCustomSpecials.name: First Implement and Esoterica
listCustomSpecials.description:
Your implement is a special object of symbolic importance: your badge as you treat with the supernatural and a powerful tool if things turn violent. Choose an implement from the options to which you have access. You begin play with a mundane item of that type, and you gain the initiate benefit for that implement. While an implement is useful to you, it typically has no value if sold. If you acquire a new object of the same general implement type, you can switch your implement to the new object by spending 1 day of downtime with the new item. As you advance as a thaumaturge, you will collect up to three implements and unlock the hidden potential stored within each, so you can mix and match their benefits to suit your situation.

While your implements are your primary tools in your dealings with the supernatural, you know the value of always being prepared. You constantly collect and carry various smaller mystic objects, bits of materials with paranormal affinities, and items used in folk practices: your esoterica. These might include cold iron nails, scraps of scrolls and scriptures, fragments of bones purportedly from a saint, and other similar objects. You keep your esoterica in easy-to-access places on your person and are well practiced in brandishing your implement and esoterica together, so you can draw and use esoterica with the same hand you're using to wield an implement.

Implements can be found here.

listCustomSpecials.name: Implement's Empowerment
listCustomSpecials.description: The power of your implement can also be turned to the more common task of combat, its power adding to and amplifying the effects of runes and other magical empowerments. When you Strike, you can trace mystic patterns with an implement you're holding to empower the Strike, causing it to deal 2 additional damage per weapon damage die. Channeling the power requires full use of your hands. You don't gain the benefit of implement's empowerment if you are holding anything in either hand other than a single one-handed weapon, other implements, or esoterica, and you must be holding at least one implement to gain the benefit.

listCustomSpecials.name: Lightning Reflexes
listCustomSpecials.description: Your reflexes are lightning fast. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Second Implement
listCustomSpecials.description:
You've added another implement of power to your toolkit. You choose a second implement, which must be a different type of implement than your first. You gain the initiate benefit of your new implement.

While you're holding an implement in one hand, you can quickly switch it with another implement you're wearing to use an action from the implement you're switching to. To do so, you can Interact as a free action immediately before executing the implement's action. This allows you to meet requirements of having an implement in hand to use its action. For example, if you had your lantern implement in one hand, a weapon in the other, and a chalice implement you were wearing, you could swap your lantern for your chalice to use its reaction.

listCustomSpecials.name: Thaumaturge Weapon Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You've learned the secret ways your weapons work most effectively. Your proficiency ranks for unarmed attacks, simple weapons, and martial weapons increase to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Implement Adept
listCustomSpecials.description: You have deepened your connection to one of your implements, unlocking its adept power. Choose one of your implements and gain the adept benefit for that implement.

listCustomSpecials.name: Resolve
listCustomSpecials.description: You've steeled your mind with resolve. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you are an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Intensify Vulnerability
listCustomSpecials.description: You've learned to use your implement to further assault a creature whose vulnerabilities you're exploiting. You gain the intensify vulnerability benefit of all of your implements, as well as the following action.

listCustomSpecials.name: Intensify Vulnerability
listCustomSpecials.description:
Frequency once per round
Requirements You're benefiting from Exploit Vulnerability, you can see the subject, and you haven't used Exploit Vulnerability this round.

You present your implement and esoterica again, intensifying their effects on the target in a way unique to your implement. You gain the intensified vulnerability benefit from one of the implements you're holding, which lasts until the beginning of your next turn.

listCustomSpecials.name: Thaumaturgic Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description:
You've learned deeper secrets of the supernatural, and your abilities are harder to resist. Your proficiency rank for your thaumaturge class DC increases to expert.

You also gain an additional skill increase, which you can apply only to Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion.

Pathbuilder Note: Add skill increase as a custom increase

listCustomSpecials.name: Vigilant Senses
listCustomSpecials.description: Through your adventures, you've developed keen awareness and attention to detail. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Medium Armor Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You've learned to defend yourself better against attacks. Your proficiency ranks for light armor, medium armor, and unarmored defense increase to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Second Adept
listCustomSpecials.description: You've improved your link to your second implement. You gain the adept benefit of your second implement.

listCustomSpecials.name: Greater Resolve
listCustomSpecials.description: Your unbelievable training grants you mental resiliency. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to legendary. When you roll a critical failure on a Will save, you get a failure instead. When you roll a failure on a Will save against a damaging effect, you take half damage.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: You fully understand your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for unarmed attacks, simple weapons, and martial weapons increase to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: Your damage from weapon specialization increases to 4 with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert, 6 if you're a master, and 8 if you're legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Juggernaut
listCustomSpecials.description: Your body is accustomed to physical hardship and resistant to a wide range of ailments. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Third Implement
listCustomSpecials.description: As you come closer to the culmination of your journey, you gain your final implement, completing your set of three. It must be a different type of implement than your first and second implements. You gain the initiate benefit and intensify vulnerability benefit of your new implement.

listCustomSpecials.name: Implement Paragon
listCustomSpecials.description: You have unlocked the last secrets of an implement. Choose one of your implements that already gained the adept benefit; you gain the paragon benefit for that implement.

listCustomSpecials.name: Thaumaturgic Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description:
You've become a master in paranormal phenomena, and your esoterica grow in power. Your proficiency rank for your thaumaturge class DC increases to master.

You also gain an additional skill increase, which you can apply only to Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion.

Pathbuilder Note: Add skill increase as a custom increase

listCustomSpecials.name: Medium Armor Mastery
listCustomSpecials.description: Your skill with light and medium armor improves, increasing your ability to avoid blows. Your proficiency ranks for light and medium armor, as well as for unarmed defense, increase to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Unlimited Esoterica
listCustomSpecials.description: Your understanding of your esoterica becomes so complete that you can access your mystic tools without even thinking. You can use Exploit Vulnerability or Intensify Vulnerability as a free action, rather than a single action, though still with a frequency of only once per round.

listCustomSpecials.name: Implement Occultism
listCustomSpecials.description: You utilize knowledge of your implements’ true natures to unlock their more mystical powers, weaving a curse upon your foes and opening them to esoteric and wholly natural attacks. Your knowledge comes not from folktales or stories, but hard facts about magic and how it can be used to burden your enemies. To be an implement occultist is to stare down a foe and know that no matter what they have at their disposal, your resources are better. You must select Occultist Dedication as your 2nd-level class feat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Implement Occultist Adjustments
listCustomSpecials.description: You do not gain the Esoteric Lore and Exploit Vulnerability abilities. If a thaumaturge feature or feat would require you to utilize Esoteric Lore, you utilize Occultism instead. Intelligence is your key attribute instead of Charisma.

listCustomSpecials.name: Warrior-Occultist
listCustomSpecials.description: In order to lay curses upon your foes, you must remain in much closer range to maintain the effect; as such, you’ve learned to both guard yourself and utilize your implements. You gain the Shield Block general feat. The hand you use to wield a shield counts as a free hand for the purposes of using Implement’s Empowerment or carrying an implement as long as the implement isn’t a weapon.

listCustomSpecials.name: Implement's Curse
listCustomSpecials.description:
Frequency once per round
Requirements You are holding your implement

You raise your implement, focusing its power to curse your foe with occult magic. Select a creature you can see within 20 feet and attempt an Occultism check against one of their DCs, based on the implement you used for this action as determined by the Curse DC section of the Implement Associations table. They suffer the following effects until you Empower Implement against a different target, you Dismiss this effect, or you end your turn more than 20 feet away from the target. This counts as you benefitting from Exploit Vulnerability for the purposes of any abilities.

Critical Success As success, but they are also cursebound 1.
Success As failure, but you fully bind a horrid curse upon the target, causing them to suffer a -1 item penalty to their AC and saving throws. In addition, when they would target a creature other than you with a hostile action, they become cursebound 1, gaining the effects of a curse based on the implement you used for this action as determined by the Curse section of the Implement Associations table. If they are already cursebound, they instead increase their cursebound value by 1, to a maximum of 2. They decrease their cursebound value at the end of a turn where they haven’t taken a hostile action against a creature other than you.
Failure The magic takes hold, but just barely. Unarmed and weapon Strikes made against the creature become magical if they weren’t already.
Critical Failure The curse wholly fails to take hold and lashes back at you, causing you to be drained 1, or increase your current drained condition by 1. Empower Implement ends on the target.

Special Oracles and creatures that gain the cursebound condition through one of their abilities are immune to this ability as their natural curses overpower those you attempt to bestow. When this action is used on such a target, you only gain the failure effects of this action if you would roll a success or critical success, but also learn that the target is naturally cursebound.
listCustomSpecials.traits: Curse, Esoterica, Manipulate, Occult, Thaumaturge, 3rd Party

listCustomSpecials.name: Master of the Paranormal
listCustomSpecials.description:
You eschew general knowledge for a specialty in the paranormal. You gain the Diverse Lore class feat, but increase the penalty to Recall Knowledge with Occultism on any topic to -4 and increase the Recall Knowledge DC for this feat when used against targets that can’t be identified with Occultism by 2.

In turn, however, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Recall Knowledge about topics that would normally be identified with Occultism. This bonus increases to +2 if you are at least master with Occultism, or +3 if you are legendary with Occultism. When using Empower Implement on a target that would be identified with Occultism, the DC to Recall Knowledge through Diverse Lore is reduced by this circumstance bonus as well.

listCustomSpecials.name: Implement Casting
listCustomSpecials.description:
You channel your innate psychic talent into your implements, allowing you to conjure potent occult magic. After selecting your first implement, consult the Implement Associations table below. While you are wielding that implement, you can cast that implement’s associated cantrip as an innate cantrip. Additionally, select one of that implement’s associated domains; you gain the initial domain spell for that domain, which you can only cast while the implement is on your person. These spells, as well as any other spells you gain from this archetype, are occult spells. You can always select the apocryphal option for your chosen domain instead of the normal version, if it exists.

You become trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs, and your spellcasting attribute is Intelligence for any spells granted by this archetype. You become an expert in spell attack rolls and spell DCs when you gain the Thaumaturgic Expertise feature, and become a master in spell attack rolls and spell DCs when you gain the Thaumaturgic Mastery feature. You refocus by maintaining and studying your implements.

Later, when you gain your second and third implements, you gain their associated cantrip and the initial domain spell for one of their associated domains.

listCustomSpecials.name: Greater Implement Domain
listCustomSpecials.description: You can draw greater power from your implements. Select one of your adept implements that you gained through the thaumaturge class or an implement occultist feat. You gain the advanced domain spell for the domain that you chose for that implement.

listCustomSpecials.name: Implement’s Major Curse
listCustomSpecials.description: You can draw out further curses from your implements to harry your foes. The maximum cursebound value your Empower Implement can cause increases from cursebound 2 to cursebound 3.

listCustomSpecials.name: Implement’s Extreme Curse
listCustomSpecials.description: You can draw out a cataclysmic level of curse within those you target with your implements. The maximum cursebound value your Empower Implement can cause increases from cursebound 3 to cursebound 4.

listCustomClasses.description:
Thaumaturges with a strong psychic talent and curiosity for the world may utilize their knowledge in place of connections to others to draw out the power in their implements. These Implement Occultists use their implements as psychic focuses, unlocking dormant magic in their associations to hamper their foes. This hampering takes many forms, but often results in their foes being placed under powerful curses.

Due to the more direct nature of their trade, implement occultists in turn are far more dedicated to serving a frontline role, utilizing defensive techniques and often keeping a weapon implement handy. That said, many will similarly stay towards the rear of groups, laying down curses from a distance and allowing their allies to reap the benefits.

listCustomClasses.name: Wizard (Arcanist)

listCustomSpecials.name: Wizard Spellcasting
listCustomSpecials.description:
Your arcane school is where you devoted yourself to the study of spellcraft. Whether you learned in the storied halls of a formal institution, via an apprenticeship with an archmage, or taught yourself from secondhand tomes, your arcane school indelibly set the curriculum and direction of your magic.

Curriculum Spells: You automatically add some of the spells listed in your school’s curriculum to your spellbook. At 1st level, you add a cantrip and two 1st-rank spells of your choice. As soon as you gain the ability to cast wizard spells of a new rank, choose one of the spells from your curriculum of that rank to add to your spellbook. A superscript “U” indicates an uncommon spell. Your GM might allow you to swap or add other spells to your curriculum if they strongly fit the theme.

Spell Slots: Each day, you can prepare an extra cantrip from your curriculum. You also gain an extra spell slot at each spell rank for which you have wizard spell slots. You can prepare only spells from your school’s curriculum in these extra slots. Any spell listed in your curriculum of a suitable spell rank is eligible to be prepared in each of these extra slots, regardless of how you added the spell to your spellbook.

School Spells: School spells are a type of focus spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell, and you start with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You refill your focus pool during your daily preparations, and you can regain 1 Focus Point by spending 10 minutes using the Refocus activity to study your spellbook or conduct arcane research. Focus spells are automatically heightened to half your level rounded up, much like cantrips. Focus spells don’t require spell slots, and you can’t cast them using spell slots. Certain feats give you more focus spells. The maximum Focus Points your focus pool can hold is equal to the number of focus spells you have, but it can never be more than 3 points. You learn the initial school spell, which is unique to your school. You can learn the advanced school spell with the Advanced School Spell feat.

*Pathbuilder Note: Due to current limitations, you cannot select your school."

listCustomSpecials.name: Arcane Bond
listCustomSpecials.description: You place some of your magical power in a bonded item. Each day when you prepare your spells, you can designate a single item you own as your bonded item. This is typically an item associated with spellcasting, such as a wand, ring, or staff, but you are free to designate a weapon or other item. You gain the Drain Bonded Item free action.

listCustomSpecials.name: Drain Bonded Item
listCustomSpecials.description:
Frequency once per day
Requirements Your bonded item is on your person.

You expend the magical power stored in your bonded item. During the current turn, you can cast one spell you prepared today and already cast, without spending a spell slot. You must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell’s other requirements.

listCustomSpecials.name: Spellbook
listCustomSpecials.description:
Every arcane spell has a written version, which you record in your personalized book of spells. You start with a spellbook worth 10 sp or less, which you receive for free and must study each day to prepare your spells. Your spellbook’s form and name are up to you. It might be a musty, leather-bound tome or an assortment of thin metal disks connected to a brass ring; its name might be esoteric, like The Tome of Silent Shadows or something more academic, like Advanced Pyromantic Applications of Elemental Theory.

The spellbook contains your choice of 10 arcane cantrips and five 1st-rank arcane spells. You choose these from the common spells on the arcane spell list or from other arcane spells you gain access to. You also add two 1st-rank spells from the curriculum of your arcane school (except in the case of the school of unified magical theory, as described in that school).

Each time you gain a level, you add two arcane spells to your spellbook, of any spell rank for which you have spell slots, chosen from common spells of your tradition or others you gain access to and learn via Learn a Spell. When you gain spell slots of a new rank, you also add an additional spell from your school’s curriculum (unless it’s the school of unified magical theory).

listCustomSpecials.name: Wizard Spellcasting
listCustomSpecials.description:
Through dedicated study and practice, you can construct spells with academic rigor by shaping arcane magic. You are a spellcaster, and you can cast spells of the arcane tradition using the Cast a Spell activity. As a wizard, when you cast spells, your incantations likely specify exactly what forces you call on and how to shape them, and your gestures precisely shape and direct your magic while circles of arcane runes flare to life.

At 1st level, you can prepare up to two 1st-rank spells and five cantrips each morning from the spells in your spellbook (see below), as well as one extra curriculum cantrip and one extra curriculum spell of each rank you can cast from your arcane school. Prepared spells remain available to you until you cast them or until you prepare your spells again. The number of spells you can prepare is called your spell slots.

As you increase in level as a wizard, the number of spells you can prepare each day increases, as does the highest rank of spell you can cast.

Some of your spells require you to attempt a spell attack to see how effective they are, or have your enemies roll against your spell DC (typically by attempting a saving throw). Since your key attribute is Intelligence, your spell attack modifier and spell DC use your Intelligence modifier.

Heightening Spells
When you get spell slots of 2nd rank and higher, you can fill those slots with stronger versions of lower-rank spells. This increases the spell’s rank, heightening it to match the spell slot. Many spells have specific improvements when they are heightened to certain ranks.

Cantrips
Some of your spells are cantrips. A cantrip is a special type of spell that doesn’t use spell slots. You can cast a cantrip at will, any number of times per day. A cantrip is always automatically heightened to half your level rounded up— this is usually equal to the highest rank of wizard spell slot you have. For example, as a 1st-level wizard, your cantrips are 1st-rank spells, and as a 5th-level wizard, your cantrips are 3rd-rank spells.

listCustomSpecials.name: Arcanist Spellcraft
listCustomSpecials.description: You bend raw magic to cast your spells, and enhance it further with spells made into spellshapes. You must select Arcanist Dedication as your 2nd-level class feat.

listCustomSpecials.name: Arcanist Adjustments
listCustomSpecials.description: You do not gain an arcane thesis, though you count as having the quintessential experimentation thesis** for the purposes of meeting feat requirements. Additionally, you do not gain an extra cantrip or extra spell slots from your Arcane School; you still gain your initial school spell and curriculum spells.

listCustomSpecials.name: Quintessential Experimentation
listCustomSpecials.description: You do not gain an arcane thesis, though you count as having the quintessential experimentation thesis** for the purposes of meeting feat requirements.

listCustomSpecials.name: Arcanist Scholarhood
listCustomSpecials.description: At 2nd level, and every 2 levels thereafter, you gain an additional skill increase. Additionally, at 3rd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, you gain a skill feat; this feat must be for Arcana, Occultism, Religion, Nature, or a Lore skill.

listCustomSpecials.name: Enhanced Spellcraft
listCustomSpecials.description: As part of your training, you gain access to two focus spells integral to Arcanist spellshaping. At 1st level, you gain the boost spell focus spell, and at 3rd level you gain the elevate spell focus spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: School Spell
listCustomSpecials.description: You gain your school's school spell. Due to limitations within Pathbuilder. this ability grants the hand of the apprentice focus spell to represent that; during play, replace that focus spell with your school's initial school spell.

listCustomSpecials.name: Exploited Exploits
listCustomSpecials.description:
Your ability to utilize exploits surpasses other wizards, in part thanks to your sorcerous nature. You gain a 1st-or-2nd-level wizard exploit feat or spellshape feat of your choice. Additionally, when utilizing exploits, you can expend an arcanist spell slot or a focus point instead of a prepared spell slot; when you do so, you are counted as expending a prepared version of any spell in your spell collection of your choice. If you expend a focus point, you are counted as expending a spell slot whose rank is equal to half your level, rounded up.

Pathbuilder Note: Add the chosen exploit or spellshape feat as a bonus feat

listCustomSpecials.name: Arcanist Spellcasting Adjustments
listCustomSpecials.description:
You learn spells as normal for a wizard, but change your spellcasting from your class as follows.
- You can cast fewer spells each day. Your number of spell slots per day don't advance from 2 to 3 spells at even levels.
- During your daily preparations, you prepare a spell collection rather than preparing spells into each spell slot individually. The number of spells in your spell collection each day equals your level + 1. As normal, you select these spells from your spellbook.
- You can cast any of the spells in your collection by using a spell slot of an appropriate level. For instance, if you were level 1 and had gentle landing and force barrage in your spell collection, you could cast gentle landing twice that day, force barrage twice, or each spell once.

Heightening Spells
Once you gain 2nd-level spells, you can heighten any spell in your spell collection to any level you can cast, similar to a spontaneous spellcaster's signature spells. The only restriction is that you must select at least one 1st-level spell for your collection each time you prepare, ensuring that you can use all your spell slots each day.

Adjudicating Class Feats and Features
Some of your class feats or features might rely on the fact that you prepare spells in spell slots. While some class feats might no longer work or be necessary with the arcanist archetype, in many cases you can make a simple replacement and continue using the class feat. The many class feats simply require replacing “a spell you have prepared” or “a prepared spell” for “a spell in your collection” or “a spell slot.” For example, in Counterspell, you'd replace “a spell you have prepared” in the trigger for “a spell in your collection” and “expend a prepared spell” for “expend a spell slot.” Similarly, in arcane bond, you'd replace “cast one spell you prepared today and already cast” with “cast one spell in your collection you've already cast today.”

listCustomSpecials.name: Reflex Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You've developed a knack for dodging danger. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Expert Spellcaster
listCustomSpecials.description: Extended practice of the arcane has improved your capabilities. Your proficiency ranks for spell attack modifier and spell DC increase to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Magical Fortitude
listCustomSpecials.description: Magical power has improved your body's resiliency. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Perception Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: You remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Expertise
listCustomSpecials.description: Through sheer experience, you've improved your technique with your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons and unarmed attacks increase to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Defensive Robes
listCustomSpecials.description: The flow of magic and your training combine to help you avoid attacks. Your proficiency rank in unarmored defense increases to expert.

listCustomSpecials.name: Weapon Specialization
listCustomSpecials.description: You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal an additional 2 damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you are an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Master Spellcaster
listCustomSpecials.description: You command superlative spellcasting ability. Your proficiency ranks for spell attack modifier and spell DC increase to master.

listCustomSpecials.name: Prodigious Will
listCustomSpecials.description: Your mind is simply too complex and sophisticated to be tampered with. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success at a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

listCustomSpecials.name: Archwizard's Spellcraft
listCustomSpecials.description: You command the most potent arcane magic and can cast a spell of truly incredible power. You gain a single 10th-rank spell slot and can prepare a spell in that slot using wizard spellcasting. Unlike with other spell slots, you can't use 10th-rank slots with abilities that give you more spell slots or that let you cast spells without expending spell slots. You don't gain more 10th-rank spells as you level up, but you can take the Archwizard's Might feat to gain a second slot.

listCustomSpecials.name: Legendary Spellcaster
listCustomSpecials.description: You are a consummate spellcaster, blending both arcane theory and practical spellcraft. Your proficiency ranks for spell attack modifier and spell DC increase to legendary.

listCustomSpecials.name: Elevate Spell
listCustomSpecials.description: At 3rd level you gain the elevate spell focus spell.

listCustomClasses.description:
Sorcerers are blessed with magic in their very blood, calling upon it innately and growing to harness it on instinct. For such mages, the study of magic appears superfluous. “Why should I learn magic, I am magic.” For some ambitious mages, however, the study of magic is a tool to enhance their innate magics to greater and greater heights. Known as Arcanists, these scholars temper their natural magical might with scholastic prowess, honing their abilities to a fine point.

While rarely having access to as much raw power as normal sorcerers or wizards, every spell they cast packs a greater punch as they bend the very laws of magic itself to their will. They are more than just scholars or shapers of magic, they are tinkerers and rule-breakers, treading into grounds that would likely be impassable for other mages and emerging all the stronger. They are reckless explorers of the unknown, but to have one as an ally is to have arcana itself turned to your side.
